text: Moshe therefore says unto Yahoshua the son of Nun, having given him this name, when he sent him to spy out the land, Take the book into your hands and write what Yahweh says, even that the Son of Yahweh, in the last days, will cut off the whole house of Amalek from the roots.

name: Epistle of Barnabas
text: Behold, therefore, again Yahshua, not the son of man but the Son of Elohim, and by a type made manifest in the flesh. Since, therefore, they should one day say that Moshiach is the son of David, David himself prophesies, being in fear and understanding the deceitfulness of sinners, Yahweh said unto my Yahweh, Sit on my right hand until I make your enemies your footstool.

name: Epistle of Barnabas
text: And again Isaiah speaks in this wise, Yahweh said unto Moshiach, my Master, whose right hand I have held, that the Gentiles should hearken before him, and I will break the strength of kings. Behold how David calls Him Yahweh, and does not call him son.480

name: Epistle of Barnabas
text: Let us inquire, therefore, whether this people or the first people inherits, and whether the covenant is unto us or unto them.

name: Epistle of Barnabas
text: Hear, now, what the scripture says concerning the people. But Yitzchak prayed for Rebecca his wife because she was barren, and she conceived. Then Rebecca went forth to inquire of Yahweh, and Yahweh said unto her, Two nations are in your womb, and two peoples are in your bowels, and the one people shall surpass the other, and the elder shall serve the younger.

name: Epistle of Barnabas
text: We ought to understand who Yitzchak was and who Rebecca was, and concerning whom he declared that the one people was greater than the other.

name: Epistle of Barnabas
text: And in another prophecy Yaakov speaks yet more clearly to Yosef his son, saying, Behold Yahweh has not deprived me of your face; bring unto me your sons, that I may bless them.

name: Epistle of Barnabas
text: And he brought unto him Ephrayim and Manasheh, wishing that he should bless Manasheh, because he was the elder. Yosef, therefore, brought him to the right hand of his father Yaakov. But Yaakov saw in spirit a figure of the people that should be hereafter. And what says the Scriptures? And Yaakov crossed his hands, and placed his right hand on the head of Ephrayim, the second and youngest, and blessed him. And Yosef said unto Yaakov, Change your right hand unto the head of Manasheh, because he is my firstborn son. And Yaakov said unto Yosef, I know, my child, I know; but the elder shall serve the younger; but this one also shall be blessed.

name: Epistle of Barnabas
text: Behold in what way he appointed that this people should be the first and heir of the covenant.

name: Epistle of Barnabas
text: If, therefore, it were moreover mentioned through Abraham also, we have the perfecting of our knowledge. What, therefore, says he unto Abraham, when he alone believed, and it was counted unto him for righteousness? Behold I have made you, Abraham, a father of the nations who in uncircumcision believe in Yahweh.

name: Epistle of Barnabas
text: Yes; but let us inquire whether he has given the covenant that he swore unto the fathers that he would give unto the people. Truly he has given it; but they were not worthy to receive it on

name: Epistle of Barnabas
text: For the prophet says, And Moshe was fasting in Mount Sinai forty days and forty nights, that he might receive the covenant which Yahweh has made with his people. And he received from Yahweh the two tables that were written in the spirit with the finger of the hand of Yahweh. And Moshe, when he had received them, was bringing them down to the people for to give them.

name: Epistle of Barnabas
text: And Yahweh said unto Moshe, Moshe, Moshe, get you down quickly, for your people, whom you brought out of the land of Egypt, have disobeyed Torah. And Moshe perceived that they had again made molten images, and he cast the tables from his hands, and the tables of the covenant of Yahweh were broken.

name: Epistle of Barnabas
text: Moshe indeed received them, but the people were not worthy. Hearken you, therefore, how we have received them. Moshe received them being a servant, but Yahweh himself gave unto us to be a people of inheritance, having suffered for our sake.

name: Epistle of Barnabas
text: And He was made manifest, that both they might be made perfect in their sins, and that we, through Him that inherited, might receive the covenant of the Master Yahshua, who, for this purpose was prepared, that by appearing himself and redeeming from darkness our hearts, which were already lavished on death, and given over to the iniquity of deceit, he might place in us the covenant of his people.

name: Epistle of Barnabas
text: For it is written how the Father gives commandment unto him, that having redeemed us from darkness, he should prepare for himself a holy people.

name: Epistle of Barnabas
text: Therefore the prophet says, I, Yahweh your Elohim, have called you in righteousness, and I will hold your hand and make you strong; and I have given you for a covenant to the nation, for a light unto the Gentiles, to open the eyes of the blind, and to bring out of chains those who are bound, and from the house of prison those who sit in darkness. We know from whence we were redeemed.

name: Epistle of Barnabas
text: And again, the prophet says, Behold, I have placed you for a light unto the Gentiles, that you should be for a salvation even unto the end of the earth; thus says Yahweh Elohim who has redeemed you.

name: Epistle of Barnabas
text: And again, the prophet says, The Spirit of Yahweh is upon me, because he has anointed me to preach the gospel unto the poor, he has sent me to heal those that are broken in heart, to preach deliverance to the captives, and the recovery of sight to482 the blind, to tell of the acceptable year of Yahweh, and the day of recompense, to comfort all that mourn.

name: Epistle of Barnabas
text: And, moreover, concerning the Shabbat it is written in the Ten Commandments, in which he spoke on Mount Sinai unto Moshe face to face: Sanctify you the Shabbat of Yahweh with pure hands and a pure heart.

name: Epistle of Barnabas
text: And in another place he says, If My sons shall keep My Shabbat, then will I place My mercy upon them.

name: Epistle of Barnabas
text: He speaks, too, of the Shabbat in the beginning of the creation: And Elohim made in six days the works of his hands, and finished them on the seventh day, and rested in it and sanctified it.

name: Epistle of Barnabas
text: Consider, my children, what signify the words, He finished them in six days. They mean this: that in six thousand years Yahweh will make an end of all things, for a day is with him as a thousand years. And he himself bears witness unto me, saying: Behold this day a day shall be as a thousand years. Therefore, my children, in six days, that is in six thousand years, shall all things be brought to an end.

name: Epistle of Barnabas
text: And the words, He rested on the seventh day, signify this: After that his Son has come, and has caused to cease the time of the wicked one, and has judged the unrighteous, and changed the sun and the moon and the stars, then shall he rest well on the seventh day.

name: Epistle of Barnabas
text: And further he says, you shall sanctify it with pure hands and a pure heart. Who, therefore, can sanctify the day which Yahweh has sanctified, unless he be pure of heart? in all things have we been deceived.

name: Epistle of Barnabas
text: Behold, that then indeed we shall be able to rest well and sanctify; even when we ourselves, having been justified, and having received the promise, when iniquity exists no longer, but all things have been made new by Yahweh, we shall then be able to sanctify it, having been first sanctified ourselves.

name: Epistle of Barnabas
text: And, further, he says unto them, Your new moons and your Shabbatot I cannot endure. See, now, what He means. The Shabbatot that now are, are not acceptable unto Me, but that which I have made is, even that in which, after that I have brought all things to an end, I shall make a beginning of the

name: Epistle of Barnabas
text: Wherefore we also keep the eighth day as a day of gladness, on which also we learned that Yahshua was risen from the dead, and after he had appeared ascended unto heaven.

name: Epistle of Barnabas
text: And I will, moreover, tell you concerning the temple, how these wretched men, being deceived, placed their hopes in the building as if it were the habitation of Elohim, and not on the Elohim who has made them.

name: Epistle of Barnabas
text: For almost after the manner of the Gentiles did they consecrate Him in the temple. But what says Yahweh, making it of no effect? Hearken you: Who has measured out the heaven with his palm, or the earth with the flat of his hand, is it not I? says Yahweh. Heaven is My throne, and earth the footstool of My feet. What house will you build for Me, or what shall be the place of My rest? You have known that their hope was vain.

name: Epistle of Barnabas
text: And, yet further, He says again, Behold those who have destroyed this temple shall rebuild it.

name: Epistle of Barnabas
text: And so is it done, for through their war it has been destroyed by the enemy, and now both they themselves and the servants of their enemies shall rebuild it.

name: Epistle of Barnabas
text: And again it was made manifest how the temple and the people of Israel should be given up to their enemies. For the scripture says, And it shall come to pass in the last days that Yahweh shall deliver up the sheep of his pasture, and their fold and their tower shall he give up to destruction; and it was done according to that which Yahweh had spoken.

name: Epistle of Barnabas
text: Let us inquire, therefore, whether there be any temple of Yahweh. There is; even where he himself has declared that he would make and perfect it. For it is written, And it shall be when the week is completed that the temple of Yahweh shall be built gloriously in the name of Yahweh.

name: Epistle of Barnabas
text: I find, therefore, that there is a temple; how then shall it be built in the name of Yahweh? Learn you. Before that we believed in Elohim the habitation of our heart was corrupt and feeble, as being of a truth a temple built by hands. For it was full of idolatry, and was a habitation of demons, because we did such things as were contrary to Elohim;

name: Epistle of Barnabas
text: But it shall be built in the name of Yahweh. Attend you: that the temple of Yahweh may be built gloriously. But in what484 manner? Learn you: having received the remission of our sins, and having hoped upon the name of Yahweh, we have become new, having been again created entirely. Wherefore Elohim of a truth dwells in us as in an habitation.

name: Epistle of Barnabas
text: How? The word of his faith, the calling of his promise, the wisdom of his ordinances, the commandments of his doctrine, he himself prophesying in us, he himself dwelling in us. To us, who were enslaved by death, he opens the gate of the temple, which is his mouth, and, giving us repentance, leads us into the temple incorruptible.

name: Epistle of Barnabas
text: For he who desires to be saved looks not unto the man, but unto him that dwells in him and speaks in him, wondering that he had never before heard him speaking such words out of his mouth, or even desired to hear. This is the spiritual temple built by Yahweh.

name: Epistle of Barnabas
text: So far as it is possible for me to show you these things with simplicity, my mind and spirit hopes that I have not omitted any of the things that pertain unto salvation;

name: Epistle of Barnabas
text: For if I write unto you concerning the things that are at hand, or the things that will be hereafter, you would not be able to understand them, because they are couched in parables. These things, therefore, are thus.

name: Epistle of Barnabas
text: Let us pass on now to another kind of knowledge and instruction. There are two paths of instruction and authority – the one that of light, and the other that of darkness. But there is a great difference between the two paths. For over the one are appointed as illuminators the angels of Elohim, over the other the angels of Satan;

name: Epistle of Barnabas
text: On the one side is he who is Yahweh from everlasting to everlasting, on the other is the ruler of the world that now lies in wickedness.

name: Epistle of Barnabas
text: Now, the path of life is this: If any one wishes to travel to the appointed place, let him hasten by means of his works. Now, the knowledge of walking in it that is given unto us is of this

name: Epistle of Barnabas
text: You shall love him that made you, you shall fear him that formed you, you shall glorify him that redeemed you from death. You shall be simple in heart, and rich in spirit; you shall not cleave unto those who go in the path of death. You shall hate whatever is not pleasing unto Elohim; you shall hate all hypocrisy; you shall not abandon the commandments of Yahweh;

name: Epistle of Barnabas
text: You shall not exalt yourself; you shall be humble in all things; you shall not take glory unto yourself; you shall not take evil counsel against your neighbour; you shall not take audacity into your spirit.

name: Epistle of Barnabas
text: You shall not commit fornication, you shall not commit adultery. You shall not pollute yourself with mankind: let not the word of Elohim go forth from you in corruption. You shall not accept the person of any to reprove any man for transgression. You shall be gentle, you shall be quiet; you shall tremble at the words that you have heard; you shall not bear malice against your brother;

name: Epistle of Barnabas
text: You shall not doubt whether a thing shall be or not; you shall not take the name of Yahweh in vain. You shall love your neighbor beyond your own spirit; you shall not kill a child by abortion, neither shall you destroy it after it is born. You shall not remove your hand from your son or your daughter, but shalt teach them from their youth the fear of Yahweh.

name: Epistle of Barnabas
text: You shall not covet your neighbor’s goods; you shall not be an extortioner; you shall not cleave with your spirit unto the proud, but you shall have your behavior with the lowly and the just. Receive as blessings the troubles that come unto you, knowing that without Elohim nothing is done.

name: Epistle of Barnabas
text: You shall not be double-minded nor double-tongued, for to be double-tongued is the snare of death. You shall submit yourself to your masters as to the image of Elohim, with shame and fear. You shall not give commands with bitterness to your servant and your handmaid, who hope in the same Elohim as you do, lest, perchance, you cease to fear Elohim, who is over both. For he came not to call men with respect of persons, but to call those whom the Spirit had prepared.

name: Epistle of Barnabas
text: You shall communicate in all things with your neighbour, and shalt not say that things are thine own. For if you be partners in that which is incorruptible, how much more in the things that are corruptible? You shall not be hasty of speech,486 for the mouth is a snare of death. As far as you are able, you shall be pure concerning your spirit.

name: Epistle of Barnabas
text: Be not a stretcher forth of your hand in receiving, and a drawer back of it in giving. You shall love, as the apple of thine eye, every one that speaks unto you the word of Yahweh.

name: Epistle of Barnabas
text: You shall remember the Day of Judgment by night and by day; and you shall seek out every day the persons of the saints.

name: Epistle of Barnabas
text: You shall not doubt to give, nor shall you murmur in giving. Give to every one that asks you, and you shall know who is the good recompenser of the reward. You shall take care of that which you have received, neither adding thereto, nor taking therefrom. You shall hate the evil man unto the end, and shalt judge justly.

name: Epistle of Barnabas
text: You shall not make a schism, but shalt make peace by bringing adversaries together. You shall make confession of your sins. You shall not go unto prayer with an evil conscience. This is the way of life, either labouring by means of the word and proceeding to exhort, and practicing to save the spirit by the word, or you shall work by your hands for the redemption of your sins.

name: Epistle of Barnabas
text: But the path of darkness is crooked and full of cursing, for it is the path of eternal death and punishment, in which way are the things that destroy the spirit. Idolatry, boldness, the pride of power, hypocrisy, double-heartedness, adultery, murder, rape, haughtiness, transgression, deceit, malice, self-will, witchcraft, sorcery, covetousness, want of the fear of Elohim.

name: Epistle of Barnabas
text: Here are those who are persecutors of the good, haters of truth, lovers of lies; those who know not the reward of righteousness, who cleave not to what is good nor unto just judgment; who attend not to the widow and the orphan; who are awake not unto the fear of Elohim, but unto evil; from whom meekness and patience are afar off; who love the things that are vain, who follow after recompense, who pity not the poor, who labour not for him who is in trouble; who are prompt to evil-speaking, who know not him that made them; murderers of children, corruptors of the image of Elohim; who turn away from the poor man and oppress the afflicted; advocates of the rich, unjust judges of the poor, sinners in all

name: Epistle of Barnabas
text: It is therefore right that he who has learned the ordinances of Yahweh, even as many as have been written beforehand, should walk in them. For he who does these things shall be glorified in the kingdom of Elohim, but he who chooses the contrary things shall perish together with his works. On this account is the resurrection; on this account is the retribution.

name: Epistle of Barnabas
text: I ask those who are of high estate among you, if you will receive any friendly advice from me, keep those with you toward whom you may do what is honorable. Fail not in so doing.

name: Epistle of Barnabas
text: The day is at hand in which everything shall perish together with the evil one; Yahweh is nigh at hand, and his reward also.

name: Epistle of Barnabas
text: Again and again do I ask you, be you good Torah-givers over yourselves, be you good advisers of yourselves. Abide faithful counsellors of one another; take out of the midst of you all hypocrisy,

name: Epistle of Barnabas
text: And may Elohim, who rules the whole world, give you wisdom, understanding, science, knowledge of his ordinances, and patience.

name: Epistle of Barnabas
text: And be you taught of Elohim, inquiring what Yahweh seeks of you, and so work that you may be found saved in the Day of Judgment.

name: Epistle of Barnabas
text: But if there is any memory of that which is good, remember me while you practice these things, that both your desire and your watching may turn unto some good.

name: Epistle of Barnabas
text: I beseech you this, asking it as a favor. So long as the good vessel is with you, fail not in any of these things, but seek them out without ceasing, and fulfill all the commandments, for these things are worthy.

name: Epistle of Barnabas
text: Therefore I have been the more anxious to write unto you, so far as I was able, to the end that I might make you glad. Farewell, children of love and peace; the Elohim of glory and of all grace be with your spirit. Amen.488

name: Paul to the Colossians
text: Paul, an apostle of Christ Jesus through the will of God, and Timothy the brother,

name: Paul to the Colossians
text: to the saints that are in Colossae and the faithful brethren in Christ. Grace to you and peace from God our Father.

name: Paul to the Colossians
text: We thank God the Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, praying always for you,

name: Paul to the Colossians
text: since we heard of your faith in Christ Jesus and the love you have for all the saints,

name: Paul to the Colossians
text: because of the hope that is laid up for you in the heavens, of which you heard before in the word of the truth of the gospel,

name: Paul to the Colossians
text: which is present among you, as also in all the world, and is bringing forth fruit and increasing as also among you, from the day you heard and knew the grace of God in truth:

name: Paul to the Colossians
text: as you learned from Epaphras, our beloved fellow-servant, who is faithful in behalf of you, a minister of Christ,

name: Paul to the Colossians
text: who also made known to us your love in the Spirit.

name: Paul to the Colossians
text: Wherefore we also, from the day we heard, cease not to pray for you and to ask that you may be filled with the knowledge of his will in all wisdom and spiritual understanding,

name: Paul to the Colossians
text: so that you walk in a manner worthy of the Lord, to all pleasing, in every good work bringing forth fruit and increasing in the knowledge of God,

name: Paul to the Colossians
text: in all power made powerful according to the might of his glory for all patience and longsuffering, with joy,

name: Paul to the Colossians
text: giving thanks to the Father who made us fit for the portion of the inheritance of the saints in light,

name: Paul to the Colossians
text: who delivered us from the authority of darkness and translated us into the kingdom of the Son of his love,

name: Paul to the Colossians
text: in whom we have redemption, the remission of sins,

name: Paul to the Colossians
text: who is the image of the invisible God, the firstborn of every creature,

name: Paul to the Colossians
text: for in him were all things created that are in the heavens and that are on the earth, visible and invisible, whether thrones or lordships, or principalities or authorities: all things have been created through him and for him,

name: Paul to the Colossians
text: and he is before all things, and all things in him consist;

name: Paul to the Colossians
text: and he is the head of the body, and the church: who is the beginning, the firstborn from the dead, that he himself might become in all things pre-eminent;

name: Paul to the Colossians
text: and through him to reconcile all things to himself, having made peace through the blood of his cross, through him, whether things on the earth or things in the heavens;

name: Paul to the Colossians
text: and you being formerly alienated and enemies in mind in the wicked works, now, however, he has reconciled

name: Paul to the Colossians
text: in the body of his flesh through death, to present you holy and without fault and blameless in his presence;

name: Paul to the Colossians

name: Paul to the Colossians
text: Now I rejoice in sufferings for you, and, in your stead, I fill up that which remains of the afflictions of Christ in my flesh for his body’s sake, which is the church,

name: Paul to the Colossians
text: of which I became a minister according to the dispensation of God, which was given to me for you to fulfil the word of God,

name: Paul to the Colossians
text: the mystery that having been hid from the ages and from the generations, now, however, has been made manifest to his saints,

name: Paul to the Colossians
text: to whom God wished to make known what is the riches of the glory of this mystery among the Gentiles, which is Christ in you, the hope of glory,

name: Paul to the Colossians
text: whom we announce, admonishing every man and teaching every man in all wisdom, that we may present every man perfect in Christ;

name: Paul to the Colossians
text: for which I also labor, striving according to his energy that is active in me in power.

name: Paul to the Colossians
text: For I wish you to know how great a conflict I have for you and those in Laodicea and as many as have not seen my face in the flesh,

name: Paul to the Colossians
text: that their hearts may be comforted, they being knit together in love, and for all the riches of the full assurance of understanding, for the acknowledgment of the mystery of God,

name: Paul to the Colossians
text: in which are laid up all the treasures of wisdom and of knowledge.

name: Paul to the Colossians
text: But this I say , that no one may beguile you with persuasive words.

name: Paul to the Colossians
text: For though in the flesh I am absent, yet in the spirit I am with you, rejoicing and I beholding your order and the steadfastness of your faith in Christ.

name: Paul to the Colossians
text: As therefore you received Christ Jesus the Lord, in him walk,

name: Paul to the Colossians
text: rooted and builded up in him and strengthened in the faith as you were taught, abounding in it in thanksgiving.

name: Paul to the Colossians
text: Take care that there shall be no one that leads you astray through philosophy and vain deceit, according to the tradition of men, according to the rudiments of the world, and not according to Christ,

name: Paul to the Colossians
text: for in him dwells all the fulness of the Godhead bodily,358

name: Paul to the Colossians
text: and you are complete in him, who is the head of all principality and authority,

name: Paul to the Colossians
text: in whom you were also circumcised with a circumcision made without hands, in the putting off of the body of the flesh, in the circumcision of Christ,

name: Paul to the Colossians
text: having been buried with him in baptism, in which you were also raised with him through faith in the energy of God who raised him from the dead;

name: Paul to the Colossians
text: and you being dead in the offenses and the uncircumcision of your flesh, he made alive together with him, having forgiven us all offenses;

name: Paul to the Colossians
text: having blotted out the handwriting in ordinances that was against us, which was opposed to us, he also took it out of the midst, having nailed it to the cross:

name: Paul to the Colossians
text: after spoiling principalities and authorities, he made a show of them openly, having triumphed over them in it.

name: Paul to the Colossians
text: Let no one therefore judge you in eating or in drinking or in respect of a feast or of a new moon or of sabbaths,

name: Paul to the Colossians
text: which are a shadow of things to come, but the body of Christ is the substance.

name: Paul to the Colossians
text: Let no one deprive you of your reward by delighting in humility and worship of angels, intruding into those things which he has not seen, vainly puffed up by the mind of his flesh,

name: Paul to the Colossians
text: and not holding the head, from whom all the body, through joints and bands, having nourishment, ministered and being knit together, increases with the increase of God.

name: Paul to the Colossians
text: If you die with Christ from the rudiments of the world, why as living in the world are you subject to dogmas, —

name: Paul to the Colossians
text: Touch not, neither taste nor handle, —

name: Paul to the Colossians
text: which things are all to perish in the using, according to the commandments and teachings of men.

name: Paul to the Colossians
text: And these have indeed a show of wisdom in will-worship and humility and austerity of the body, not in any honor for the satisfying of the flesh.

name: Paul to the Colossians
text: If then you were raised with Christ, seek the things that are above, where Christ is sitting at the right hand of God:

name: Paul to the Colossians
text: think of things that are above, not of things that are on the earth.

name: Paul to the Colossians
text: For you died, and your life has been hid with Christ in God:

name: Paul to the Colossians
text: when Christ, our life, shall be made manifest, then shall you also be

name: Paul to the Colossians
text: Put to death therefore your members that are on the earth, lewdness, uncleanness, passion, evil desire, and covetousness, which is idolatry;

name: Paul to the Colossians
text: because of which things comes the wrath of God;

name: Paul to the Colossians
text: in which you also walked formerly when you lived in them;

name: Paul to the Colossians
text: but now do you also put off all these, anger, wrath, malice, blasphemy, filthy speech out of your mouth:

name: Paul to the Colossians
text: lie not one to another, as you have put off the old man with his deeds,

name: Paul to the Colossians
text: and have put on the new, that is renewed for knowledge according to the image of him that created him,

name: Paul to the Colossians
text: where there is not Greek and Jew, circumcision and uncircumcision, barbarian, Scythian, bondman, freeman, but Christ is all and in all.

name: Paul to the Colossians
text: Put on therefore, as the elect of God, holy and beloved, bowels of mercy, kindness, lowliness of mind, meekness, longsuffering,

name: Paul to the Colossians
text: bearing with one another and forgiving one another, if any one have a quarrel with any, as Christ also forgave you, so also do you;

name: Paul to the Colossians
text: but over all these put on love, which is the bond of perfectness.

name: Paul to the Colossians
text: And let the peace of Christ reign in your hearts, to which you were also called in one body, and become thankful.

name: Paul to the Colossians
text: Let the word of Christ dwell in you richly, in all wisdom teaching and admonishing each other, in psalms, hymns, spiritual songs, in gratitude singing in your heart to God;

name: Paul to the Colossians
text: and everything whatever you do in word or in deed, do all in the name of the Lord Jesus, giving thanks to God the Father through him.

name: Paul to the Colossians
text: Wives, be subject to your husbands, as it is fit in the Lord.

name: Paul to the Colossians
text: Husbands, love your wives, and be not bitter against them.

name: Paul to the Colossians
text: Children, obey your parents in all things; for this is well-pleasing in the Lord.

name: Paul to the Colossians
text: Fathers, provoke not your children to anger, lest they be discouraged.

name: Paul to the Colossians
text: Servants, obey in all things your masters according to the flesh, not in eye-service, as pleasing men, but in simplicity of heart, fearing the Lord.

name: Paul to the Colossians
text: Whatever you do, work from the soul as to the Lord, and not to men,

name: Paul to the Colossians
text: knowing that from the Lord you shall receive the reward of the inheritance. Serve the Lord Christ;

name: Paul to the Colossians
text: for he that does wrong shall receive for the wrong that he has done, and there is no respect of persons.360

name: Paul to the Colossians
text: Masters, give to your servants that which is just and equal, knowing that you also have a Master in heaven,

name: Paul to the Colossians
text: Persevere in prayer, watching in it in thanksgiving,

name: Paul to the Colossians
text: praying at the same time also for us, that God would open for us a door of the word to speak the mystery of Christ, for which I also have been bound,

name: Paul to the Colossians
text: that I may make it manifest as I ought to speak.

name: Paul to the Colossians
text: Walk in wisdom toward those who are without, redeeming the time.

name: Paul to the Colossians
text: Let your speech be always in grace, seasoned with salt, that you may know of how you ought to answer every one.

name: Paul to the Colossians
text: All things that concern me will Tychicus, the beloved brother and to faithful minister and fellow-servant in the Lord, make known to you,

name: Paul to the Colossians
text: whom I sent to you for this very purpose, that he may know your state, and comfort your hearts,

name: Paul to the Colossians
text: and Onesimus, the faithful and beloved brother, who is of you; they will make known all things here.

name: Paul to the Colossians
text: Aristarchus, my fellow-prisoner, salutes you, and so does Mark, the nephew of Barnabas, concerning whom you received commandments, —if he come to you, receive him,—

name: Paul to the Colossians
text: and Jesus who is called Justus, who are of the circumcision: these only are my fellow-workers for the kingdom of God, who have been a comfort to me.

name: Paul to the Colossians
text: Epaphras, who is of you, salutes you, a servant of Christ Jesus, always striving for you in prayers, that you may stand perfect and complete in all the will of God.

name: Paul to the Colossians
text: For I testify for him that he has great travail for you and for those in Laodicea and those in Hierapolis.

name: Paul to the Colossians
text: Luke, the beloved physician, salutes you, and Demas.

name: Paul to the Colossians
text: Salute the brethren in Laodicea, and Nymphas, and the church that is in his house.

name: Paul to the Colossians
text: And when the epistle has been read among you, cause that it be read also in the church of the Laodiceans, and see that you also read that from Laodicea.

name: Paul to the Colossians
text: And say to Archippus: Take heed to the ministry which thou hast received in the Lord, that thou fulfil it.

name: Paul to the Colossians
text: The salutation of Paul with my own hand. Remember my bonds.

name: Didachē or Teaching of the Twelve
text: There are two ways, one of life and one of death, and there is a great difference between the two ways.

name: Didachē or Teaching of the Twelve
text: The way of life is this. First of all, thou shalt love the God that made thee; secondly, Thy neighbor as thyself. And all things whatsoever thou wouldst not have befall thyself, neither do thou unto another.

name: Didachē or Teaching of the Twelve
text: Now of these words the doctrine is this. Bless them that curse you, and pray for your enemies and fast for them that persecute you; for what thank is it, if ye love them that love you? Do not even the Gentiles the same? But do ye love them that hate you that hate you, and ye shall not have an enemy.

name: Didachē or Teaching of the Twelve
text: Abstain thou from fleshly and bodily lusts. If any man give thee a blow on thy right cheek, turn to him the other also, and thou shalt be perfect; If a man impress thee to go with him one mile, go with him twain; if a man take away thy cloak, give him thy coat also; if a man take away from thee that which is thy own, ask it not back, for neither art thou able.

name: Didachē or Teaching of the Twelve
text: To every man that asketh of thee give, and ask not back for the Father desireth that gifts be given to all from His own bounties. Blessed is he that giveth according to the commandment; for he is guiltless. Woe to him that receiveth; for, if a man receiveth having need, he is guiltless; but he that hath no need shall give satisfaction why and wherefore he received and being put in confinement he shall be examined concerning the deeds that he hath done, and he shall not come out thence until he hath given back the last farthing.

name: Didachē or Teaching of the Twelve
text: Yea, as touching this also it is said; Let thine alms sweat into thine hands, until thou have learnt to whom to give.

name: Didachē or Teaching of the Twelve
text: And this is the second commandment of the teaching.

name: Didachē or Teaching of the Twelve
text: Thou shalt do no murder, thou shalt not commit adultery, thou shalt not corrupt boys, thou shalt not commit fornication, thou shalt not steal, thou shalt not deal in magic, thou shalt do no sorcery, thou shalt not murder a child by abortion nor kill them when born, thou shalt not covet thy neighbors goods,

name: Didachē or Teaching of the Twelve
text: thou shalt not perjure thyself, thou shalt not bear false witness, thou shalt not speak evil, thou shalt not cherish a grudge,

name: Didachē or Teaching of the Twelve
text: thou shalt not be double-minded nor double-tongued; for the double tongue is a snare of death.

name: Didachē or Teaching of the Twelve
text: Thou shalt not be avaricious nor a plunderer nor a hypocrite nor ill-tempered nor proud. Thou shalt not entertain an evil design against thy neighbor.

name: Didachē or Teaching of the Twelve
text: Thou shalt not hate any man but some thou shalt reprove, and for others thou shalt pray, and others thou shalt love more than thy life.

name: Didachē or Teaching of the Twelve
text: My child, flee from every evil and everything that resembleth it.

name: Didachē or Teaching of the Twelve
text: Be not angry, for anger leadeth to murder, nor jealous nor contentious nor wrathful; for of all these things murders are engendered.

name: Didachē or Teaching of the Twelve
text: My child, be not lustful, for lust leadeth to fornication, neither foul- speaking neither with uplifted eyes; for of all these things adulteries are engendered.

name: Didachē or Teaching of the Twelve
text: My child, be no dealer in omens, since it leads to idolatry, nor an enchanter nor an astrologer nor a magician, neither be willing to look at them; for from all these things idolatry is engendered.

name: Didachē or Teaching of the Twelve
text: My child, be not a liar, since lying leads to theft, neither avaricious neither vainglorious; for from all these things thefts are engendered.

name: Didachē or Teaching of the Twelve
text: My child, be not a murmurer, since it leadeth to blasphemy, neither self-willed neither a thinker of evil thoughts; for from all these things blasphemies are engendered.

name: Didachē or Teaching of the Twelve
text: But be meek, since the meek shall inherit the earth.

name: Didachē or Teaching of the Twelve
text: Be long-suffering and pitiful and guileless and quiet and kindly and always fearing the words which thou hast heard.

name: Didachē or Teaching of the Twelve
text: Thou shalt not exalt thyself, neither shalt thou admit boldness into thy soul. Thy soul shall not cleave together with the lofty, but with the righteous and humble shalt thou walk.

name: Didachē or Teaching of the Twelve
text: The accidents that befall thee thou shalt receive as good, knowing that nothing is done without God.

name: Didachē or Teaching of the Twelve
text: My child, thou shalt remember him that speaketh unto thee the word of God night and day, and shalt honor him as the Lord; for whencesoever the Lordship speaketh, there is the Lord.

name: Didachē or Teaching of the Twelve
text: Moreover thou shalt seek out day by day the persons of the saints, that thou mayest find rest in their words.

name: Didachē or Teaching of the Twelve
text: Thou shalt not make a schism, but thou shalt pacify them that contend; thou shalt judge righteously, thou shalt not make a difference in a person to reprove him for transgressions.

name: Didachē or Teaching of the Twelve
text: Thou shalt not doubt whether a thing shall be or not be.

name: Didachē or Teaching of the Twelve
text: Be not thou found holding out thy hands to receive, but drawing them in as to giving.590

name: Didachē or Teaching of the Twelve
text: If thou hast ought passing through thy hands, thou shalt give a ransom for thy sins.

name: Didachē or Teaching of the Twelve
text: Thou shalt not hesitate to give, neither shalt thou murmur when giving; for thou shalt know who is the good paymaster of thy reward.

name: Didachē or Teaching of the Twelve
text: Thou shalt not turn away from him that is in want, but shalt make thy brother partaker in all things, and shalt not say that anything is thy own. For if ye are fellow-partakers in that which is imperishable, how much rather in the things which are perishable?

name: Didachē or Teaching of the Twelve
text: Thou shalt not withhold thy hand from thy son or from thy daughter, but from their youth thou shalt teach them the fear of God.

name: Didachē or Teaching of the Twelve
text: Thou shalt not command thy bondservant or thine handmaid in thy bitterness who trust in the same God as thyself, lest haply they should cease to fear the God who is over both of you; for He cometh, not to call men with respect of persons, but He cometh to those whom the Spirit hath prepared.

name: Didachē or Teaching of the Twelve
text: But ye, servants, shall be subject unto your masters, as to a type of God, in shame and fear.

name: Didachē or Teaching of the Twelve
text: Thou shalt hate all hypocrisy, and everything that is not pleasing to the Lord.

name: Didachē or Teaching of the Twelve
text: Thou shalt never forsake the commandments of the Lord but shalt keep those things which thou hast received, neither adding to them nor taking away from them.

name: Didachē or Teaching of the Twelve
text: In church thou shalt confess thy transgressions, and shalt not betake thyself to prayer with an evil conscience. This is the way of life.

name: Didachē or Teaching of the Twelve
text: But the way of death is this. First of all, it is evil and full of a curse; murders, adulteries, lusts, fornications, thefts, idolatries, magical arts, witchcrafts, plunderings, false witnessings, hypocrisies, doubleness of heart, treachery, pride, malice, stubbornness, covetousness, foul--speaking, jealousy, boldness, exaltation, boastfulness;

name: Didachē or Teaching of the Twelve
text: Persecutors of good men, hating truth, loving a lie, not perceiving the reward of righteousness, not cleaving to the good nor to righteous judgment, wakeful not for that which is good but for that which is evil-from whom gentleness and forbearance stand aloof; loving vain things, pursuing a recompense, not pitying the poor man, not toiling for him that is oppressed with toil, not recognizing Him that made them, murderers of children, corrupters of the creatures of God, turning away from him that is in want, oppressing him that is afflicted, advocates of the wealthy, unjust judges of the poor, altogether sinful. May ye be delivered, my children, from all these

name: Didachē or Teaching of the Twelve
text: See lest any man lead you astray from this way of righteousness, for he teacheth thee apart from God.

name: Didachē or Teaching of the Twelve
text: For if thou art able to bear the whole yoke of the Lord, thou shalt be perfect; but if thou art not able, do that which thou art able.

name: Didachē or Teaching of the Twelve
text: But concerning eating, bear that which thou art able; yet abstain by all means from meat sacrificed to idols; for it is the worship of dead gods.

name: Didachē or Teaching of the Twelve
text: But concerning baptism, thus shall ye baptize. Having first recited all these things, baptize in the name of the Father and of the Son and of the Holy Spirit in living (running) water.

name: Didachē or Teaching of the Twelve
text: But if thou hast not living water, then baptize in other water; and if thou art not able in cold, then in warm.

name: Didachē or Teaching of the Twelve
text: But if thou hast neither, then pour water on the head thrice in the name of the Father and of the Son and of the Holy Spirit.

name: Didachē or Teaching of the Twelve
text: But before the baptism let him that baptizeth and him that is baptized fast, and any others also who are able; and thou shalt order him that is baptized to fast a day or two before.

name: Didachē or Teaching of the Twelve
text: And let not your fastings be with the hypocrites, for they fast on the second and the fifth day of the week; but do ye keep your fast on the fourth and on the preparation (the sixth) day.

name: Didachē or Teaching of the Twelve
text: Neither pray ye as the hypocrites, but as the Lord commanded in His Gospel, thus pray ye: Our Father, which art in heaven, hallowed be Thy name; Thy kingdom come; Thy will be done, as in heaven, so also on earth; give us this day our daily bread; and forgive us our debt, as we forgive our debtors; and lead us not into temptation, but deliver us from the evil one; for Thine is the power and the glory for ever and ever.

name: Didachē or Teaching of the Twelve
text: Three times in the day pray ye so.

name: Didachē or Teaching of the Twelve
text: But as touching the eucharistic thanksgiving give ye thanks thus.

name: Didachē or Teaching of the Twelve
text: First, as regards the cup: We give Thee thanks, O our Father, for the holy vine of Thy son David, which Thou madest known unto us through Thy Son Jesus; Thine is the glory for ever and ever.

name: Didachē or Teaching of the Twelve
text: Then as regarding the broken bread: We give Thee thanks, O our Father, for the life and knowledge which Thou didst make known unto us through Thy Son Jesus; Thine is the glory for ever and ever.

name: Didachē or Teaching of the Twelve
text: As this broken bread was scattered upon the mountains and being gathered together became one, so may Thy Church be gathered592 together from the ends of the earth into Thy kingdom; for Thine is the glory and the power through Jesus Christ for ever and ever.

name: Didachē or Teaching of the Twelve
text: But let no one eat or drink of this eucharistic thanksgiving, but they that have been baptized into the name of the Lord; for concerning this also the Lord hath said: Give not that which is holy to the dogs.

name: Didachē or Teaching of the Twelve
text: And after ye are satisfied thus give ye thanks:

name: Didachē or Teaching of the Twelve
text: We give Thee thanks, Holy Father, for Thy holy name, which Thou hast made to tabernacle in our hearts, and for the knowledge and faith and immortality, which Thou hast made known unto us through Thy Son Jesus; Thine is the glory for ever and ever.

name: Didachē or Teaching of the Twelve
text: Thou, Almighty Master, didst create all things for Thy name’s sake, and didst give food and drink unto men for enjoyment, that they might render thanks to Thee; but didst bestow upon us spiritual food and drink and eternal life through Thy Son.

name: Didachē or Teaching of the Twelve
text: Before all things we give Thee thanks that Thou art powerful; Thine is the glory for ever and ever.

name: Didachē or Teaching of the Twelve
text: Remember, Lord, Thy Church to deliver it from all evil and to perfect it in Thy love; and gather it together from the four winds – even the Church which has been sanctified – into Thy kingdom which Thou hast prepared for it; for Thine is the power and the glory for ever and ever.

name: Didachē or Teaching of the Twelve
text: May grace come and may this world pass away. Hosanna to the God of David. If any man is holy, let him come; if any man is not, let him repent. Maran Atha. Amen.

name: Didachē or Teaching of the Twelve
text: But permit the prophets to offer thanksgiving as much as they desire.

name: Didachē or Teaching of the Twelve
text: Whosoever therefore shall come and teach you all these things that have been said before, receive him;

name: Didachē or Teaching of the Twelve
text: but if the teacher himself be perverted and teach a different doctrine to the destruction thereof, hear him not; but if to the increase of righteousness and the knowledge of the Lord, receive him as the Lord.

name: Didachē or Teaching of the Twelve
text: But concerning the apostles and prophets, so do ye according to the ordinance of the Gospel.

name: Didachē or Teaching of the Twelve
text: Let every apostle, when he cometh to you, be received as the Lord;

name: Didachē or Teaching of the Twelve
text: but he shall not abide more than a single day, or if there be need, a second likewise; but if he abide three days, he is a false prophet.

name: Didachē or Teaching of the Twelve
text: And when he departeth let the apostle receive nothing save bread,

name: Didachē or Teaching of the Twelve
text: And any prophet speaking in the Spirit ye shall not try neither discern; for every sin shall be forgiven, but this sin shall not be forgiven.

name: Didachē or Teaching of the Twelve
text: Yet not every one that speaketh in the Spirit is a prophet, but only if he have the ways of the Lord. From his ways therefore the false prophet and the prophet shall be recognized.

name: Didachē or Teaching of the Twelve
text: And no prophet when he ordereth a table in the Spirit shall eat of it; otherwise he is a false prophet.

name: Didachē or Teaching of the Twelve
text: And every prophet teaching the truth, if he doeth not what he teacheth, is a false prophet.

name: Didachē or Teaching of the Twelve
text: And every prophet approved and found true, if he doeth ought as an outward mystery typical of the Church, and yet teacheth you not to do all that he himself doeth, shall not be judged before you; he hath his judgment in the presence of God; for in like manner also did the prophets of old time.

name: Didachē or Teaching of the Twelve
text: And whosoever shall say in the Spirit, Give me silver or anything else, ye shall not listen to him; but if he tell you to give on behalf of others that are in want, let no man judge him.

name: Didachē or Teaching of the Twelve
text: But let every one that cometh in the name of the Lord be received; and then when ye have tested him ye shall know him, for ye shall have understanding on the right hand and on the left.

name: Didachē or Teaching of the Twelve
text: If the comer is a traveler, assist him, so far as ye are able; but he shall not stay with you more than two or three days, if it be necessary.

name: Didachē or Teaching of the Twelve
text: But if he wishes to settle with you, being a craftsman, let him work for and eat his bread.

name: Didachē or Teaching of the Twelve
text: But if he has no craft, according to your wisdom provide how he shall live as a Christian among you, but not in idleness.

name: Didachē or Teaching of the Twelve
text: If he will not do this, he is trafficking upon Christ. Beware of such men.

name: Didachē or Teaching of the Twelve
text: But every time prophet desiring to settle among you is worthy of his food.

name: Didachē or Teaching of the Twelve
text: In like manner a true teacher is also worthy, like the workman, of his food.

name: Didachē or Teaching of the Twelve
text: Every firstfruit then of the produce of the wine-vat and of the threshing-floor, of thy oxen and of thy sheep, thou shalt take and give as the firstfruit to the prophets; for they are your chief-priests.

name: Didachē or Teaching of the Twelve
text: But if ye have not a prophet, give them to the poor.

name: Didachē or Teaching of the Twelve
text: If thou makest bread, take the firstfruit and give according to the commandment.594

name: Didachē or Teaching of the Twelve
text: In like manner, when thou openest a jar of wine or of oil, take the firstfruit and give to the prophets;

name: Didachē or Teaching of the Twelve
text: yea and of money and raiment and every possession take the firstfruit, as shall seem good to thee, and give according to the commandment.

name: Didachē or Teaching of the Twelve
text: And on the Lord’s own day gather yourselves together and break bread and give thanks, first confessing your transgressions, that your sacrifice may be pure.

name: Didachē or Teaching of the Twelve
text: And let no man, having his dispute with his fellow, join your assembly until they have been reconciled, that your sacrifice may not be defiled;

name: Didachē or Teaching of the Twelve
text: for this sacrifice it is that was spoken of by the Lord; In every place and at every time offer me a pure sacrifice; for I am a great king, saith the Lord, and My name is wonderful among the nations.

name: Didachē or Teaching of the Twelve
text: Appoint for yourselves therefore bishops and deacons worthy of the Lord, men who are meek and not lovers of money, and true and approved; for unto you they also perform the service of the prophets and teachers.

name: Didachē or Teaching of the Twelve
text: Therefore despise them not; for they are your honorable men along with the prophets and teachers.

name: Didachē or Teaching of the Twelve
text: And reprove one another, not in anger but in peace, as ye find in the Gospel; and let no one speak to any that has gone wrong towards his neighbor, neither let him hear a word from you, until he repent.

name: Didachē or Teaching of the Twelve
text: But your prayers and your almsgiving and all your deeds so do ye as ye find it in the Gospel of our Lord.

name: Didachē or Teaching of the Twelve
text: Be watchful for your life; let your lamps not be quenched and your loins not ungirdled, but be ye ready; for ye know not the hour the hour in which our Lord cometh.

name: Didachē or Teaching of the Twelve
text: And ye shall gather yourselves together frequently, seeking what is fitting for your souls; for the whole time of your faith shall not profit you, if ye be not perfected at the last season.

name: Didachē or Teaching of the Twelve
text: For in the last days the false prophets and corrupters shall be multiplied, and the sheep shall be turned into wolves, and love shall be turned into hate.

name: Didachē or Teaching of the Twelve
text: For as lawlessness increaseth, they shall hate one another and shall persecute and betray. And then the world-deceiver shall appear as a delivered into his hands; and he shall do unholy things, which have never been since the world began.
