name: Paul to the Galatians
text: O foolish Galatians, who has bewitched you, before whose eyes Jesus Christ has been set forth among you as crucified?

name: Paul to the Galatians
text: This only I wish to learn of you, by works of law did you receive the Spirit, or by the message of faith?

name: Paul to the Galatians
text: Are you so foolish? Haying begun in spirit, are you now made perfect in flesh?

name: Paul to the Galatians
text: Have you suffered so many things in vain? If indeed it be yet in vain.

name: Paul to the Galatians
text: He then that supplies to you the Spirit, and works mighty deeds among you, is it by works of law or by the message of faith?

name: Paul to the Galatians
text: As Abraham believed God, and it was counted to him for righteousness.

name: Paul to the Galatians
text: Know you then that they that are of faith, these are sons of Abraham.

name: Paul to the Galatians
text: But the Scripture, foreseeing that God would justify the Gentiles by faith, preached beforehand the gospel to Abraham: In thee shall all the nations be blessed.

name: Paul to the Galatians
text: So then they that are of faith are blessed with believing Abraham.

name: Paul to the Galatians
text: For as many as are of works of law, are under a curse; for it is written: Cursed is every one that abides not in all things that are written in the book of the law, to do them.

name: Paul to the Galatians
text: But that in law no one is justified with God is evident; because the just by faith shall live;

name: Paul to the Galatians
text: Christ has bought us off from the curse of the law, having become a curse for us; for it is written: Cursed is every one that hangs on a tree;

name: Paul to the Galatians
text: that upon the Gentiles the blessing of Abraham might come in Christ Jesus, that we might receive the promise of the Spirit through faith.

name: Paul to the Galatians
text: Brethren, I speak as a man. No one sets aside or adds to a covenant when confirmed, though it be a man’s.

name: Paul to the Galatians
text: Now to Abraham were the promises spoken and to his offspring. It does not say: And to offsprings, as of many, but as of one: And to thy offspring, who is Christ.

name: Paul to the Galatians
text: But this I say: A covenant confirmed by God, the law which was four hundred and thirty years after does not annul, so as to make the promise of no effect.

name: Paul to the Galatians
text: For if the inheritance is of law, it is no longer of promise; but God has given it as a favor to Abraham through promise.

name: Paul to the Galatians
text: Why then the law? Because of transgressions was it added, till the offspring should come, to whom the promise has been made, having been appointed through angels, in the hand of a mediator.

name: Paul to the Galatians
text: Now there is no mediator of one, but God is one.

name: Paul to the Galatians
text: Is the law then against the promises of God? It cannot be. For if a law had been given that could have made alive, verily righteousness would have been by law:

name: Paul to the Galatians
text: but the Scripture has shut up all under sin, that the promise by faith of Jesus Christ might be given to those that believe.

name: Paul to the Galatians
text: But before faith came we were kept in guard under law, shut up for the faith that was to be revealed.

name: Paul to the Galatians
text: So, then, the law was our pedagogue* to Christ, that we might be justified by faith; * Pedagogue—a servant that led his master’s children to school.

name: Paul to the Galatians
text: but since faith has come we are no longer under a pedagogue.

name: Paul to the Galatians
text: For you are sons of God through faith in Christ Jesus;

name: Paul to the Galatians
text: for as many of you as were baptized into Christ, put on Christ.

name: Paul to the Galatians
text: There is not Jew, neither Greek; there is not servant, neither freeman; there is not male and female; for you are all one in Christ Jesus.

name: Paul to the Galatians
text: But if you are Christ’s, then are you Abraham’s posterity, heirs according to promise.

name: Paul to the Galatians
text: But I say, as long as the heir is a minor, he differs nothing from a servant, though he is lord of all;338

name: Paul to the Galatians
text: but is under tutors and stewards till the time appointed by the father.

name: Paul to the Galatians
text: So also we, when we were minors, were in bondage under the elements of the world;

name: Paul to the Galatians
text: but when the fulness of the time had come. God sent forth his Son, born of a woman, born under law,

name: Paul to the Galatians
text: that he might buy off those under law, that we might receive the adoption of sons.

name: Paul to the Galatians
text: And because you are sons. God has sent forth the Spirit of his Son into our hearts, crying: Abba, Father.

name: Paul to the Galatians
text: So then thou art no longer a servant, but a son; and if a son, an heir also through God.

name: Paul to the Galatians
text: But then, indeed, not having known God, you were in bondage to them that by nature are not gods:

name: Paul to the Galatians
text: now, however, having known God, rather having been known by God, how turn you again to the weak and poor elements, to which you desire again to be in bondage?

name: Paul to the Galatians
text: You observe days and months and seasons and years.

name: Paul to the Galatians
text: I am afraid of you lest perhaps I have bestowed on you labor in vain.

name: Paul to the Galatians
text: Brethren, I beseech you, become as I am, for I was as you are. You have injured me in nothing;

name: Paul to the Galatians
text: but you know that because of weakness of the flesh I preached to you the gospel formerly,

name: Paul to the Galatians
text: and my trial that is in my flesh you did not despise, neither loathe, but you received me as an angel of God, as Christ Jesus.

name: Paul to the Galatians
text: What, then, was your happiness? for I testify for you that if possible you would have pulled out your eyes and given them to me.

name: Paul to the Galatians
text: So, then, have I become your enemy because I tell you the truth?

name: Paul to the Galatians
text: They are zealous for you, not honorably: yes, they desire to exclude you, that you may be zealous for them.

name: Paul to the Galatians
text: But it is honorable to be zealous in what is honorable, always, and not only when I am present with you.

name: Paul to the Galatians
text: My little children, for whom I again suffer the pains of childbirth till Christ be; formed in you,

name: Paul to the Galatians
text: I was wishing, however, to be, present with you now, and to change my voice, for I am in doubt with regard to you.

name: Paul to the Galatians
text: Tell me, you that desire to be under law, do you not understand the law?

name: Paul to the Galatians
text: for it is written that Abraham had two sons, one by the maidservant and one by the free woman.

name: Paul to the Galatians
text: But the one by the maidservant was born according to the flesh,

name: Paul to the Galatians
text: Which things are allegorized; for these are two covenants, one indeed from Mount Sinai, bringing forth for bondage, which is Hagar.

name: Paul to the Galatians
text: For this Hagar is Mount Sinai in Arabia, and corresponds to the present Jerusalem, for she is in bondage with her children.

name: Paul to the Galatians
text: But the Jerusalem above is free, which is the mother of us all;

name: Paul to the Galatians
text: for it is written: Rejoice, thou barren that bearest not, break forth and cry out, thou that travailest not, for many more are the children of the deserted, than of her that had the husband.

name: Paul to the Galatians
text: But you, brethren, as Isaac, are children of promise.

name: Paul to the Galatians
text: But as then he that was born according to the flesh persecuted him that was born according to the spirit, so also now.

name: Paul to the Galatians
text: But what says the Scripture? Cast out the maidservant and her son; for the son of the maidservant shall not be heir with the son of the free woman.

name: Paul to the Galatians
text: Wherefore, brethren, we are not children of the maidservant, but of the free woman.

name: Paul to the Galatians
text: In the freedom with which Christ has freed us, stand fast, and be not again subject to the yoke of bondage.

name: Paul to the Galatians
text: Behold, I Paul say to you, that if you be circumcised, Christ shall profit you nothing.

name: Paul to the Galatians
text: But I testify again to every man that is circumcised, that he is a debtor to do the whole law.

name: Paul to the Galatians
text: You have withdrawn from Christ, whoever of you are justified in law: you have fallen from grace.

name: Paul to the Galatians
text: For we, through the Spirit, by faith wait for the hope of righteousness.

name: Paul to the Galatians
text: For in Christ Jesus neither circumcision avails anything, nor uncircumcision, but faith working through love.

name: Paul to the Galatians
text: You were running well: who hindered you, that you should not obey the truth?

name: Paul to the Galatians
text: The credulity is not of him that calls you.

name: Paul to the Galatians
text: A little leaven leavens the whole mass.

name: Paul to the Galatians
text: I have confidence in you in the Lord, that you will have no other mind; but he that troubles you shall bear the condemnation, whoever he be.

name: Paul to the Galatians
text: But I, brethren, if I yet preach circumcision, why am I yet persecuted? Then has the offense of the cross ceased.

name: Paul to the Galatians
text: I would that they that subvert you would even cut themselves off.340

name: Paul to the Galatians
text: For you, brethren, were called for freedom: only use not your freedom as an occasion for the flesh, but through love serve one another.

name: Paul to the Galatians
text: For the whole law has been fulfilled in one word, in this: Thou shalt love thy neighbor as thyself.

name: Paul to the Galatians
text: But if you bite and devour one another, see that you be not destroyed one by another.

name: Paul to the Galatians
text: But, I say, walk in the Spirit and you shall not fulfill the desire of the flesh.

name: Paul to the Galatians
text: For the flesh has desires against the Spirit, and the Spirit against the flesh; and these array themselves one against the other, so that you can not do the things that you would.

name: Paul to the Galatians
text: But if you are led by the Spirit, you are not under law.

name: Paul to the Galatians
text: But the works of the flesh are manifest, which are lewdness, uncleanness, wantonness,

name: Paul to the Galatians
text: idolatry, witchcraft, enmities, strife, emulation, wraths, contentions, divisions, heresies,

name: Paul to the Galatians
text: envyings, drunkenness, revellings, and things like these; as to which I foretell you as I have also said before, that those that do such things shall not inherit the kingdom of God.

name: Paul to the Galatians
text: But the fruit of the Spirit is love, joy, peace, longsuffering, gentleness, goodness, faith,

name: Paul to the Galatians
text: meekness, self-control: against such things there is no law.

name: Paul to the Galatians
text: But they that are Christ Jesus’ have crucified the flesh with the passions and the desires.

name: Paul to the Galatians
text: If we live in the Spirit, in the Spirit also let us walk.

name: Paul to the Galatians
text: Become not vainglorious, provoking one another, envying one another.

name: Paul to the Galatians
text: Brethren, if a man shall have been also overtaken in any fault, do you that are spiritual restore such a one in the spirit of meekness, considering thyself, lest thou also be tempted.

name: Paul to the Galatians
text: Bear the griefs of one another, and so fulfil the law of Christ.

name: Paul to the Galatians
text: For if any one thinks himself to be something, being nothing, he deceives himself. But let each one prove his own work, and then shall he have cause of boasting in regard to himself, and not in regard to another:

name: Paul to the Galatians
text: for each one shall bear his own burden.

name: Paul to the Galatians
text: But let him that is instructed in the word communicate to him that instructs, in all good things.

name: Paul to the Galatians
text: Be not deceived, God is not mocked. For whatever a man sows, this

name: Paul to the Galatians
text: for he that sows for his own flesh shall of the flesh reap corruption, but he that sows for the Spirit shall of the Spirit reap life eternal.

name: Paul to the Galatians
text: But let us not be weary in doing that which is beautiful; for in the proper time we shall reap, if we faint not.

name: Paul to the Galatians
text: Therefore, as we I have opportunity, let us do good to all, but especially to those of the household of faith.

name: Paul to the Galatians
text: See in how large letters* I have written to you with my own hand. * The form of the Greek requires us to understand that Paul wrote in large letters for emphasis, as we sometimes use capitals.

name: Paul to the Galatians
text: As many as wish to make a fair show in the flesh, these compel you to be circumcised, only that they are not persecuted for the cross of Christ.

name: Paul to the Galatians
text: For neither do they themselves that are circumcised keep the law, but they wish you to be circumcised that they may glory in your flesh.

name: Paul to the Galatians
text: But may it not happen to me that I glory except in the cross of our Lord Jesus Christ, through whom the world has been crucified to me, and I to the world;

name: Paul to the Galatians
text: for neither circumcision is anything, nor uncircumcision, but a new creature.

name: Paul to the Galatians
text: And as many as walk by this rule, peace upon them and mercy, and upon the Israel of God.

name: Paul to the Galatians
text: Finally, let no one give me trouble; for I bear in my body the marks of Jesus.

name: Paul to the Galatians
text: The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with your spirit, brethren: amen.342

name: Epistle of Hebrews
text: God, after having in many parts and many ways spoken in ancient times to the fathers, in the prophets, has in the end of these days spoken to us in his Son,

name: Epistle of Hebrews
text: whom he has appointed heir of all things, through whom also he made the ages,

name: Epistle of Hebrews
text: who, being the effulgence of his glory and the exact image of his substance, bearing onward also all things by the word of his power, when he had through himself made a cleansing of sins sat down at the right hand of the majesty on high,

name: Epistle of Hebrews
text: having become so much superior to angels as the name which he has inherited is more excellent than they.

name: Epistle of Hebrews
text: For to which of the angels said he at any time: Thou art my Son, this day have I begotten thee? and again: I will be to him a Father, and he shall be to me a Son?

name: Epistle of Hebrews
text: And when he shall have brought again the first begotten into the world, he says: And let all the angels of God worship him.

name: Epistle of Hebrews
text: And in respect indeed to angels, he says: Who makes his angels winds, and his ministers a flame of fire.

name: Epistle of Hebrews
text: But with respect to the Son: Thy throne, O God, is forever and ever; and: A scepter of rectitude is the scepter of thy kingdom.

name: Epistle of Hebrews
text: Thou didst love righteousness and hate iniquity: therefore, O God, thy God has anointed thee with the oil of gladness above thy fellows.

name: Epistle of Hebrews
text: And: Thou, Lord, in the beginning didst lay the foundation of the earth, and the heavens are the works of thy hands:

name: Epistle of Hebrews
text: they shall perish, but thou remainest: and they all shall grow old as a garment,

name: Epistle of Hebrews
text: and as a mantle shalt thou roll them up, and they shall be changed, but thou art the same, and thy years shall not fail.

name: Epistle of Hebrews
text: But to which of the angels has he said at any time: Sit at my right hand, till I make thy enemies thy footstool?

name: Epistle of Hebrews
text: Are they not all ministering spirits sent forth to minister for the sake of those that shall inherit salvation?

name: Epistle of Hebrews
text: For this reason it is necessary that we give the more earnest heed to the things that have been heard, lest perhaps we glide away from them.

name: Epistle of Hebrews
text: For if the word that was spoken through angels became steadfast, and every transgression and disobedience received a just recompense

name: Epistle of Hebrews
text: how shall we escape if we neglect so great salvation? which began to be spoken through the Lord, and was confirmed for us by those that heard,

name: Epistle of Hebrews
text: God jointly testifying with them, both by signs and wonders, and various mighty deeds, and distributions of the Holy Spirit, according to his will.

name: Epistle of Hebrews
text: For not to angels did he put in subjection the world to come, of which we speak.

name: Epistle of Hebrews
text: But one in some place testified, saying: What is man that thou art mindful of him? or the son of man, that thou lookest on him?

name: Epistle of Hebrews
text: Thou madest him a little lower than angels, with glory and honor thou didst crown him,

name: Epistle of Hebrews
text: thou didst put all things in subjection under his feet. For in having subjected all things to him, he left nothing not subjected to him; but now we see not yet all things subjected to him.

name: Epistle of Hebrews
text: But him that was made a little lower than angels we do see, Jesus, because of the suffering of death, crowned with glory and honor; that he by the grace of God might taste of death for every man.

name: Epistle of Hebrews
text: For it became him, for whom are all things and through whom are all things, in bringing many sons to glory, to make the author of their salvation perfect through sufferings.

name: Epistle of Hebrews
text: For both he that sanctifies and they that are sanctified are all of one; for which cause he is not ashamed to call them brethren,

name: Epistle of Hebrews
text: saying: I will declare thy name to my brethren, in the midst of the congregation will I sing hymns to thee.

name: Epistle of Hebrews
text: And again: I will put my trust in him. And again: Behold, I and the children that God gave to me.

name: Epistle of Hebrews
text: Since then the children partake of flesh and blood, himself also in like manner took part in the same, that through death he might render powerless him that has the power of death, that is, the devil;

name: Epistle of Hebrews
text: and deliver them who through fear of death were all their lifetime subject to bondage.

name: Epistle of Hebrews
text: For surely not angels does he succor,* but the posterity of Abraham he succors. *To succor—to take hold of in order to save.

name: Epistle of Hebrews
text: Whence, it behooved him in all things to be made like his brethren, that he might become a merciful and faithful high priest in things pertaining to God, that he might make expiation for the sins of the people.

name: Epistle of Hebrews
text: For in that he himself has suffered being tempted, he is able also to assist those that are tempted.

name: Epistle of Hebrews
text: Wherefore, holy brethren, partakers of a heavenly calling, consider the apostle and high priest of our confession, Jesus,

name: Epistle of Hebrews
text: who was faithful to him that appointed him, as Moses also in all his house.

name: Epistle of Hebrews
text: For this man has been counted worthy of more honor than Moses, by as much as he that constructed the house has more honor than the house.

name: Epistle of Hebrews
text: For every house is constructed by some one, but he that constructed all things is God.

name: Epistle of Hebrews
text: And Moses indeed was faithful in all his house as a servant, for a testimony to those things that should afterward be spoken;

name: Epistle of Hebrews
text: but Christ is a Son over his own house, whose house we are, if we hold fast the boldness and the glorying of the hope.

name: Epistle of Hebrews
text: Wherefore, as says the Holy Spirit: Today, if you hear his voice,

name: Epistle of Hebrews
text: harden not your hearts as in the provocation in the day of temptation in the wilderness,

name: Epistle of Hebrews
text: where your fathers tempted me by proving and saw my works forty years.

name: Epistle of Hebrews
text: Wherefore I was angry with that generation, and said: They do always err in their heart; and they have not known my ways,

name: Epistle of Hebrews
text: so I swore in my wrath: They shall not enter into my rest.

name: Epistle of Hebrews
text: Take heed, brethren, lest perhaps there shall be in any one of you an evil heart of unbelief in apostatizing from the living God,

name: Epistle of Hebrews
text: but exhort one another each day, while it is called Today, lest any one of you be hardened through the deceitfulness of sin;

name: Epistle of Hebrews
text: for we have become partakers of Christ, if indeed we hold fast the beginning of the confidence firm to the end.

name: Epistle of Hebrews
text: In its being said: To-day, if you hear his voice, harden not your hearts as in the provocation;

name: Epistle of Hebrews
text: for who, when they heard, did provoke? yes, did not all that came out of Egypt through Moses?

name: Epistle of Hebrews
text: And with whom was he angry forty years? was it not with those that sinned, whose carcasses fell in the wilderness?,

name: Epistle of Hebrews
text: And to whom did he swear that they should not enter into his rest, but to those that believed not?

name: Epistle of Hebrews
text: And we see that they could not enter in because of unbelief.

name: Epistle of Hebrews
text: Let us fear, therefore, lest perhaps, as there remains a promise of entering into his rest, any of you should seem to have come short of

name: Epistle of Hebrews
text: For we also have had the good news preached to us, even as they; but the word that was heard did not profit them, not being mixed with faith in them that heard.

name: Epistle of Hebrews
text: For we who have believed are entering into the rest, as he has said: So I swore in my wrath: They shall not enter into my rest, although his works had been finished from the foundation of the world.

name: Epistle of Hebrews
text: For he has spoken in some place of the seventh day thus: And God rested on the seventh day from all his works.

name: Epistle of Hebrews
text: And in this again: They shall not enter into my rest.

name: Epistle of Hebrews
text: Since then it remains that some enter into it, and those, that formerly had the good news preached to them, entered not in because of unbelief,

name: Epistle of Hebrews
text: again he determines a day, Today, saying in David after so long a time, as has been said before, To-day if you hear his voice, harden not your hearts.

name: Epistle of Hebrews
text: For if Joshua had given them rest, he would not after this have spoken of another day.

name: Epistle of Hebrews
text: There remains, therefore, a sabbath rest for the people of God.

name: Epistle of Hebrews
text: For he that has entered into his rest has also himself rested from his works, as God from his own.

name: Epistle of Hebrews
text: Let us therefore be diligent to enter into that rest, lest any one fall after the same example of unbelief.

name: Epistle of Hebrews
text: For the word of God is living and energetic, and sharper than any two-edged sword, and piercing even to the dividing asunder of soul and spirit, of the joints also and the marrow, and is a judge of the thoughts and purposes of the heart;

name: Epistle of Hebrews
text: and there is no creature not manifest in his sight, but all things are naked and exposed to the eyes of him, to whom we must give an account.

name: Epistle of Hebrews
text: Having therefore a great high priest that has passed through the heavens, Jesus the Son of God, let us hold fast the confession.

name: Epistle of Hebrews
text: For we have not a high priest that can not sympathize with our infirmities, but has been tempted in all things like ourselves, without sin.

name: Epistle of Hebrews
text: Let us therefore come with boldness to the throne of grace, that we may receive mercy, and find grace for seasonable help.

name: Epistle of Hebrews
text: For every high priest taken from among men is appointed for men in things pertaining to God, that he may offer both gifts and sacrifices for sins,

name: Epistle of Hebrews
text: being able to have compassion on the ignorant and erring, since himself also is compassed with weakness,394

name: Epistle of Hebrews
text: and because of it he is obliged, as for the people, so also for himself, to offer for sins.

name: Epistle of Hebrews
text: And not to himself does any one take the honor, but being called by God, just as also Aaron.

name: Epistle of Hebrews
text: So, also, Christ glorified not himself in having become a high priest, but he that said to him: Thou art my Son, this day have I begotten thee:

name: Epistle of Hebrews
text: as also in another place he says: Thou art a priest for ever, according to the order of Melchisedec:

name: Epistle of Hebrews
text: who, in the days of his flesh, having with strong crying and tears offered up both prayers and supplications to him who was able to save him from death, and having been heard because of his piety,

name: Epistle of Hebrews
text: although he was a Son, learned obedience from the things that he suffered;

name: Epistle of Hebrews
text: and having been made perfect, he became, to all those that obey him, the author of eternal salvation,

name: Epistle of Hebrews
text: having been addressed by God as high priest according to the order of Melchisedec.

name: Epistle of Hebrews
text: Concerning whom we have many things to say, and hard to be explained, since you have become dull of hearing.

name: Epistle of Hebrews
text: For while you ought, on account of the time, to be teachers, you again have need that some one teach you what are first principles of the oracles of God, and have need of milk, not of solid food.

name: Epistle of Hebrews
text: For every one that partakes of milk is unskilled in the word of righteousness, for he is a babe;

name: Epistle of Hebrews
text: but solid food belongs to full-grown men, who because of habit have their senses exercised to the discerning of both good and evil.

name: Epistle of Hebrews
text: Wherefore passing by the rudimental instruction concerning Christ, let us go onward to the perfection, not again laying a foundation of repentance from dead works, and of faith toward God,

name: Epistle of Hebrews
text: of the teaching in respect to baptisms, also of the laying on of hands, also of the resurrection of the dead, and of eternal judgment.

name: Epistle of Hebrews
text: And this will we do, if indeed God permit.

name: Epistle of Hebrews
text: For it is impossible to renew again to repentance those that were once enlightened, and had tasted of the heavenly gift, and had become partakers of the Holy Spirit,

name: Epistle of Hebrews
text: and had tasted the good word of God, and the powers of the coming age,

name: Epistle of Hebrews
text: and have fallen away, crucifying to themselves the Son of God

name: Epistle of Hebrews
text: For land that drinks up the rain that often comes upon it, and yields herbs fit for those for whose sake it is also cultivated, shares blessing from God;

name: Epistle of Hebrews
text: but bringing forth thorns and thistles it is disapproved and near a curse, the end of which is for burning.

name: Epistle of Hebrews
text: But concerning you, beloved, we are persuaded better things, and things that accompany salvation, though we thus speak.

name: Epistle of Hebrews
text: For God is not unrighteous to forget your work, and the love which you showed for his name, in having ministered to the saints, and in ministering.

name: Epistle of Hebrews
text: But we desire that each one of you show the same diligence in respect to the full assurance of the hope to the end,

name: Epistle of Hebrews
text: in order that you become not slothful, but imitators of those who through faith and longsuffering inherit the promises.

name: Epistle of Hebrews
text: For when God made promise to Abraham, since he could swear by no greater, he swore by himself,

name: Epistle of Hebrews
text: saying: Surely blessing I will bless thee, and multiplying I will multiply thee;

name: Epistle of Hebrews
text: and so having patiently endured he obtained the promise.

name: Epistle of Hebrews
text: For men indeed swear by the greater, and to them an oath for confirmation is an end of all strife:

name: Epistle of Hebrews
text: in which God being more abundantly willing to show to the heirs of the promise the immutability of his purpose, interposed with an oath,

name: Epistle of Hebrews
text: that by two immutable things, in which it is impossible for God to lie, we may have strong consolation, who have fled for refuge to lay hold on the hope set before us,

name: Epistle of Hebrews
text: which we have as an anchor of the soul both safe and steadfast and which enters into the part within the veil,

name: Epistle of Hebrews
text: whither a forerunner for us has entered, Jesus, having become a high priest forever according to the order of Melchisedec.

name: Epistle of Hebrews
text: For this Melchisedec, king of Salem, priest of the most high God, who met Abraham returning from the slaughter of the kings and blessed him,

name: Epistle of Hebrews
text: to whom Abraham also divided a tenth of all, first indeed being by interpretation king of righteousness, and then also king of Salem, which is king of peace,

name: Epistle of Hebrews

text: I merely reflected on this and nothing more.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: After a certain time, as I was journeying to Cumae, and glorifying God’s creatures for their greatness and splendour and power, as I walked I fell asleep.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And a Spirit took me, and bore me away through a pathless tract, through which no man could pass

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: for the place was precipitous, and broken into clefts by reason of the waters.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: When then I had crossed the river, I came into the level country, and knelt down, and began to pray to the Lord and to confess my sins.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Now, while I prayed, the heaven was opened, and I see the lady, whom I had desired, greeting me from heaven, saying, Good morrow, Hermas.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And, looking at her, I said to her, Lady, what doest thou here?

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Then she answered me, I was taken up, that I might convict thee of thy sins before the Lord.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: I said to her, Dost thou now convict me?

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Nay, not so, said she, but hear the words, that I shall say to thee.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: God, Who dwelleth in the heavens, and created out of nothing the things which are, and increased and multiplied them for His holy Church’s sake, is wroth with thee, for that thou didst sin against me.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: I answered her and said, Sin, against thee?

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: In what way?

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Did I ever speak an unseemly word unto thee?

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Did I not always regard thee as a goddess?

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Did I not always respect thee as a sister?

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: How couldst thou falsely charge me, lady, with such villainy and uncleanness?

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Laughing she saith unto me, The desire after evil entered into

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Nay, thinkest thou not that it is an evil deed for a righteous man, if the evil desire should enter into his heart?

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: It is indeed a sin and a great one too, saith she;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: for the righteous man entertaineth righteous purposes.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: While then, his purposes are righteous, his repute stands stedfast in the heavens, and he finds the Lord easily propitiated in all that he does.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: But they that entertain evil purposes in their hearts, bring upon themselves death and captivity,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: especially they that claim for themselves this present world, and boast in its riches, and cleave not to the good things that are to come.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Their souls shall rue it, seeing that they have no hope, but have abandoned themselves and their life.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: AS soon as she had spoken these words the heavens were shut;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: myself, If this sin is recorded against me, how can I be saved?

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Or how shall I propitiate God for my sins which are full-blown?

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Or with what words shall I entreat the Lord that He may be propitious unto me?

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: While I was advising and discussing these matters in my heart,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: I see before me a great white chair of snow-white wool and there came an aged lady in glistening raiment, having a book in her hands,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and she sat down alone, and she saluted me, Good morrow, Hermas.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Then I grieved and weeping, said, Good morrow, lady.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And she said to me, Why so gloomy, Hermas, thou that art patient and good-tempered, and art always smiling?

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Why so downcast in thy looks, and far from cheerful?

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And I said to her, Because of an excellent lady saying that I had sinned against her.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Then she said, Far be this thing from the servant of God ! Nevertheless the thought did enter into thy heart concerning her.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Now to the servants of God such a purpose bringeth sin.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: For it is an evil and mad purpose to overtake a devout spirit that hath been already approved,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: that it should desire an evil deed, and especially if it be Hermas the temperate, who abstaineth from every evil desire, and is full of all simplicity and of great guilelessness.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Yet it is not for this that God is wroth with thee, but that thou mayest convert thy family, that hath done wrong against the Lord and against you their parents.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: But out of fondness for thy children thou didst not admonish thy family, but didst suffer it to become fearfully corrupt.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Therefore the Lord is wroth with thee.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: But He will heal all thy past sins, which have been committed in thy family;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: for by reason of their sins and iniquities thou hast been corrupted by the affairs of this world.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: But the great mercy of the Lord had pity on thee and thy family, and will strengthen thee, and establish thee in His glory.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Only be not thou careless, but take courage, and strengthen thy family.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: For as the smith hammering his work conquers the task which he wills, so also doth righteous discourse repeated daily conquer all evil.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Cease not therefore to reprove thy children;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: for I know that if they shall repent with all their heart, they shall be written in the books of life with the saints.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: After these words of hers had ceased, she saith unto me, Wilt thou listen to me as I read?

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Then say I, Yes, lady.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: She saith to me, Be attentive, and hear the glories of God.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: I listened with attention and with wonder to that which I had no power to remember;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: for all the words were terrible, such as man cannot bear.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: The last words however I remembered, for they were suitable for us and gentle.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Behold, the God of Hosts, Who by His invisible and mighty power and by His great wisdom created the world,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and by His glorious purpose clothed His creation with comeliness,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and by His strong word fixed the heaven,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and founded the earth upon the waters and by His own wisdom and providence formed His Holy Church, which also He blessed- behold,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: He removeth the heavens and the mountains and the hills and the seas,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and all things are made level for His elect,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: that He may fulfil to them the promise which He promised with great glory and rejoicing, if so be that they shall keep the ordinances of God, which they received, with great faith.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: When then she finished reading and arose from her chair, there came four young men, and they took away the chair, and departed towards the East.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Then she calleth me unto her, and she touched my breast, and saith to me, Did my reading please thee?

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And I say unto her, Lady, these last words please me, but the former were difficult and hard.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Then she spake to me, saying, These last words are for the righteous, but the former are for the heathen and the rebellious.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: While she yet spake with me, two men appeared, and took her by the arms, and they departed, whither the chair also had gone towards the East.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: VISION TWO.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and I called to mind my last years vision as I walked;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and again a Spirit taketh me, and carrieth me away to the same place as last year.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: When then I arrived at the place, I fell upon my knees, and began to pray to the Lord, and to glorify His name, for that he counted me worthy, and made known unto me my former sins.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: But after I had risen up from prayer, I behold before me the aged lady, whom also I had seen last year, walking and reading a little book.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And she saith to me, Canst thou report these things to the elect of God?

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: I say unto her, Lady, I cannot recollect so much;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: but give me the little book, that I may copy it.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Take it, saith she, and be sure and return it to me.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: I took it, and retiring to a certain spot in the country I copied it letter for letter:

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: for I could not make out the syllables.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: When then I had finished the letters of the book, suddenly the book was snatched out of my hand;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Now after fifteen days, when I had fasted and entreated the Lord earnestly, the knowledge of the writing was revealed to me.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And this is what was written:

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: the Lord, and have betrayed their parents through great wickedness, yea, they have got the name of betrayers of parents, and yet they did not profit by their betrayal;492

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and they still further added to their sins wanton deeds and reckless wickedness;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and so the measure of their transgressions was filled up.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: But make these words known to all thy children, and to thy wife who shall be as thy sister;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: for she too refraineth not from using her tongue, wherewith she doeth evil.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: But, when she hears these words, she will refrain, and will find mercy.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: After that thou hast made known unto them All these words,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: which the Master commanded me that they should be revealed unto thee, then all their sins which they sinned aforetime are forgiven to them;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: yea, and to all the saints that have sinned unto this day, if they repent with their whole heart, and remove double-mindedness from their heart.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: For the Master sware by His own glory, as concerning His elect;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: that if, now that this day has been set as a limit, sin shall hereafter be committed, they shall not find salvation;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: for repentance for the righteous hath an end;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: the days of repentance are accomplished for all the saints;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: whereas for the Gentiles there is repentance until the last day.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Thou shalt therefore say unto the rulers of the Church, that they direct their paths in righteousness, that they may receive in full the promises with abundant glory.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Ye therefore that work righteousness be stedfast, and be not double-minded, that ye may have admission with the holy angels.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Blessed are ye, as many as endure patiently the great tribulation that cometh, and as many as shall not deny their life.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: For the Lord sware concerning His Son, that those who denied their Lord should be rejected from their life, even they that are now about to deny Him in the coming days;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: But do thou, Hermas, no longer bear a grudge against thy children, neither suffer thy sister to have her way,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: so that they with a righteous chastisement, unless thou bear a grudge against them thyself.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: The bearing of a grudge worketh death.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: But thou, Hermas, hast had great tribulations of thine own, by reason of the transgressions of thy family, because thou hadst no care

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: For thou wast neglectful of them, and wast mixed up with thine evil transactions.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: But herein is thy salvation, in that thou didst not depart from the living God, and in thy simplicity and thy great continence.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: These have saved thee, if thou abidest therein;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and they save all who do such things, and walk in guilelessness and simplicity.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: These men prevail over all wickedness, and continue unto life eternal.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Blessed are all they that work righteousness.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: They shall never be destroyed.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: But thou shalt say to Maximus, “Behold tribulation cometh (upon thee), if thou think fit to deny a second time.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: The Lord is nigh unto them that turn unto Him, as it is written in Eldad and Modat, who prophesied to the people in the wilderness.”

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Now, brethren, a revelation was made unto me in my sleep by a youth of exceeding fair form,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: who said to me, Whom thinkest thou the aged woman, from whom thou receivedst the book, to be?

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: I say, The Sibyl.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Thou art wrong, saith be, she is not.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Who then is she?

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: I say.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: The Church, saith he.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: I said unto him, Wherefore then is she aged?

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Because, saith he, she was created before all things;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: therefore is she aged;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and for her sake the world was framed.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And afterwards I saw a vision in my house.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: The aged woman came, and asked me, if I had already given the book to the elders.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: I said that I had not given it.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Thou hast done well, she said, for I have words to add.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: When then I shall have finished all the words, it shall be made known by thy means to all the elect.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Thou shalt therefore write two little books, and shalt send one to Clement, and one to Grapte.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: So Clement shall send to the foreign cities, for this is his duty;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: while Grapte shall instruct the widows and the orphans.494

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: VISION THREE.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: fasting often, and entreating the Lord to declare unto me the revelation which He promised to show me by the mouth of the aged woman,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: that very night the aged woman was seen of me,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and she said to me, Seeing that thou art so importunate and eager to know all things, come into the country where thou abidest,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and about the fifth hour I will appear, and will show thee what thou oughtest to see.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: I asked her, saying, Lady, to what part of the country ?

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Where thou wilt, saith she.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: I selected a beautiful and retired spot;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: but before I spoke to her and named the spot, she saith to me, I will come, whither thou willest.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: I went then, brethren, into the country, and I counted up the hours, and came to the place where I appointed her to come,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and I see an ivory couch placed there, and on the couch there lay a linen cushion, and on the cushion was spread a coverlet of fine linen of flax.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: When I saw these things so ordered, and no one in the place,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: I was amazed, and a fit of trembling seized me, and my hair stood on end and a fit of shuddering came upon me, because I was alone.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: When then I recovered myself, and remembered the glory of God, and took courage, I knelt down and confessed my sins to the Lord once more, as I had done on the former occasion.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Then she came with six young men, the same whom I had seen before, and she stood by me, and listened attentively to me, as I prayed and confessed my sins to the Lord.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And she touched me, and said:

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Hermas, make an end of constantly entreating for thy sins;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: entreat also for righteousness, that thou mayest take some part forthwith to thy family.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Then she raiseth me by the hand, and leadeth me to the couch, and saith to the young men, Go ye, and build.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And after the young men had retired and we were left alone, she saith to me, Sit down here.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Do as I bid thee, saith she, sit down.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: When then I wanted to sit down on the right side, she would not allow me, but beckoned me with her hand that I should sit on the left side.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: As then I was musing thereon, and was sad because she would not permit me to sit on the right side, she saith to me, Art thou sad, Hermas?

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: The place on the right side is for others, even for those who have already been well-pleasing to God, and have suffered for the Names sake.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: But thou lackest much that thou shouldest sit with them;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: but as thou abidest in thy simplicity, even so continue, and thou shalt sit with them, thou and as many as shall have done their deeds, and have suffered what they suffered.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: What did they suffer?

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: say I.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Listen, saith she.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Stripes, imprisonments, great tribulations, crosses, wild beasts, for the Names sake.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Therefore to them belongs the right side of the Holiness-to them, and to all who shall suffer for the Name.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: But for the rest is the left side.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Howbeit, to both, to them that sit on the right, and to them that sit on the left, are the same gifts, and the same promises, only they sit on the right and have a certain glory.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Thou indeed art very desirous to sit on the right with them, but thy shortcomings are many;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: yet thou shalt be purified from thy shortcomings;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: When she had said this, she wished to depart;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: but, falling at vision which she promised.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Then she again took me by the hand, and raiseth me, and seateth me on the couch at the left hand, while she herself sat on the right.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And lifting up a certain glistening rod, she saith to me, Seest thou a great thing?

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: I say to her, Lady, I see nothing.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: She saith to me, Look thou;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: dost thou not see in front of thee a great tower being builded upon the waters, of glistening square stones?496

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Now the tower was being builded foursquare by the six young men that came with her.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And countless other men were bringing stones, some of them from the deep, and others from the land, and were handing them to the six young men.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And they took them and builded.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: The stones that were dragged from the deep they placed in every case,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: just as they were, into the building, for they had been shaped, and they fitted in their joining with the other stones;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and they adhered so closely one with another that their joining could not possibly be detected;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and the building of the tower appeared as if it were built of one stone.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: But of the other stones which were brought from the dry land, some they threw away, and some they put into the building;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and others they broke in pieces, and threw to a distance from the tower.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Now many other stones were lying round the tower, and they did not use them for the building;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: for some of them were mildewed, and others had cracks ill them, and others were too short, and others were white and round, and did not fit into the building.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And I saw other stones thrown to a distance from the tower, and coming to the way, and yet not staying in the way, but rolling to where there was no way;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and others falling into the fire and burning there;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: When she had shown me these things, she wished to hurry these things, and yet not to know what the things mean?

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: She answered and said unto me, Thou art an over-curious fellow, in desiring to know all that concerns the tower.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Yea, lady, I said, that I may announce it to any brethren, and that they [may be the more gladdened and] when they hear [these things] may know the Lord in great glory.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Then said she, Many shall hear;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: but when they hear, some of them shall be glad, and others shall weep.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Yet even these latter, if they hear and repent, shall likewise be glad.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Hear thou therefore the parables of the tower;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: for I will reveal all things unto thee.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: for these revelations have an end, seeing that they have been completed.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Nevertheless thou wilt not cease asking for revelations;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: for thou art shameless.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: The tower, which thou seest building, is myself, the Church, which was seen of thee both now and aforetime.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Ask, therefore, what thou willest concerning the tower, and I will reveal it unto thee, that thou mayest rejoice with the saints.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: I say unto her, Lady, since thou didst hold me worthy once for all, that thou shouldest reveal all things to me, reveal them.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Then she saith to me, Whatsoever is possible to be revealed to thee, shall be revealed.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Only let thy heart be with God, and doubt not in thy mind about that which thou seest.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: I asked her, Wherefore is the tower builded upon waters, lady?

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: I told thee so before, said she, and indeed thou dost enquire diligently.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: So by thy enquiry thou discoverest the truth.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Hear then why the tower is builded upon waters;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: it is because your life is saved and shall be saved by water.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: I answered and said unto her,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Lady, this thing is great and These are the holy angels of GOD, that were created first of all, unto whom the Lord delivered all His creation to increase and to build it, and to be masters of all creation.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: By their hands therefore the building of the tower will be accomplished.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And who are the others who are bringing the stones?

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: They also are holy angels of God;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: but these six are superior to them.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: The building of the tower then shall be accomplished, and all alike shall rejoice in the (completed) circle of the tower, and shall glorify God that the building of the tower was accomplished.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: I enquired of her, saying, Lady, I could wish to know concerning the end of the stones, and their power, of what kind it is.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: She answered and said unto me, It is not that thou of all men art especially worthy that it should be revealed to thee;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: for there are others before thee, and better than thou art, unto whom these visions ought to have been revealed.498

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: But that the name of God may be glorified,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: it hath been revealed to thee, and shall be revealed, for the sake of the doubtful-minded, who question in their hearts whether these things are so or not.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Tell them that all these things are true, and that there is nothing beside the truth, but that all are stedfast, and valid, and established on a firm foundation.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Hear now concerning the stones that go to the building.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: The stones that are squared and white, and that fit together in their joints,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: these are the apostles and bishops and teachers and deacons,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: who walked after the holiness of God,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and exercised their office of bishop and teacher and deacon in purity and sanctity for the elect of God, some of them already fallen on sleep, and others still living.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And because they always agreed with one another, they both had peace among themselves and listened one to another.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Therefore their joinings fit together in the building of the tower.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: But they that are dragged from the deep, and placed in the building, and that fit together in their joinings with the other stones that are already builded in, who are they?

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: These are they that suffered for the name of the Lord.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: But the other stones that are brought from the dry land, I would fain know who these are, lady.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: She said, Those that go to the building, and yet are not hewn, these the Lord hath approved because they walked in the uprightness of the Lord, and rightly performed His commandments.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: But they that are brought and placed in the building, who are they?

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: They are young in the faith, and faithful;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: but they are warned by the angels to do good, because wickedness was found in them.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: But those whom they rejected and threw away, who are they?

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: These have sinned, and desire to repent, therefore they were not cast to a great distance from the tower, because they will be useful for the building, if they repent.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: They then that shall repent, if they repent, will be strong in the faith, if they repent now while the tower is building.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: But if the building shall be finished, they have no more any place,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: But wouldst thou know about them that are broken in pieces, and cast away far from the tower?

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: These are the sons of wickedness was absent from them.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Therefore they have not salvation, for they are not useful for building by reason of their wickednesses.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Therefore they were broken up and thrown far away by reason of the wrath of the Lord, for they excited Him to wrath.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: But the rest whom thou hast seen lying in great numbers, not going to the building, of these they that are mildewed are they that knew the truth, but did not abide in it, nor cleave to the saints.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: But they that have the cracks, who are they?

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: These are they at peace among themselves;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: who have an appearance of peace, but when they depart from one another, their wickednesses abide in their hearts.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: These are the cracks which the stones have.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: But they that are broken off short, these have believed, and have their greater part in righteousness, but have some parts of lawlessness;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: But the white and round stones, which did not fit into the building, who are they, lady?

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: She answered and said to me, How understandest nothing?

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: These are they that have faith, but have also riches of this world.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: When tribulation cometh, they deny their Lord by reason of their riches and their business affairs.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And I answered and said unto her, When then, lady, will they be useful for the building ?

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: When, she replied, their wealth, which leadeth their souls astray, shall be cut away, then will they be useful for God.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: For just as the round stone, unless it be cut away, and lose some portion of itself, cannot become square,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: so also they that are rich in this world, unless their riches be cut away, cannot become useful to the lord.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Learn first from thyself.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: When thou hadst riches, thou wast useless;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: but now thou art useful and profitable unto life.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: But the other stones which thou sawest cast far away from the tower and falling into the way and rolling out of the way into believed,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: but by reason of their double heart they abandon their true way.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Thus thinking that they can find a better way, they go astray and are sore distressed, as they walk about in the regions where there is no way.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: But they that fall into the fire and are burned,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: these are they that finally rebelled from the living God,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and it no more entered into their hearts to repent by reason of the lusts of their wantonness and of the wickednesses which they wrought.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: But the others, which fall near the waters and yet cannot roll into the water, wouldest thou know who are they?

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: These are they that heard the word, and would be baptized unto the name of the Lord.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Then, when they call to their remembrance the purity of the truth, they change their minds, and go back again after their evil desires.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: So she finished the explanation of the tower.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Still importunate, I asked her further, whether for all these stones that were rejected and would not fit into the building of the tower there was repentance, and they had a place in this tower.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: They can repent, she said, but they cannot be fitted into this tower.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Yet they shall be fitted into another place much more humble, but not until they have undergone torments, and have fulfilled the days of their sins.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And they shall be changed for this reason, because they participated it, the Righteous Word;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and then shall it befall them to be relieved from their torments, if the evil deeds, that they have done, come into their heart;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: When then I ceased asking her concerning all these things, desirous of beholding, I was greatly rejoiced that I should see it.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: She looked upon me, and smiled, and she saith to me, Seest thou seven women round the tower?

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: I see them, lady, say I.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: This tower is supported by them by commandment of the Lord.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Hear now their employments.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: The first of them, the woman with the strong hands, is called Faith;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: through her are saved the elect of God.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And the second, that is girded about and looketh like a man, is

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: she is the daughter of Faith.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Whosoever then shall follow her, becometh happy in his life, for he shall refrain from all evil deeds, believing that, if he refrain from every evil desire, he shall inherit eternal life.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And the others, lady, who be they?

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: They are daughters one of the other.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: The name of the one is Simplicity, of the next, knowledge, of the next, Guilelessness, of the next, Reverence, of the next, Love.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: When then thou shalt do all the works of their mother, thou canst live.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: I would fain know, lady, I say, what power each of them possesseth.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Listen then, saith she, to the powers which they have.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Their powers are mastered each by the other, and they follow each other, in the order in which they were born.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: From Faith is born Continence, from Continence Simplicity, from Simplicity Guilelessness, from Guilelessness Reverence, from Reverence knowledge, from knowledge Love.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Their works then are pure and reverent and divine.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Whosoever therefore shall serve these women, and shall have strength to master their works, shall have his dwelling in the tower with the saints of God.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Then I asked her concerning the seasons, whether the consummation is even now.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: But she cried aloud, saying, Foolish man, seest thou not that the tower is still a-building?

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Whensoever therefore the tower shall be finished building, the end cometh;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: but it shall be built up quickly.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Ask me no more questions:

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: this reminder is sufficient for you and for the saints, and is the renewal of your spirits.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: But it was not revealed to thyself alone, but in order that thou mightest show these things unto all.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: After three days-for thou must understand first,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and I charge thee, Hermas, first with these words, which I am about to speak to thee-(I charge thee to) tell all these things into the ears of the saints,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: that hearing them and doing them they may be purified from their wickednesses, and thyself also with them.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Hear me, my children.502

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: I brought you up in much simplicity and guilelessness and reverence,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: through the mercy of the Lord, Who instilled righteousness into you, that ye might be justified and sanctified from all wickedness and all crookedness.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: But ye will not to cease from your wickedness.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Now then hear me and be at peace among your, selves, and have regard one to another, and assist one another,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and do not partake of the creatures of God alone in abundance, but share them also with those that are in want.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: For some men through their much eating bring weakness on the flesh, and injure their flesh:

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: whereas the flesh of those who have nought to eat is injured by their not having sufficient nourishment, and their body is ruined.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: This exclusiveness therefore is hurtful to you that have and do not share with them that are in want.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Look ye to the judgment that cometh.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Ye then that have more than enough, seek out them that are hungry, while the tower is still unfinished;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: for after the tower is finished, ye will desire to do good, and will find no place for it.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Look ye therefore, ye that exult in your wealth,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: lest they that are in want shall moan, and their moaning shall go up unto the Lord, and ye with your [abundance of) good things be shut outside the door of the tower.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Now therefore I say unto you that are rulers of the Church, and that occupy the chief seats;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: be not ye like unto the sorcerers.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: The sorcerers indeed carry their drugs in boxes,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: but ye carry your drug and your poison in your heart Ye are case- hardened,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and ye will not cleanse your hearts and mix your wisdom together in a clean heart, that ye may obtain mercy from the Great King.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Look ye therefore, children, lest these divisions of yours deprive you of your life.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: How is it that ye wish to instruct the elect of the Lord, while ye yourselves have no instruction?

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Instruct one another therefore, and have peace among yourselves, that I also may stand gladsome before the Father, and give an account concerning you all to your Lord.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: When then she ceased speaking with me, the six young men, who were building, came, and took her away to the tower, and other four lifted the couch, and took it also away to the tower.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: I saw not the face of these, for they were turned away.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And, as she went, I asked her to reveal to me concerning the three forms, in which she had appeared to me.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: She answered and said to me;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: As concerning these things thou must ask another, that they may be revealed to thee.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Now she was seen of me, brethren, in my first vision of last year, as a very aged woman and seated on a chair.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: In the second vision her face was youthful, but her flesh and her hair were aged, and she spake to me standing;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and she was more gladsome than before.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: But in the third vision she was altogether youthful and of exceeding great beauty, and her hair alone was aged;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and she was gladsome exceedingly and seated on a couch.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Touching these things I was very greatly anxious to learn this revelation.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And I see the aged woman in a vision of the night, saying to me, Every enquiry needs humility.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Fast therefore, and thou shalt receive what thou askest from the Lord.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: So I fasted one day;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and that very night there appeared unto me a young man, and he saith to me, Seeing that thou askest me revelations offhand with entreaty, take heed lest by thy much asking thou injure thy flesh.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Sufficient for thee are these revelations.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Canst thou see mightier revelations than those thou hast seen?

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: I say unto him in reply, Sir, this one thing alone I ask, concerning the three forms of the aged woman, that a complete revelation may be vouchsafed me.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: He saith to me in answer, How long are ye without understanding?

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: It is your double-mindedness that maketh you of no understanding, and because your heart is not set towards the Lord.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Listen, saith he, concerning the three forms, of which thou enquirest.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: In the first vision wherefore did she appear to aged, and already decayed, and had no power by reason of your infirmities and acts of double-mindedness.504

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: For as aged people, having no longer hope of renewing their youth, expect nothing else but to fall asleep,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: so ye also, being weakened with the affairs of this world, gave yourselves over to repining, and cast not your cares on the Lord;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: but your spirit was broken, and ye were aged by your sorrows.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Wherefore then she was seated on a chair, I would fain know, Sir.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Because every weak person sits on a chair by reason of his weakness, that the weakness of his body may be supported.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: But in the second vision thou sawest her standing, and with her countenance more youthful and more gladsome than before;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: saith he.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Imagine an old man, who has now lost all hope of himself by reason of his weakness and his poverty, and expecteth nothing else save the last day of his life.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Suddenly an inheritance is left him.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: He heareth the news, riseth up and full of joy clothes himself with strength, and no longer lieth down, but standeth up,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and his spirit, which was now broken by reason of his former circumstances, is renewed again, and he no longer sitteth, but taketh courage;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: so also was it with you, when ye heard the revelation which the Lord revealed unto you.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: For He had compassion on you, and renewed your spirits,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and ye laid aside your maladies, and strength came to you, and ye were made powerful in the faith, and the Lord rejoiced to see you put on your strength.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And therefore He showed you the building of the tower;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: But in the third vision ye saw her younger and fair and cometh some piece of good tidings,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: immediately he forgetteth his former sorrows,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and admitteth nothing but the tidings which he hath heard, and is strengthened thenceforth unto that which is good, and his spirit is renewed by reason of the joy which he hath received;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: so also ye have received a renewal of your spirits by seeing these good things.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And whereas thou sawest her seated on a couch, the position is a firm one;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: for the couch has four feet and standeth firmly;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: They then that have fully repented shall be young again, and founded firmly, seeing that they have repented with their whole heart.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: There thou hast the revelation entire and complete.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: VISION FOUR The fourth vision which I saw, brethren, twenty days after tribulation.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: I was going into the country by the Campanian Way.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: From the high road, it is about ten stades;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and the place is easy for travelling.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: While then I am walking alone,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: I entreat the Lord that He will accomplish the revelations and the visions which He showed me through His holy Church,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: that He may strengthen me and may give repentance to His servants which have stumbled,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: that His great and glorious Name may be glorified, for that He held me worthy that He should show me His marvels.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And as I gave glory and thanksgiving to Him, there answered me as it were the sound of a voice, Be not of doubtful mind Hermas.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: I began to question in myself and to say, How can I be of doubtful mind, seeing that I am so firmly founded by the Lord, and have seen glorious things?

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And I went on a little, brethren, and behold, I see a cloud of dust rising as it were to heaven, and I began t> say within myself, Can it be that cattle are coming, and raising a cloud of dust ?

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: for it was just about a stade from me.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: As the cloud of dust waxed greater and greater, I suspected that it was something supernatural.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Then the sun shone out a little, and behold, I see a huge beast like some sea-monster, and from its mouth fiery locusts issued forth.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And the beast was about a hundred feet in length, and its head was as it were of pottery.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And I began to weep, and to entreat the Lord that He would rescue me from it.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And I remembered the word which I had heard, Be not of doubtful mind, Hermas.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Having therefore, brethren, put on the faith of the Lord and called to mind the mighty works that He had taught me, I took courage and gave myself up to the beast.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Now the beast was coming on with such a rush, that it might have ruined a city.506

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: I come near it, and, huge monster as it was, it stretcheth itself on the ground, and merely put forth its tongue, and stirred not at all until I had passed by it.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And the beast had on its head four colours;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Now after I had passed the beast,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and had gone forward about thirty feet, behold, there meeteth me a virgin arrayed as if she sandals, veiled up to her forehead, and her head-covering consisted of a turban, and her hair was white.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: I knew from the former visions that it was the Church, and I became more cheerful.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: She saluteth me, saying, Good morrow, my good man;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and I saluted her in turn, Lady, good morrow.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: She answered and said unto me, Did nothing meet thee?

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: I say unto her, Lady, such a huge beast, that could have destroyed whole peoples :

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: but, by the power of the Lord and by His great mercy, I escaped it.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Thou didst escape it well, saith she,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
