text: because thou didst cast thy care upon God, and didst open thy heart to the Lord, believing that thou canst be saved by nothing else but by His great and glorious Name.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Therefore the Lord sent His angel, which is over the beasts, whose name is Segri, and shut its mouth, that it might not hurt thee.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Thou hast escaped a great tribulation by reason of thy faith, and because, though thou sawest so huge a beast, thou didst not doubt in thy mind.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Go therefore, and declare to the elect of the Lord His mighty works, and tell them that this beast is a type of the great tribulation which is to come.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: If therefore ye prepare yourselves beforehand,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and repent  unto the Lord with your whole heart, ye shall be able to escape it, if your heart be made pure and without blemish, and if for the remaining days of your life ye serve the Lord blamelessly.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Cast your cares upon the Lord and He will set them straight.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Trust ye in the Lord, ye men of doubtful mind, for He can do all things, yea, He both turneth away His wrath from you, and again He sendeth forth His plagues upon you that are of doubtful mind.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Woe to them that hear these words and are disobedient;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: I asked her concerning the four colours, which the beast had upon its head.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Then she answered me and said, Again thou art me what these things are.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Listen, said she;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: the black is this world in which ye dwell;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and the fire and blood colour showeth that this world must perish by blood and fire;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and the golden part are ye that have escaped from this world.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: For as the gold is tested by the fire and is made useful, so ye also [that dwell in it] are being tested in yourselves.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Ye then that abide and pass through the fire will be purified by it.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: For as the gold loses its dross, so ye also shall cast away all sorrow and tribulation, and shall be purified, and shall be useful for the building of the tower.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: But the white portion is the coming age, in which the elect of God shall dwell;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: because the elect of God shall be without spot and pure unto life eternal.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Wherefore cease not thou to speak in the ears of the saints.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Ye have now the symbolism also of the tribulation which is coming in power.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: But if ye be willing, it shall be nought.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Remember ye the things that are written beforehand.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: With these words she departed, and I saw not in what direction she departed;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: for a noise was made;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: REVELATION FIVE.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: As I prayed in the house, and sat on the couch,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: there entered a skin wrapped about him, and with a wallet on his shoulders and a staff in his hand.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And he saluted me, and I saluted him in return.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And he immediately sat down by my side, and he saith unto me, I was sent by the most holy angel, that I might dwell with thee the remaining days of thy life.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: I thought he came to tempt me, and I say unto him, Why, who art thou?

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: For I know, say I, unto whom I was delivered.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: He saith to me, Dost thou not recognise me?

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: No, I say.508

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: I, saith he, am the shepherd, unto whom thou wast delivered.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: While he was still speaking, his form was changed, and I recognised him as being the same, to whom I was delivered;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and straightway I was confounded, and fear seized me, and I was altogether overwhelmed with distress that I had answered him so wickedly and senselessly.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: But he answered and said unto me, Be not confounded, but strengthen thyself in my commandments which I am about to command thee.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: For I was sent, saith he, that I might show thee again all the things which thou didst see before, merely the heads which are convenient for you.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: First of all, write down my commandments and my parables;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and the other matters thou shalt write down as I shall show them to thee.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: The reason why, saith he, I command thee to write down first the commandments and parables is, that thou mayest read them off- hand, and mayest be able to keep them.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: So I wrote down the commandments and parables, as he commanded me.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: If then, when ye hear them, ye keep them and walk in them, and do them with a pure heart, ye shall receive from the Lord all things that He promised you;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: but if, when ye hear them, ye do not repent, but still add to your sins, ye shall receive from the Lord the opposite.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: MANDATE THE FIRST.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: First of all, believe that God is One,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: even He Who created all non-existence into being, Who comprehendeth all things, being alone incomprehensible.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Believe Him therefore, and fear Him, and in this fear be continent.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Keep these things,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and thou shall cast off all wickedness from thyself, and shall clothe thyself with every excellence of righteousness, and shall live unto God, if thou keep this commandment.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: MANDATE THE SECOND.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: He saith to me;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Keep simplicity and be guileless, and thou shall be as little children,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: First of all, speak evil of no man, neither take pleasure in listening to a slanderer.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Otherwise thou that hearest too shalt be responsible for the sin of him that speaketh the evil, if thou believest the slander, which thou hearest;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: for in believing it thou thyself also wilt have a grudge against thy brother.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: So then shalt thou be responsible for the sin of him that speaketh the evil.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Slander is evil;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: it is a restless demon, never at peace, but always having its home among factions.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Refrain from it therefore, and thou shalt have success at all times with all men.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: But clothe thyself in reverence, wherein is no evil stumbling-block, but all things are smooth and gladsome.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Work that which is good,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and of thy labours, which God giveth thee, give to all that are in want freely, not questioning to whom thou shall give, and to whom thou shall not give.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Give to all;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: for to all God desireth that there should be given of His own bounties.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: They then that receive shall render an account to God why they received it, and to what end;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: for they that receive in distress shall not be judged, but they that receive by false pretence shall pay the penalty.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: He then that giveth is guiltless;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: for as he received from the Lord the ministration to perform it, he hath performed it in sincerity, by making no distinction to whom to give or not to give.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: This ministration then, when sincerely performed, becomes glorious in the sight of God.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: He therefore that ministereth thus sincerely shall live unto God.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Therefore keep this commandment, as I have told thee, that thine own repentance and that of thy household may be found to be sincere, and [thy] heart pure and undefiled.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: MANDATE THE THIRD.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Again he saith to me;510

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Love truth, and let nothing but truth proceed out of thy mouth, that the Spirit which God made to dwell in this flesh, may be found true in the sight of all men;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and thus shall the Lord, Who dwelleth in thee, be glorified;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: for the Lord is true in every word, and with Him there is no falsehood.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: They therefore that speak lies set the Lord at nought, and become robbers of the Lord, for they do not deliver up to Him the deposit which they received.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: For they received of Him a spirit free from lies.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: This if they shall return a lying spirit, they have defiled the commandment of the Lord and have become robbers.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: When then I heard these things, I wept bitterly.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: But seeing me weep he saith, Why weepest thou ?

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Because, Sir, say I, I know not if I can be saved.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Why so?

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: saith he.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Because, Sir, I say, never in my life spake I a true word, but I always lived deceitfully with all men and dressed up my falsehood as truth before all men;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and no man ever contradicted me, but confidence was placed in my word.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: How then, Sir, say I, can I live, seeing that I have done these things?

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Your supposition, he saith, is right and true,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: for it behoved thee as a servant of God to walk in truth, and no complicity with evil should abide with the Spirit of truth, nor bring grief to the Spirit which is holy and true.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Never, Sir, say I, heard I clearly words such as these.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Now then, saith he, thou hearest.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Guard them, that the former falsehoods also which thou spakest in thy business affairs may themselves become credible, now that these are found true;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: for they too can become trustworthy.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: If thou keep these things,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and from henceforward speak nothing but truth,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: thou shalt be able to secure life for thyself And whosoever shall hear this command, and abstain from falsehood, that most pernicious habit, shall live unto God.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: I charge thee, saith he, to keep purity,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and let not a thought enter into thy heart concerning another’s wife, or concerning fornication or concerning any such like evil deeds;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: for in so doing thou committest a great sin.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: But remember thine own wife always, and thou shalt never go wrong.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: For should this desire enter into thine heart, thou wilt go wrong, and should any other as evil as this, thou committest sit,.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: For this desire in a servant of God is a great sin;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and if any man doeth this evil deed, he worketh out death for himself Look to it therefore.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Abstain from this desire;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: for, Mere holiness dwelleth, there lawlessness ought not to enter into the heart of a righteous man.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: I say to him, Sir, permit me to ask thee a few more questions.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Say on, saith he.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Sir, say I, if a man who has a wife that is faithful in the Lord detect her in adultery, doth the husband sin in living with her?

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: So long as he is ignorant, saith he, he sinneth not;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: but if the husband know of her sin, and the wife repent not, but continue in her fornication, and her husband live with her, he makes himself responsible for her sin and an accomplice in her adultery.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: What then, Sir, say I, shall the husband do, if the wife continue in this case?

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Let him divorce her, saith he, and let the husband abide alone:

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: but if after divorcing his wife he shall marry another, he likewise committeth adultery.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: If then, Sir, say I, after the wife is divorced, she repent and desire to return to her own husband, shall she not be received?

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Certainly, saith he, if the husband receiveth her not, he sinneth and bringeth great sin upon himself;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: nay, one who hath sinned and repented must be received, yet not often;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: for there is but one repentance for the servants of God.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: For the sake of her repentance therefore the husband ought not to marry.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: This is the manner of acting enjoined on husband and wife.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Not only, saith he, is it adultery, if a man pollute his flesh, but whosoever doeth things like unto the heathen committeth adultery.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: If therefore in such deeds as these likewise a man continue and repent not, keep away from him, and live not with him.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Otherwise, thou also art a partaker of his sin.512

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: For this cause ye were enjoined to remain single, whether husband or wife;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: for in such cases repentance is possible.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: I, said he, am not giving an excuse that this matter should be concluded thus, but to the end that the sinner should sin no more.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: But as concerning his former sin, there is One who is able to give healing;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: I asked him again, saying, Seeing that the Lord held me worthy that thou shouldest always dwell with me, suffer me still to made dense by my former deeds.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Make me to understand, for I am very foolish, and I apprehend absolutely nothing.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: He answered and said unto me, I, saith he, preside over repentance, and I give understanding to all who repent.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Nay, thinkest thou not, saith he, that this very act of repentance is understanding?

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: To repent is great understanding, saith he.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: For the man that hath sinned understandeth that he hath done evil before the Lord,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and the deed which he hath done entereth into his heart, and he repenteth, and doeth no more evil, but doeth good lavishly, and humbleth his own soul and putteth it to torture because it sinned.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Thou seest then that repentance is great understanding.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: It is on this account therefore, Sir, say I, that I enquire everything accurately of thee;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: first, because I am a sinner;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: secondly, because I know not what deeds I must do that I may live, for my sins are many and various.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Thou shalt live, saith he, if thou keep my commandments and walk in them;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: I will still proceed, Sir, say I, to ask a further question.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Speak on, saith he.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: I have heard, Sir, say I, from took place when we went down into the water and obtained remission of our former sins.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: He saith to me;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Thou hast well heard;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: For he that hath received remission of sins ought no longer to sin, but to dwell in purity.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: But, since thou enquirest all things accurately,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: I will declare unto thee this also, so as to give no excuse to those who shall hereafter believe or those who have already believed, on the Lord.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: For they that have already believed, or shall hereafter believe, have not repentance for sins, but have only remission of their former sins.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: To those then that were called before these days the Lord has appointed repentance.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: For the Lord, being a discerner of hearts and foreknowing all things,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: perceived the weakness of men and the manifold wiles of the devil, how that he will be doing some mischief to the servants of God, and will deal wickedly with them.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: The Lord then, being very compassionate, had pity on His handiwork, and appointeth this (opportunity of) repentance, and to me was given the authority over this repentance.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: But I say unto you, saith he, if after this great and holy calling any one, being tempted of the devil, shall commit sin, he hath only one (opportunity of) repentance.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: But if he sin off-hand and repent, repentance is unprofitable for such a man;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: for he shall live with difficulty.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: I say unto him, I was quickened into life again, when I heard these things from thee so precisely.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: For I know that, if I shall add no more to my sins, I shall be saved.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: I asked him again, saying, Sir, since once thou dost bear with me, declare unto me this further matter also.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Say on, saith and one of them marry, doth the one that marrieth sin?

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: He sinneth not, saith he, but if he remain single, he investeth himself with more exceeding honour and with great glory before the Lord;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: yet even if he should marry, he sinneth not.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Preserve purity and holiness therefore, and thou shalt live unto God.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: All these things, which I speak and shall hereafter speak unto thee, guard from this time forward, from the day when thou vast committed unto me, and I will dwell in thy house.514

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: But for thy former transgressions there shall be remission, if thou keepest my commandments.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: MANDATE THE FIFTH.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: thou shalt have the mastery over all evil deeds, and shalt work all righteousness.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: For if thou art long-suffering,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: the Holy Spirit that abideth in thee shall be pure,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: not being darkened by another evil spirit,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: but dwelling in a large room shall rejoice and be glad with the vessel in which he dwelleth, and shall serve God with much cheerfulness, having prosperity in himself.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: But if any angry temper approach, forthwith the Holy Spirit, being delicate, is straitened, not having [the) place clear, and seeketh to retire from the place;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: for he is being choked by the evil spirit, and has no room to minister unto the Lord, as he desireth, being polluted by angry temper.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: For the Lord dwelleth in long-suffering, but the devil in angry temper.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Thus that both the spirits then should be dwelling together is inconvenient and evil for that man in whom they dwell.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: For if you take a little wormwood, and pour it into a jar of honey, is not the whole of the honey spoiled, and all that honey ruined by a very small quantity of wormwood?

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: For it destroyeth the sweetness of the honey, and it no longer hath the same attraction for the owner, because it is rendered bitter and hath lost its use.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: But if the wormwood be not put into the honey, the honey is found sweet and becomes useful to its owner.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Thou seest [then) that long-suffering is very sweet, beyond the sweetness of honey, and is useful to the Lord, and He dwelleth in it.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: But angry temper is bitter and useless.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: If then angry temper be mixed with long-suffering, long-suffering is polluted and the mans intercession is no longer useful to God.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: I would fain know, Sir, say I, the working of angry temper, that I may guard myself from it.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Yea, verily, saith he, if thou guard not thyself from it-thou and thy family-thou hast lost all thy hope.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: But guard thyself from it;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Yea, and all men shall hold aloof from it, as many as have repenteth with their whole heart.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: For I will be with them and will preserve them;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Hear now, saith he, the working of angry temper, how evil it is,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and how it subverteth the servants of God by its own working, lead astray them that are full in the faith, nor can it work upon them, because the power of the Lord is with them;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: but them that are empty and double-minded it leadeth astray.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: For when it seeth such men in prosperity it insinuates itself into the heart of the man,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and for no cause whatever the man or the woman is embittered on account of worldly matters,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: either about meats, or some triviality, or about some friend, or about giving or receiving, or about follies of this kind.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: For all these things are foolish and vain and senseless and inexpedient for the servants of God.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: But long-suffering is great and strong,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and has a mighty and vigorous power, and is prosperous in great enlargement, gladsome, exultant, free from care, glorifying the Lord at every season, having no bitterness in itself, remaining always gentle and tranquil.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: This long-suffering therefore dwelleth with those whose faith is perfect.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: But angry temper is in the first place foolish, fickle and senseless;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: then from foolishness is engendered bitterness, and from bitterness wrath, and from wrath anger, and from anger spite;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: then spite being composed of all these evil elements becometh a great sin and incurable.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: For when all these spirits dwell in one vessel, where the Holy Spirit also dwelleth, that vessel cannot contain them, but overfloweth.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: The delicate spirit therefore,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: as not being accustomed to dwell with-an evil spirit nor with harshness, departeth from a man of that kind, and seeketh to dwell with gentleness and tranquility.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Then, when it hath removed from that man, in whom it dwells,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: that man becometh emptied of the righteous spirit,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and henceforward, being filled with the evil spirits, he is unstable in all his actions,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: being dragged about hither and thither by the evil spirits, and is altogether blinded and bereft of his good intent.516

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Thus then it happeneth to all persons of angry temper.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Refrain therefore from angry temper, the most evil of evil spirits.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: But clothe thyself in long-suffering, and resist angry temper and bitterness, and thou shalt be found in company with the holiness which is beloved of the Lord.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: See then that thou never neglect this commandment;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: for if thou master this commandment, thou shalt be able likewise to keep the remaining commandments, which I am about to give thee.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Be strong in them and endowed with power;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: MANDATE THE SIXTH.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: I charged thee, saith he,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: in my first commandment to guard saith he, I wish to show thee their powers also, that thou mayest understand what is the power and effect of each one of them.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: For their effects are twofold.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Now they are prescribed alike to the righteous and the unrighteous.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Do thou therefore trust righteousness, but trust not unrighteousness;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: for the way of righteousness is straight, but the way of unrighteousness is crooked.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: But walk thou in the straight path, and leave the crooked one alone.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: For the crooked way has no tracks, but only pathlessness and many stumbling-stones, and is rough and thorny.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: So it is therefore harmful to those who walk in it.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: But those who walk in the straight way walk on the level and without stumbling :

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: for it is neither rough nor thorny.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Thou seest then that it is more expedient to walk in this way.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: I am pleased, Sir, say I, to walk in this way.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Hear now, saith he, concerning faith.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: There are two then, Sir, say I, shall I know their workings, seeing that both angels dwell with me?

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Hear, saith he, and understand their workings.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: The angel of righteousness is delicate and bashful and gentle and tranquil.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: forthwith he speaketh with thee of righteousness, of purity, of holiness, and of contentment, of every righteous deed and of every glorious virtue.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: When all these things enter into thy heart, know that the angel of righteousness is with thee.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: [These then are the works of the angel of righteousness.]

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Trust him therefore and his works.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Now see the works of the angel of wickedness also.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: First of all, he is quick-tempered and bitter and senseless, and his works are evil, overthrowing the servants of God.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Whenever then he entereth into thy heart, know him by his works.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: How I shall discern him, Sir, I reply, I know not.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Listen, saith he.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: When a fit of angry temper or bitterness comes upon thee, know that he is in thee.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Then the desire of much business and the costliness of many viands and drinking bouts and of many drunken fits and of various luxuries which are unseemly,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and the desire of women, and avarice, and haughtiness and boastfulness,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and whatsoever things are akin and like to these-when then these things enter into thy heart, know that the angel of wickedness is with thee.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Do thou therefore, recognising his works, stand aloof from him, and trust him in nothing, for his works are evil and inexpedient for the servants of God.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Here then thou hast the workings of both the angels.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Understand them, and trust the angel of righteousness.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: But from the angel of wickedness stand aloof, for his teaching is evil in every matter;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: for though one be a man of faith, and the desire of this angel enter into his heart, that man, or that woman, must commit some sin.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And if again a man or a woman be exceedingly wicked, and the works of the angel of righteousness come into that mans heart, he must of necessity do something good.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Thou seest then, saith he, that it is good to follow the angel of righteousness, and to bid farewell to the angel of wickedness.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: This commandment declareth what concerneth faith,, that thou mayest trust the works of the angel of righteousness, and doing them mayest live unto God.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: But believe that the works of the angel of wickedness are difficult;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: MANDATE THE SEVENTH.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Fear the Lord, saith he, and keep His commandments.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: So deed, and thy doing shall be incomparable.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: For whilst thou fearest the Lord, thou shalt do all things well.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: But this is the fear wherewith thou oughtest to be afraid, and thou shalt be saved.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: But fear not the devil;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: for, if thou fear the Lord, thou shalt be master over the devil, for there is no power in him.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: [For] in whom is no power, neither is there fear of him;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: but in whom power is glorious, of him is fear likewise.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: For every one that hath power hath fear, whereas he that hath no power is despised of all.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: But fear thou the works of the devil, for they are evil.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: While then thou fearest the Lord, thou wilt fear the works of the devil, and wilt not do them, but abstain from them.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Fear therefore is of two kinds.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: If thou desire to do evil, fear the Lord, and thou shalt not do it.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: If again thou desire to do good, fear the Lord and thou shalt do it.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Therefore the fear of the Lord is powerful and great and glorious.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Fear the Lord then, and thou shalt live unto Him;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: yea, and as many of them that keep His commandments as shall fear Him, shall live unto God.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Wherefore, Sir, say I, didst thou say concerning those that keep His commandments, “They shall live unto God”?

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Because, saith he, every creature feareth the Lord, but not every one keepeth His commandments.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Those then that fear Him and keep His commandments, they have life unto God;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: MANDATE THE EIGHTH.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: I told thee, saith he, that the creatures of God are twofold;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: be temperate, but in other things it is not right.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Make known unto me, Sir, say I, in what things it is right to be temperate, and in what things it is not right.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Listen, saith he.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Be temperate as to what is evil, and do it not;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: but be not temperate as to what is good, but do it.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: For if thou be temperate as to what is good, so as not to do it, thou

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: but if thou be temperate as to what is evil, so as not to do it, thou doest great righteousness.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Be temperate therefore in abstaining from all wickedness, and do that which is good.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: What kinds of wickedness, Sir, say I, are they from which we must be temperate and abstain?

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Listen, saith he;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: from adultery and fornication,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: from the lawlessness of drunkenness, from wicked luxury,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: from many viands and the costliness of riches, and vaunting and haughtiness and pride, and from falsehood and evil-speaking and hypocrisy, malice and all blasphemy.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: These works are the most wicked of all in the life of men.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: From these works therefore the servant of God must be temperate and abstain;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: for he that is not temperate so as to abstain from these cannot live unto God.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Listen then to what follows upon these.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Why, are there still other evil deeds, Sir?

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: say I.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Aye, saith he, there are many, from which the servant of God must be temperate and abstain;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: theft, falsehood, deprivation, false witness, avarice, evil desire, deceit, vain-glory, boastfulness, and whatsoever things are like unto these.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Thinkest thou not that these things are wrong, yea, very wrong, [saith he,] for the servants of God?

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: In all these things he that serveth God must exercise temperance.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Be thou temperate, therefore, and refrain from all these things, that thou mayest live unto God, and be enrolled among those who exercise self-restraint in them.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: These then are the things from which thou shouldest restrain thyself Now hear, saith he, the things, in which thou shouldest not exercise self-restraint, but do them.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Exercise no self-restraint in that which is good, but do it.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Sir, say I, show me the power of the good also, that I may walk in them and serve them, that doing them it may be possible for me to be saved.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Hear, saith he, the works of the good likewise, which thou must do, and towards which thou must exercise no self-restraint.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: First of all, there is faith, fear of the Lord, love, concord, words of righteousness, truth, patience;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: nothing is better than these it, the life of men.520

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: If a man keep these, and exercise not self-restraint from them, he becomes blessed in his life.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Hear now what follow upon these;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: to minister to widows, to visit the orphans and the needy,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: to ransom the servants of God from their afflictions,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: to be hospitable (for in hospitality benevolence from time to time has a place),

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: to resist no man, to be tranquil, to show yourself more submissive than all men,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: to reverence the aged, to practise righteousness, to observe brotherly feeling,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: to endure injury, to be long-suffering, to bear no grudge,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: to exhort those who are sick at soul, not to cast away those that have stumbled from the faith,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: but to convert them and to put courage into them, to reprove sinners, not to oppress debtors and indigent persons, and whatsoever actions are like these.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Do these things, saith he, seem to thee to be good?

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Why, what, Sir, say I, can be better than these ?

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Then walk in them, saith he, and abstain not from them, and thou shalt live unto God.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Keep this commandment therefore.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: If thou do good and abstain not from it, thou shalt live unto God;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: yea, and all shall live unto God who act so.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And again if thou do not evil, and abstain from it, thou shalt live unto God;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: yea, and all shall live unto God, who shall keep these commandments, and walk in them.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: MANDATE THE NINTH.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: He saith to me;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Remove from thyself a doubtful mind and doubt not at all whether to ask of God, saying within thyself, “ How can I ask a thing of the Lord and receive it, seeing that I have committed so many sins against Him?”

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Reason not thus, but turn to the Lord with thy whole heart,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and ask of Him, nothing wavering, and thou shalt know His exceeding compassion, that He will surely not abandon thee, but will fulfil the petition of thy soul.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: For God is not as men who bear a grudge, but Himself is without

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Do thou therefore cleanse thy heart from all the vanities of this life, and from the things mentioned before;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and ask of the Lord, and thou shalt receive all things, and shalt lack nothing of all thy petitions, if thou ask of the Lord nothing wavering.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: But if thou waver in thy heart, thou shalt surely receive none of thy petitions.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: For they that waver towards God, these are the doubtful-minded, and they never obtain any of their petitions.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: But they that are complete in the faith make all their petitions trusting in the Lord, and they receive, because they ask without wavering, nothing doubting;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: for every doubtful-minded man, if he repent not, shall hardly be saved.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Cleanse therefore thy heart from doubtful-mindedness, and put on faith, for it is strong, and trust God that thou wilt receive all thy petitions which thou askest;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and if after asking anything of the Lord, thou receive thy petition somewhat tardily, be not of doubtful mind because thou didst not receive the petition of thy soul at once.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: For assuredly it is by reason of some temptation or some transgression, of which thou art ignorant, that thou receivest thy petition so tardily.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Do thou therefore cease not to make thy souls petition, and thou shalt receive it.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: But if thou grow weary, and doubt as thou askest, blame thyself and not Him that giveth unto thee.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: See to this doubtful-mindedness;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: for it is evil and senseless, and uprooteth many from the faith, yea, even very faithful and strong men.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: For indeed this doubtful-mindedness is a daughter of the devil, and worketh great wickedness against the servants of God.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Therefore despise doubtful-mindedness and gain the mastery over it in everything, clothing thyself with faith which is strong and powerful.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: For faith promiseth all things, accomplisheth all things;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: but doubtful-mindedness, as having no confidence in itself, fails in all the works which it doeth.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Thou seest then, saith he, that faith is from above from the Lord, and hath great power;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: but doubtful-mindedness as an earthly spirit from the devil, and hath no power.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Do thou therefore serve that faith which hath power, and hold aloof from the doubtful-mindedness which hath no power;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and thou shalt live unto God;522

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: yea, and all those shall live unto God who are so minded.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: MANDATE THE TENTH.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Put away sorrow from thyself, saith he, for she is the sister of doubtful-mindedness and of angry temper.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: How, Sir, say I, is she the sister of these?

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: For angry temper seems to me to be one thing, doubtful- mindedness another, sorrow another.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Thou art a foolish fellow, saith he,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: [and] perceivest not that sorrow is more evil than all the spirits,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and is most fatal to the servants of God, and beyond all the spirits destroys a man, and crushes out the Holy Spirit, and yet again saves it.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: I, Sir, say I, am without understanding, and I understand not these parables.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: For how it can crush out and again save, I do not comprehend.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Listen, saith he.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Those who have never investigated concerning the truth,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: nor enquired concerning the deity,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: but have merely believed,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and have been mixed up in business affairs and riches and heathen friendships,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and many other affairs of this world-as many, I say, as devote themselves to these things, comprehend not the parables of the deity;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: for they are darkened by these actions, and are corrupted and become barren.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: As good vineyards,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: when they are treated with neglect, are made barren by the thorns and weeds of various kinds,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: so men who after they have believed fall into these many occupations which were mentioned before, lose their understanding and comprehend nothing at all concerning righteousness;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: for if they hear concerning the deity and truth, their mind is absorbed in their occupations, and they perceive nothing at all.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: But they that have the fear of God,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and investigate concerning deity and truth, and direct their heart towards the Lord, perceive and understand everything that is said to them more quickly,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: because they have the fear of the Lord in themselves;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Cleave therefore unto the Lord, and thou shalt understand and perceive all things.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Hear now, senseless man, saith he, how sorrow crusheth out the Holy Spirit, and again saveth it.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: When the man of doubtful mind sets his hand to any action, and fails in it owing to his doubtful-mindedness, grief at this entereth into the man, and grieveth the Holy Spirit, and crusheth it out.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Then again when angry temper cleaveth to a man concerning any matter,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and he is much embittered, again sorrow entereth into the heart of the man that was ill-tempered, and he is grieved at the deed which he hath done, and repenteth that he did evil.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: This sadness therefore seemeth to bring salvation, because he repented at having done the evil.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: So both the operations sadden the Spirit;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: first, the doubtful mind saddens the Spirit, because it succeeded not in its business, and the angry temper again, because it did what was evil.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Thus both are saddening to the Holy Spirit, the doubtful mind and the angry temper.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Put away therefore from thyself sadness, and afflict not the Holy Spirit that dwelleth in thee, lest haply He intercede with God [against thee], and depart from thee.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: For the Spirit of God, that was given unto this flesh, endureth not sadness neither constraint.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Therefore clothe thyself in cheerfulness, which hath favour with God always, and is acceptable to Him, and rejoice in it.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: For every cheerful man worketh good, and thinketh good, and despiseth sadness;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: but the sad man is always committing sin.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: In the first place he committeth sin, because he grieveth the Holy Spirit, which was given to the man being a cheerful spirit;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and in the second place, by grieving the Holy Spirit he doeth lawlessness, in that he doth not intercede with neither confess unto God.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: For the intercession of a sad man hath never at any time power to ascend to the altar of God.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Wherefore, say I, doth not the intercession of him that is saddened ascend to the altar?524

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Because, saith he, sadness is seated at his heart.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Thus sadness mingled with the intercession doth not suffer the intercession to ascend pure to the altar.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: For as vinegar when mingled with vine in the same  hath not the same pleasant taste, so likewise sadness mingled with the Holy Spirit hath not the same intercession.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Therefore cleanse thyself from this wicked sadness, and thou shalt live unto God;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: yea, and all they shall live unto God, who shall cast away sadness from themselves and clothe themselves in all cheerfulness.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: MANDATE THE ELEVENTH.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: He shewed me men seated on a couch, and another man seated on a chair.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And he saith to me, Seest thou those that are seated on the couch ?

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: I see them, Sir, say I.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: These, saith he, are faithful,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: but he that sitteth on the chair is a false prophet who destroyeth the mind of the servants of God-I mean, of the doubtful-minded, not of the faithful.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: These doubtful-minded ones then come to him as to a soothsayer and enquire of him what shall befall them.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And he, the false prophet, having no power of a divine Spirit in himself, speaketh with them according to their enquiries [and according to the lusts of their wickedness],

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and filleth their souls as they themselves wish.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: For being empty himself he giveth empty answers to empty enquirers;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: for whatever enquiry may be made of him, he answereth according to the emptiness of the man.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: But he speaketh also some true words for the devil filleth him with his own spirit, if so be he shall be able to break down some of the righteous.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: So many therefore as are strong in the faith of the Lord, clothed with the truth, cleave not to such spirits, but hold aloof from them;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: but as many as are doubters and frequently change their minds, practise soothsaying like the Gentiles, and bring upon themselves greater sin by their idolatries.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: For he that consulteth a false prophet on any matter is an idolater and emptied of the truth, and senseless.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: but, having the power of deity, speaketh all things of itself, because it is from above, even from the power of the divine Spirit.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: But the spirit which is consulted, and speaketh according to the desires of men, is earthly and fickle, having no power;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and it speaketh not at all, unless it be consulted.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: How then, Sir, say I, shall a man know who of them is a prophet, and who a false prophet?

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Hear, saith he, concerning both the prophets;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and, as I shall tell thee, so shalt thou test the prophet and the false prophet.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: By his life test the man that hath the divine Spirit.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: In the first place, he that hath the Spirit, which is from above,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: is gentle and tranquil and humble-minded,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and abstaineth from all wickedness and vain desire of this present world,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and holdeth himself inferior to all men, and giveth no answer to any man when enquired of, nor speaketh in solitude (for neither doth the Holy Spirit speak when a man wisheth Him to speak);

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: but the man speaketh then when God wisheth him to speak.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: When then the man who hath the divine Spirit cometh into an assembly of righteous men, who have faith in a divine Spirit,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and intercession is made to God by the gathering of those men,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: then the angel of the prophetic spirit, who is attached to him, filleth the man, and the man, being filled with the Holy Spirit, speaketh to the multitude, according as the Lord willeth.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: In this way then the Spirit of the deity shall be manifest.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: This then is the greatness of the power as touching the Spirit of the deity of the Lord.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Hear now, saith he, concerning the earthly and vain spirit, which hath no power but is foolish.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: In, the first place, that man who seemeth to have a spirit exalteth himself,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and desireth to have a chief place,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and straight-way he is impudent and shameless and talkative and conversant in many luxuries and in many other deceits, and receiveth money for his prophesying, and if he receiveth not, he prophesieth not.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Now can a divine Spirit receive money and prophesy?

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: It is not possible for a prophet of God to do this, but the spirit of such prophets is earthly.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: In the next place, it never approacheth an assembly of righteous men;526

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: but avoideth them, and cleaveth to the doubtful-minded and empty,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and prophesieth to them in corners, and deceiveth them, speaking all things in emptiness to gratify their desires;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: for they too are empty whom it answereth.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: For the empty vessel placed together with the empty is not broken, but they agree one with the other.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: But when he comes into an assembly full of righteous men who have a Spirit of deity,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and intercession is made from them,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: that man is emptied, an(l the earthly spirit fleeth from him, in fear, and that man is struck dumb and is altogether broken in pieces, being unable to utter a word.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: For, if you pack wine or oil into a closet, and place an empty vessel among them, and again desire to unpack the closet,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: the vessel which you placed there empty, empty in like manner you will find it.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Thus also the empty prophets, whenever they come unto the spirits of righteous men, are found just such as they came.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: I have given thee the life of both kinds of prophets.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Therefore test, by his life and his works, the man who says that he is moved by the Spirit.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: But do thou trust the Spirit that cometh from God, and hath power;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: but in the earthly and empty spirit put no trust at all;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: for in it there is no power, for it cometh from the devil.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Listen to the parable which I shall tell thee.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Take a stone, and throw it up to heaven-see if thou canst reach it;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: or again, take a squirt of water, and squirt it up to heaven-see if thou canst bore through the heaven.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: How, Sir, say I, can these things be?

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: For both these things which thou hast mentioned are beyond our power.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Well then, saith he, just as these things are beyond our power, so likewise the earthly spirits have no power and are feeble.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Now take the power which cometh from above.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: The hail is a very small grain, and yet, when it falleth on a mans head, what pain it causeth! Or again, take a drop which falls on the ground from the tiles, and bores through the stone.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: He saith to me;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Remove from thyself all evil desire, and clothe thyself in the desire which is good and holy;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: for clothed with this desire thou shalt hate the evil desire, and shalt bridle and direct it as thou wilt.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: For the evil desire is wild, and only tamed with difficulty;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: for it is terrible, and by its wildness is very costly to men;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: more especially if a servant of God get entangled in it, and have no understanding, he is put to fearful costs by it.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: But it is costly to such men as are not clothed in the good desire, but are mixed up with this life.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: These men then it hands over to death.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Of what sort, Sir, say I, are the works of the evil desire, which hand over men to death?

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Make them known to me, that I may hold aloof from them.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Listen, through what works the evil desire bringeth death to the servants of God.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Before all is desire for the wife or husband of another, and for extravagance of wealth, and for many needless dainties, and for drinks and other luxuries, many and foolish.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: For every luxury is foolish and vain for the servants of God.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: These desires then are evil, and bring death to the servants of God.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: For this evil desire is a daughter of the devil.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Ye must, therefore, abstain from the evil desires, that so abstaining ye may live unto God.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: But as many as are mastered by them, and resist them not, are done to death utterly;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: for these desires are deadly.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: But do thou clothe thyself in the desire of righteousness, and, having armed thyself with the fear of the Lord, resist them.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: For the fear of God dwelleth in the good desire.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: If the evil desire shall see thee armed with the fear of God and resisting itself, it shall flee far from thee, and shall no more be seen of thee, being in fear of thine arms.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Do thou therefore, when thou art crowned for thy victory over it, come to the desire of righteousness,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and deliver to her the victors prize which thou hast received, and serve her, according as she herself desireth.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: I would fain know, Sir, say I, in what ways I ought to serve the and the fear of the Lord, faith and gentleness, and as many good deeds as are like these.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Practising these thou shalt be well-pleasing as a servant of God, and shalt live unto Him;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: So he completed the twelve commandments, and he saith to me;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Thou hast these commandments;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: walk in them, and exhort thy hearers that their ministration, which I give thee, fulfil thou with all diligence to the end, and thou shalt effect much.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: For thou shalt find favour among those who are about to repent, and they shall obey thy words.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: I say to him;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Sir, these commandments are great and beautiful and glorious, and are able to gladden the heart of the man who is able to man, for they are very hard.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: He answered and said unto me;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: If thou set it before thyself that they can be kept, thou wilt easily keep them, and they will not be hard;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: but if it once enter into thy heart that they cannot be kept by a man, thou wilt not keep them.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: But now I say unto thee;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: if thou keep then, not, but neglect them, thou shalt not have salvation, neither thy children nor thy household, since thou hast already pronounced judgment against thyself that these commandments cannot be kept by a man.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And these things he said to me very angrily, so that I was confounded, and feared him exceedingly;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: for his form was changed, so that a man could not endure his anger.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And when he saw that I was altogether disturbed and confounded, he began to speak more kindly [and cheerfully] to me, and he saith;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Foolish fellow, void of understanding and of doubtful mind,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: perceivest thou not the glory of God, how great and mighty and

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: how that He created the world for mans sake, and subjected all His creation to man, and gave all authority to him, that he should be master over all things under the heaven?

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: If then, man is lord of all the creatures of God and mastereth all things, cannot he also master these commandments?

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Aye, saith he, the man that hath the Lord in his heart can master [all things and] all these commandments.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: But they that have the Lord on their lips, while their heart is hardened, and are far from the Lord, to them these commandments are hard and inaccessible.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Therefore do ye, who are empty and fickle in the faith, set your Lord in your heart, and ye shall perceive that nothing is easier than these commandments, nor sweeter, nor more gentle.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Be ye converted, ye that walk after the commandments of devil, (the commandments which are so) difficult and bitter and wild and riotous;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and fear not the devil, for there is no power in him against you.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: For I will be with you, I, the angel of repentance, who have the mastery over him.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: The devil hath fear alone, but his fear hath no force.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: I say to him, Sir, listen to a few words from me.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Say what thou wilt, saith he.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Man, Sir, I say, is eager to keep the commandments of strengthened in His commandments, and be subject to them;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: but the devil is hard and overmastereth them.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: He cannot, saith he, overmaster the servants of God, who set their hope on Him with their whole heart.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: The devil can wrestle with them, but he cannot overthrow them.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: If then ye resist him, he will be vanquished, and will flee from you disgraced.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: But as many, saith he, as are utterly empty, fear the devil as if he had power.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: When a man has filled amply sufficient jars with good wine, and among these jars a few are quite empty, he comes to the jars, and does not examine the full ones, for he knows that they are full;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: but he examineth the empty ones, fearing lest they have turned sour.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: For empty jars soon turn sour, and the taste of the wine is spoilt.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: So also the devil cometh to all the servants of Cod tempting them.530

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: As many then as are complete in the faith, oppose him mightily, and he departeth from them, not having a place where he can find an entrance.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: So he cometh next to the empty ones, and finding a place goeth into them, and further he doeth what he willeth in them, and they become submissive slaves to him.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: But I, the angel of repentance, say unto you;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Fear not the devil;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: for I was sent, saith he, to be with you who repent with your whole heart, and to strengthen you in the faith.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Believe, therefore, on God, ye who by reason of your sins have despaired of your life, and are adding to your sins, and weighing down your life;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: for if ye turn unto the Lord with your whole heart,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and work righteousness the remaining days of your life, and serve Him rightly according to His will, He will give healing to your former sins, and ye shall have power to master the works of the devil.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: But of the threatening of the devil fear not at all;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: for he is unstrung, like the sinews of a dead man.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Hear me therefore, and fear Him, Who is able to do all things, to save and to destroy, and observe these commandments, and ye shall live unto God.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: I say to him, Sir, now am I strengthened in all the ordinances of the Lord, because thou art with me;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and I know that thou wilt crush all the power of the devil, and we shall be masters over him, and shall prevail over all his works.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And I hope, Sir, that I am now able to keep these commandments which thou hast commanded, the Lord enabling me.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Thou shalt keep them, saith he, if thy heart be found pure with the Lord;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: PARABLES WHICH HE SPAKE WITH ME.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: He saith to me;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Ye know that ye, who far from this city.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: If then ye know your city, in which ye shall dwell, why do ye here prepare fields and expensive displays and buildings and dwelling- chambers which are superfluous?

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: He, therefore, that prepareth these things for this city does not

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: O foolish and double-minded and miserable man, perceivest thou not that all these things are foreign, and are under the power of another?

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: For the lord of this city shall say, “I do not wish thee to dwell in my city;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: go forth from this city, for thou dost not conform to my laws.”

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Thou, therefore, who hast fields and dwellings and many other possessions,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: when thou art cast out by him, what wilt thou do with thy field and thy house and all the other things that thou preparedst for thyself?

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: For the lord of this country saith to thee justly, “Either conform to my laws, or depart from my country.”

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: What then shalt thou do, who art under law in thine own city?

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: For the sake of thy fields and the rest of thy possessions wilt thou altogether repudiate thy law, and walk according to the law of this city?

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Take heed, lest it be inexpedient to repudiate thy law;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: for if thou shouldest desire to return again to thy city, thou shalt surely not be received [because thou didst repudiate the law of thy city], and shalt be shut out from it.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Take heed therefore;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: as dwelling in a strange land prepare nothing more for thyself but a competency which is sufficient for thee,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and make ready that,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: whensoever the master of this city may desire to cast thee out for thine opposition to his law, thou mayest go forth from his city and depart into thine own city, and use thine own law joyfully, free from all insult.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Take heed therefore, ye that serve God and have Him in your heart work the works of God being mindful of His commandments and of the promises which He made, and believe Him that He will perform them, if His commandments be kept.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Therefore, instead of fields buy ye souls that are in trouble, as each is able, and visit widows and orphans, and neglect them not;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and spend your riches and all your displays, which ye received from God, on fields and houses of this kind.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: For to this end the Master enriched you, that ye might perform these ministrations for Him.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: It is much better to purchase fields and houses of this kind, which thou wilt find in thine own city, when thou visitest it.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: This lavish expenditure is beautiful and joyous, not bringing sadness or fear, but bringing joy.532

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: The expenditure of the heathen then practise not ye;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: for it is not convenient for you the servants of God.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: But practise your own expenditure, in which ye can rejoice;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and do not corrupt, neither touch that which is another mans, nor lust after it;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: for it is wicked to lust after other men’s possessions.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: ANOTHER PARABLE.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: As I walked in the field, and noticed an elm and a vine,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and was distinguishing them and their fruits, the shepherd appeareth thinking, [Sir,] say I, about the elm and the vine, that they are excellently suited the one to the other.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: These two trees, saith he, are appointed for a type to the servants of God.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: I would fain know, say I, the type contained in these trees, of which thou speakest.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Seest thou, saith he, the elm and the vine?

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: I see them, Sir, say I.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: This vine, saith he, beareth fruit, but the elm is an unfruitful stock.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Yet this vine, except it climb up the elm, cannot bear much fruit when it is spread on the ground;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and such fruit as it beareth is rotten, because it is not suspended upon the elm.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: When then the vine is attached to the elm, it beareth fruit both from itself and from the elm.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Thou seest then that the elm also beareth fruit, not less than the vine, but rather more.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: How more, Sir? say I.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Because, saith he, the vine, when hanging upon the elm, bears its fruit in abundance, and in good condition;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: but, when spread on the ground, it beareth little fruit, and that rotten.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: This parable therefore is applicable to the servants of God, to poor and to rich alike.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: How, Sir? say I;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: instruct me.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Listen, saith he;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: the rich man hath much wealth, but in the things of the Lord he is poor, being distracted about his riches, and his confession and

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and even that which he giveth is small and weak and hath not power above.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: When then the rich man goeth up to the poor, and assisteth him in his needs,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: believing that for what he doth to the poor man he shall be able to obtain a reward with God-because the poor man is rich in intercession [and confession],

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and his intercession hath great power with God-the rich man then supplieth all things to the poor man without wavering.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: But the poor man being supplied by the rich maketh intercession for him, thanking God for him that gave to him.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And the other is still more zealous to assist the poor man, that he may he continuous in his life:

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: for he knoweth that the intercession of the poor man is acceptable and rich before God.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: They both then accomplish their work;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: the poor man maketh intercession, wherein he is rich [which he received of the Lord];

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: this he rendereth again to the Lord Who supplieth him with it.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: The rich man too in like manner furnisheth to the poor man, nothing doubting, the riches which he received from the Lord.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And this work is great and acceptable with God,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: because  hath understanding concerning his riches, and worketh for the poor man from the bounties of the Lord, and accomplisheth the ministration of the Lord rightly.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: In the sight of men then the elm seemeth not to bear fruit,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and they know not, neither perceive,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: that if there cometh a drought, the elm having water nurtureth the vine, and the vine having a constant supply of water beareth fruit twofold, both for itself and for the elm.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: So likewise the poor, by interceding with the Lord for the rich, establish their riches, and again the rich, supplying their needs to the poor, establish their souls.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: So then both are made partners in the righteous work.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: He then that doeth these things shall not be abandoned of God, but shall be written in the books of the living.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Blessed are the rich, who understand also that they are enriched from the Lord.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: ANOTHER PARABLE.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: He showed me many trees which had no leaves, but they seemed to me to be, as it were, withered for they were all alike.534

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And he all alike, and are withered.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: He answered and said to me;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: These trees that thou seest are they that dwell in this world.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Wherefore then, Sir, say I, are they as if they were withered, and alike?

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Because, saith he, neither the righteous are distinguishable, nor the sinners in this world, but they are alike.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: For this world is winter to the righteous, and they are not distinguishable, as they dwell with the sinners.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: For as in the winter the trees, having shed their leaves, are alike, and are not distinguishable, which are withered,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and which alive, so also in this world neither the just nor the sinners are distinguishable, but they are all alike.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: ANOTHER PARABLE.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: He showed me many trees again, some of them sprouting, and others withered, and he saith to me;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Seest thou, saith he, these trees?

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: I see them, Sir, say I, some of them sprouting, and others withered.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: These trees, saith he, that are sprouting are the righteous, who shall dwell in the world to come;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: for the world to come is summer to the righteous, but winter to the sinners.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: When then the mercy of the Lord shall shine forth, then they that serve Cod shall be made manifest;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: yea, and all men shall be made manifest.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: For as in summer the fruits of each several tree are made manifest,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and are recognised of what sort they are,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: so also the fruits of the righteous shall be manifest, and all [even the very smallest] shall be known to be flourishing in that world.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: But the Gentiles and the sinners,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: just as thou sawest the trees which were withered,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: even such shall they be found, withered and unfruitful in that world, and shall be burnt up as fuel, and shall be manifest, because their practice in their life hath been evil.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: For the sinners shall be burned, because they sinned and repented not;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and the Gentiles shall be burned, because they knew not Him that created them.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Do thou therefore bear fruit, that in that summer thy, fruit may be

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: But abstain from overmuch business, and thou shalt never fall into any sin.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: For they that busy themselves overmuch, sin much also, being distracted about their business, and in no wise serving their own Lord.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: How then, saith he, can such a man ask anything of the Lord and receive it, seeing that he serveth not the Lord?

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: [For] they that serve Him, these shall receive their petitions, but they that serve not the Lord, these shall receive nothing.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: But if any one work one single action, he is able also to serve the Lord;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: for his mind shall not be corrupted from  the Lord, but he shall serve Him, because he keepeth his mind pure.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: If therefore thou doest these things, thou shalt be able to bear fruit unto the world to come;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: ANOTHER PARABLE.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: As I was fasting and seated on a certain mountain, and giving thanks to the Lord for all that He had done unto me, I see the morn?

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: “Because, Sir, say I, I am keeping a station.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: What, saith he, is a station?

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: I am fasting, Sir, say I.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And what, saith he, is this fast?

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: As I was accustomed, Sir, say I, so I fast.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Ye know not, saith he, how to fast unto the Lord, neither is this a fast, this unprofitable fast which ye make unto Him.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Wherefore, Sir, say I, sayest thou this?

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: I tell thee, saith he, that this is not a fast, wherein ye think to fast;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: but I will teach thee what is a complete fast and acceptable to the Lord.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Listen, saith he;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: God desireth not such a vain fast;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
