text: for by so fasting unto God thou shalt do nothing for righteousness.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: But fast thou such a fast as this;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: do no wickedness in thy life, and serve the Lord with a pure heart;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: observe His commandments and walk in His ordinances, and let no evil desire rise up in thy heart;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: but believe God.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Then, if thou shalt do these things, and fear Him, and control thyself from every evil deed, thou shalt live unto God;536

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and if thou do these things, thou shalt accomplish a great fast, and one acceptable to God.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Hear the parable which I shall tell thee relating to fasting.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: A certain man had an estate, and many slaves, and a portion of his estate he planted as a vineyard;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and choosing out a certain slave who was trusty and well-pleasing (and) held in honour, he called him to him and saith unto him:

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: “Take this vineyard, and fence it [till I come], but do nothing else to the vineyard.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Now keep this my commandment, and thou shalt be free in my house.”

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Then the master of the servant went away to travel abroad.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: When then he had gone away, the servant took and fenced the vineyard;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and having finished the fencing of the vineyard, he noticed that the vineyard was full of weeds.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: So he reasoned within himself, saying, “ This command of my lord I have carried out.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: I will next dig this vineyard, and it shall be neater when it is digged;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and when it hath no weeds it will yield more fruit, because not choked by the weeds.”

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: He took and digged the vineyard, and all the weeds that were in the vineyard he plucked up.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And that vineyard became very neat and flourishing, when it had no weeds to choke it.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: After a time the master of the servant came, and he went into the vineyard.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And seeing the vineyard fenced neatly, and digged as well, and [all] the weeds plucked up, and the vines flourishing, he rejoiced [exceedingly] at what his servant had done.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: So he called his beloved son, who was his heir,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and the friends who were his advisers, and told them what he had commanded his servant, and how much he had found done.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And they rejoiced with the servant at the testimony which his master had borne to him.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And he saith to them;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: “I promised this servant his freedom, if he should keep the commandment which I commanded him;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: but he kept my commandment and did a good work besides to my

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: For this work therefore which he has done, I desire to make him joint-heir with my son, because, when the good thought struck him, he did not neglect it, but fulfilled it.”

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: In this purpose the son of the master agreed with him, that the servant should be made joint-heir with the son.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: After some few days, his master made a feast, and sent to him many dainties from the feast.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: But when the servant received [the dainties sent to him by the master], he took what was sufficient for him, and distributed the rest to his fellow-servants.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And his fellow-servants, when they received the dainties, rejoiced, and began to pray for him,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: that he might find greater favour with the master, because he had treated them so handsomely.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: All these things which had taken place his master heard, and again rejoiced greatly at his deed.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: So the master called together again his friends and his son, and announced to them the deed that he had done with regard to his dainties which he had received;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: I say, Sir, I understand not these parables, neither can I apprehend thee, saith he;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and will show thee whatsoever things I shall speak with thee.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Keep the commandments of the Lord, and thou shalt be well- pleasing to God, and shalt be enrolled among the number of them that keep His commandments.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: But if thou do any good thing outside the commandment of God, thou shalt win for thyself more exceeding glory, and shalt be more glorious in the sight of God than thou wouldest otherwise have been.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: If then, while thou keepest the commandments of God, thou add these services likewise, thou shalt rejoice, if thou observe them according to my commandment.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: I say to him, Sir, whatsoever thou commandest me, I will keep it;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: for I know that thou art with me.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: I will be with thee, saith he, because thou hast so great zeal for doing good;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: yea, and I will be with all, saith he, whosoever have such zeal as this.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: This fasting, saith he, if the commandments of the Lord are kept, is very good.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: This then is the way, that thou shalt keep this fast [which thou art about to observe].538

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: First of all, keep thyself from every evil word and every evil desire, and purify thy heart from all the vanities of this world.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: If thou keep these things, this fast shall be perfect for thee.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And thus shalt thou do.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Having fulfilled what is written, on that day on which thou fastest thou shalt taste nothing but bread and water;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and from thy meats, which thou wouldest have eaten,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: thou shalt reckon up the amount of that days expenditure, which thou wouldest have incurred,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and shalt give it to a widow, or an orphan, or to one in want,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and so shalt thou humble thy soul, that he that hath received from thy humiliation may satisfy his own soul, and may pray for thee to the Lord.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: If then thou shalt so accomplish this fast, as I have commanded thee, thy sacrifice shall be acceptable in the sight of God, and this fasting shall be recorded;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and the service so performed is beautiful and joyous and acceptable to the Lord.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: These things thou shalt so observe, thou and thy children and thy whole household;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and, observing them, thou shalt be blessed;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: I entreated him earnestly,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: that he would show me the parable of the fenced the vineyard, [and of the fence,]

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and of the weeds which were plucked up out of the vineyard, and of the son, and of the friends, the advisers.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: For I understood that all these things are a parable.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: but he answered and said unto me;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Thou art exceedingly importunate in enquiries.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Thou oughtest not, to make any enquiry at all;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: for if it be right that a thing be explained unto thee, it shall be explained.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: I say to him;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Sir, whatsoever things thou showest unto me and dost not explain, I shall have seen them in vain, and without understanding what they are.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: In like manner also, if thou speak parables to me and interpret them not, I shall have heard a thing in vain from thee.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Whosoever, saith he, is a servant of God, and hath his own Lord in his heart, asketh understanding of Him,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and receiveth it, and interpreteth every parable, and the words of the Lord which are spoken in parables are made known unto him.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: But as many as are sluggish and idle in intercession, these hesitate to ask of the Lord.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: But the Lord is abundant in compassion, and giveth to them that ask of Him without ceasing.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: But thou who hast been strengthened by the holy angel, and hast received from him such (powers of) intercession and art not idle, wherefore dost thou not ask understanding of the Lord, and obtain it from Him?

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: I say to him, Sir, I that have thee with me have  need to ask thee and enquire of thee;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: for thou showest me all things, and speakest with me;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: but if I had seen or heard them apart from thee I should have asked of the Lord, that they might be shown to me.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: I told thee just now, saith he, that thou art unscrupulous and importunate, in enquiring for the interpretations of the parables.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: But since thou art so obstinate, I will interpret to thee the parable of the estate and all the accompaniments thereof, that thou mayest make them known unto all.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Hear now, saith he, and understand them.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: The estate is this world, and the lord of the estate is He that created all things, and set them in order, and endowed them with power;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and the servant is the Son of God, and the vines are this people whom He Himself planted;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and the fences are the angels of the Lord who keep together His people;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and the weeds, which are plucked up from the vineyard, are the transgressions of the servants of God;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and the dainties which He sent to him from the feast are the commandments which He gave to His people through His Son;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and the friends and advisers are the holy angels which were first created;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and the absence of the master is the time which remaineth over until His coming.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: I say to him;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Sir, great and marvelous are all things and all things are glorious;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: was it likely then, say I, that I could have apprehended them?540

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Nay, nor can any other man, though he be full of understanding, apprehend them.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Yet again, Sir, say I, explain to me what I am about to enquire of thee.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Say on, he saith, if thou desirest anything.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Listen, said he;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: the Son of God is not represented in the guise of a I;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: I comprehend not.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Because, saith he, God planted the vineyard, that is, He created the people, and delivered them over to His Son.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And the Son placed the angels in charge of them, to watch over them;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and the Son Himself cleansed their sins, by labouring much and enduring many toils;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: for no one can dig without toil or labour.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Having Himself then cleansed the sins of His people, He showed them the paths of life, giving them the law which He received from His Father.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Thou seest, saith he, that He is Himself Lord of the people, having received all power from His Father.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: But how that the lord took his son and the glorious angels as advisers concerning the inheritance of the servant, listen.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: The Holy Pre-existent Spirit, Which created the whole creation, God made to dwell in flesh that He desired.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: This flesh, therefore, in which the Holy Spirit dwelt, was subject unto the Spirit, walking honourably in holiness and purity, without in any way defiling the Spirit.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: When then it had lived honourably in chastity,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and had laboured with the Spirit, and had cooperated with it in everything, behaving itself boldly and bravely, He chose it as a partner with the Holy Spirit;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: for the career of this flesh pleased, seeing that, as possessing the Holy Spirit, it was not defiled upon the earth.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: He therefore took the son as adviser and the glorious angels also,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: that this flesh too, having served the Spirit unblameably, might have some place of sojourn, and might not seem to have lost the reward for its service;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: for all flesh, which is found undefiled and unspotted, wherein the Holy Spirit dwelt, shall receive a reward.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: I was right glad, Sir, say I, to hear this interpretation.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Listen now, saith he.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Keep this thy flesh pure and undefiled, that the Spirit justified.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: See that it never enter into thine heart that this flesh of thine is perishable, and so thou abuse it in come defilement.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: [For] if thou defile thy flesh, thou shalt defile the Holy Spirit also;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: but if thou defile +the flesh, thou shalt not live.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: But if, Sir, say I, there has been any ignorance in times past, before these words were heard, how shall a man who has defiled his flesh be saved?

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: For the former deeds of ignorance, saith he, God alone hath power to give healing;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: for all authority is His.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: [But now keep thyself, and the Lord Almighty, Who is full of compassion, will give healing for thy former deeds of ignorance,] if henceforth thou defile not thy flesh, neither the Spirit;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: for both share in common, and the one cannot be defiled without the other.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: [PARABLE THE SIXTH].

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: As I sat in my house, and glorified the Lord for all things that I had seen, and was considering concerning the glorious and able to save a mans soul, I said within myself;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Blessed shall I be, if I walk in these commandments;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: yea, and whosoever shall walk in them shall be blessed.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: As I spake these things within thyself, I see him suddenly seated by me, and saying as follows;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Why art thou of a doubtful mind concerning the commandments, which I commanded thee?

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: They are beautiful.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Doubt not at all;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: but clothe thyself in the faith of the Lord, and thou shalt walk in them.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: For I will strengthen thee in them.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: These commandments are suitable for those who meditate repentance for if they walk not in them, their repentance is in vain.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Ye then that repent, cast away the evil doings of this world which crush you;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and, by putting on every excellence of righteousness, ye shall be able to observe these commandments, and to add no more to your sins.542

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: If then ye add no further sin at all, ye will depart from your former sins.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Walk then in these my commandments, and ye shall live unto God.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: These things have been told you from me.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And after he had told these things to me, he saith to me, Let us go into the country, and I will show thee the shepherds of the sheep.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Let us go, Sir, say I.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And we came to a certain plain, and he showeth me a young man, a shepherd, clothed in a light cloak, of saffron colour;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and he was feeding a great number of sheep, and these sheep were, as it were, well fed and very frisky, and were gladsome as they skipped about hither and thither;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and the shepherd himself was all gladsome over his flock;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and the very visage of the shepherd was exceedingly gladsome;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and he ran about among the sheep.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And he saith to me;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Seest thou this shepherd?

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: I see him, Sir, I say.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: This, saith he, is the angel of self-indulgence and of deceit.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: He crusheth the souls of the servants of God, and perverteth them from the truth, leading them astray with evil desires, wherein they perish.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: For they forget the commandments of the living God, and walk in vain deceits and acts of self-indulgence, and are destroyed by this angel, some of them unto death, and others unto corruption.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: I say to him, Sir, I comprehend not what means “unto death,” and what “unto corruption”.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Listen, saith he;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: the sheep which thou sawest gladsome and skipping about, these are they who have been turned asunder from God utterly, and have delivered themselves over to the lusts of this world.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: In these, therefore, there is not repentance unto life.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: For the Name of God is being blasphemed through them.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: The life of such persons is death.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: But the sheep, which thou sawest not skipping about, but feeding in one place,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: these are they that have delivered themselves over to acts of self- indulgence and deceit, but have not uttered any blasphemy against

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: These then have been corrupted from the truth.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: In these there is hope of repentance, wherein they can live.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Corruption then hath hope of a possible renewal, but death hath eternal destruction.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Again we went forward a little way, and he showeth me a great shepherd like a wild man in appearance, with a white goatskin thrown about him;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and he had a kind of wallet on his shoulders, and a staff very hard and with knots in it, and a great whip.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And his look was very sour, so that I was afraid of him because of his look.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: This shepherd then kept receiving from the young man, the shepherd,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: those sheep that were frisky and well-fed,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: but not skipping about, and putting them in a certain spot,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: which was precipitous and covered with thorns and briars, so that the sheep could not disentangle themselves from the thorns and briars, but [became entangled among the thorns and briars.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And so they] pastured entangled in the thorns and briars, and were in great misery with being beaten by him;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and he kept driving them about to and fro, and giving them no rest, and altogether those sheep had not a happy time.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: When then I saw them so lashed with the whip and vexed, I was sorry for their sakes, because they were so tortured and had no rest at all.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: I say to the shepherd who was speaking with me;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Sir, who is this shepherd, who is hard-hearted and severe, and has no compassion at all for these sheep?

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: This, saith he, is the angel of punishment, and he is one of the just angels, and presides over punishment.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: So he receiveth those who wander away from God, and walk after the lusts and deceits of this life, and punisheth them, as they deserve, with fearful and various punishments.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: I would fain learn, Sir, say I, of what sort are these various punishments.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Listen, saith he;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: the various tortures and punishments are tortures belonging to the present life;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: for some are punished with losses, and others with want,544

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and others with divers maladies, and others with of unsettlement, and others with insults from unworthy persons and with suffering in many other respects.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: For many, being unsettled in their plans, set their hands to many things, and nothing ever goes forward with them.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And then they say that they do not prosper in their doings, and it doth not enter into their hearts that they have done evil deeds, but they blame the Lord.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: When then they are afflicted with every kind of affliction,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: then they are delivered over to me for good instruction, and are strengthened in the faith of the Lord, and serve the Lord with a pure heart the remaining days of their life.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: But, if they repent, the evil works which they have done rise up in their hearts,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and then they glorify God, saying that He is a just Judge, and that they suffered justly each according to his doings.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And they serve the Lord thenceforward with a pure heart, and are prosperous in all their doings, receiving from the Lord whatsoever things they may ask;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: I say unto him;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Sir, declare unto me this further matter.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: What self-indulgence and are deceived undergo torments during the same length of time as they live in self-indulgence and are deceived.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: He saith to me, They undergo torments for the same length of time.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Then, Sir, say I, they undergo very slight torments;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: for those who are living thus in self-indulgence and forget God ought to have been tormented sevenfold.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: He saith to me, Thou art foolish, and comprehendest not the power of the torment.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: True, say I, for if I had comprehended it, I should not have asked thee to declare it to me.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Listen, saith he, to the power of both, [of the self-indulgence and of the torment].

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: The time of the self-indulgence and deceit is one hour.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: But an hour of the torment hath the power of thirty days.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: If then one live in self-indulgence and be deceived for one day, and be tormented for one day, the day of the torment is equivalent to a whole year.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: For as many days then as a man lives in self-indulgence, for so

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Thou seest then, saith he, that the time of the self-indulgence and deceit is very short, but the time of the punishment and torment is long.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Inasmuch, Sir, say I, as I do not quite comprehend concerning the time of the deceit and self-indulgence and torment, show me more clearly.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: He answered and said unto me;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Thy stupidity cleaveth to thee;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and thou wilt not cleanse thy heart and serve God.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Take heed, lest haply the time be fulfilled, and thou be found in thy foolishness.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Listen then, even as thou wishest, that thou mayest comprehend the matter.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: He that liveth in self-indulgence and is deceived for one day, and doeth what he wisheth, is clothed in much folly and comprehendeth not the thing which he doeth;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: for on the morrow he forgetteth what he did the day before.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: For self-indulgence and deceit have no memories, by reason of the folly, wherewith each is clothed;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: but when punishment and torment cling to a man for a single day, he is punished and tormented for a whole year long;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: for punishment and torment have long memories.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: So being tormented and punished for the whole year, the man remembers at length the self-indulgence and deceit, and perceiveth that it is on their account that he is suffering these ills.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Every man, therefore, that liveth in self-indulgence and is deceived, is tormented in this way because, though possessing life, they have delivered themselves over unto death.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: What kinds of self-indulgence, Sir, say I, are harmful?

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: “Every action, saith he, is self-indulgence to a man, which he does with pleasure;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: for the irascible man, when he gives the reins to his passion, is self-indulgent;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and the adulterer and the drunkard and the slanderer and the liar and the miser and the defrauder and he that doeth things akin to these, giveth the reins to his peculiar passion;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: therefore he is self-indulgent in his action.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: All these habits of self-indulgence are harmful to the servants of God;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: on account of these deceits therefore they so suffer who are punished and tormented.546

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: But there are habits of self-indulgence likewise which save men;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: for many are self-indulgent in doing good, being carried away by the pleasure it gives to themselves.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: This self-indulgence then is expedient for the servants of God, and bringeth life to a man of this disposition;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: but the harmful self-indulgencies afore-mentioned bring to men torments and punishments;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: [PARABLE THE SEVENTH].

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: After a few days I saw him on the same plain, where also I had seen the shepherds, and he saith to me, What seekest punisheth go out of My house;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: for he afflicteth me much.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: It is necessary for thee, saith he, to be afflicted;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: for so, saith he, the glorious angel ordered as concerning thee, for he wisheth thee to be proved.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Why, what so evil thing have I done, Sir, say I, that I should be delivered over to this angel?

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: “ Listen, saith he.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Thy sins are many, yet not so many that thou shouldest be delivered over to this angel;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: but thy house has committed great iniquities and sins,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and the glorious angel was embittered at their deeds,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and for this cause he made thee be afflicted for a certain time, that they also might repent and cleanse themselves from every lust of this world.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: When therefore they shall repent and be cleansed, then shall the angel of punishment depart.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: I say to him;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Sir, if they perpetrated such deeds that the glorious angel is embittered, what have I done?

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: They cannot be afflicted otherwise, saith he, unless thou, the head of the [whole] house, be afflicted;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: for if thou be afflicted, they also of necessity will be afflicted;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: but if thou be prosperous, they can suffer no affliction.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: But behold, Sir, say I, they have repented with their whole heart.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: I am quite aware myself, saith he, that they have repented with their whole heart;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: well, thinkest thou that the sins of those who repent are forgiven forthwith?

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: but the person who repents must torture his own soul, and must be thoroughly humble in his every action, and be afflicted with all the divers kinds of affliction;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and if he endure the afflictions which come upon him, assuredly He Who created all things and endowed them with power will be moved with compassion and will bestow some remedy.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: But why speak I many words to thee?

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Thou must be afflicted as the angel of the Lord commanded, even he that delivered thee unto me;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and for this give thanks to the Lord, in that He deemed thee worthy that I should reveal unto thee beforehand the affliction, that foreknowing it thou mightest endure it with fortitude.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: I say to him;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Sir, be thou with, me, and I shall be able to endure all affliction [easily].

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: I will be with thee, saith he;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and I will ask the angel that punisheth to afflict thee more lightly;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: but thou shalt be afflicted for a short time, and thou shalt be restored again to thy house.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Only continue to be humble and to minister unto the Lord with a pure heart,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: thou and thy children and thy house, and walk in my commandments which I command thee, and thus it will be possible for thy repentance to be strong and pure.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And if thou keep these commandments with thy household, all affliction shall hold aloof from thee;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: [PARABLE THE EIGHTH].

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: He showed me a willow, overshadow are called by the name of the Lord.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And by the willow there stood an angel of the Lord, glorious and very tall, having a great sickle,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and he was lopping branches from the willow, and giving them to the people that sheltered beneath the willow;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and he gave them little rods about a cubit long.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And after all had taken the rods, the angel laid aside the sickle, and the tree was sound, just as I had seen it.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Then I marvelled within myself, saying, How is the tree sound after so many branches have been lopped off?548

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: The shepherd saith to me, Marvel not that the tree remained sound, after so many branches were lopped off;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: but wait until thou seest all things, and it shall be shown to thee what it is.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: The angel who gave the rods to the people demanded them back from them again;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and according as they had received them, so also they were summoned to him, and each of them returned the several rods.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: But the angel of the Lord took them, and examined them.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: From some he received the rods withered and eaten as it were by grubs:

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: the angel ordered those who gave up rods like these to stand apart.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And others gave them up withered, but not grub-eaten;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and these again he ordered to stand apart.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And others gave them up half-withered;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: these also stood apart.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And others gave up their rods half-withered and with cracks;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: these also stood apart.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And others gave up their rods green and with cracks;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: these also stood apart.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And others gave up their rods one half withered and one half green;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: these also stood apart.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And others brought their rods two parts of the rod green, and the third part withered;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: these also stood apart.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And others gave them up two parts withered, and the third part green;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: these also stood apart.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And others gave up their rods nearly all green, but a very small portion of their rods was withered, just the end;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: but they had cracks in them;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: these also stood apart.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And in those of others there was a very small portion green, but the rest of the rods was withered;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: these also stood apart.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And others came bringing their rods green, as they received them from the angel;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and the most part of the multitude gave up their rods in this state;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and the angel rejoiced exceedingly at these;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: these also stood apart.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: these also stood apart;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and at these again the angel rejoiced exceedingly.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And others gave up their rods green and with shoots;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and their shoots had, as it were, a kind of fruit.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And those men were exceeding gladsome, whose rods were found in this state.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And over them the angel exulted, and the shepherd was very gladsome over them.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And the angel of the Lord commanded crowns to be brought.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And crowns were brought, made as it were of palm-branches;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and he crowned the men that had given up the rods which had the shoots and some fruit, and sent them away into the tower.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And the others also he sent into the tower, even those who had given up the rods green and with shoots, but the shoots were without fruit;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and he set a seal upon them.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And all they that went into the tower had the same raiment, white as snow.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And those that had given up their rods green as they received them, he sent away, giving them a [white] robe, and seals.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: After the angel had finished these things, he saith to the shepherd;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: I go away;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: but these thou shall send away to  the walls, according as each deserveth to dwell;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: but examine their rods carefully, and so send them away.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: But be careful in examining them.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Take heed lest any escape thee, saith he.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Still if any escape thee, I will test then, at the altar.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: When he had thus spoken to the shepherd, he departed.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And, after the angel had departed, the shepherd saith to me;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Let us take the rods of all and plant them, to see whether any of them shall be able to live.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: I say unto him, Sir, these withered things, how can they live?

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: He answered and said unto me;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: This tree is a willow, and this class of trees clingeth to life.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: If then the rods shall be planted and get a little moisture, many of them will live.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And afterwards let us try to pour some water also over them.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: If any of them shall be able to live, I will rejoice with it;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: but if it live not, I at least shall not be found neglectful.550

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: So the shepherd made me call them, just as each one of them was stationed.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And they came row after row, and they delivered up the rods to the shepherd.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And the shepherd took the rods, and planted them in rows, and after he had planted them, he poured much water over them, so that the rods could not be seen for the water.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And after he had watered the rods, he saith to me;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Let us go now, and after a few days let us return and inspect all the rods;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: for He Who created this tree willeth that all those who have received rods from this tree should live.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: I say to him;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Sir, inform me what this tree is.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: For I am perplexed and nothing appears to have been cut from it;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: I am therefore perplexed thereat.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Listen, saith he;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: this great tree which overshadows plains and mountains and all the earth is the law of God which was given to the whole world;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and this law is the Son of God preached unto the ends of the earth.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: But the people that are under the shadow are they that have heard the preaching, and believed on Him;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: but the great and glorious angel is Michael, who hath the power over this people and is their captain.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: For this is he that putteth the law into the hearts of the believers;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: therefore he himself inspecteth them to whom he gave it, to see whether they have observed it.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: But thou seest the rods of every one;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: for the rods are the law.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Thou seest these many rods rendered useless, and thou shalt notice all those that have not observed the law, and shalt see the abode of each severally.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: I say unto him;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Sir, wherefore did he send away some into the tower, and leave others for thee?

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: As many, saith he, as transgressed the law which they received from him, these he left under my authority for repentance;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: but as many as already satisfied the law and have observed it,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Who then, Sir, say I, are they that have been crowned and go into the tower?

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: [As many, saith he, as wrestled with the devil and overcame him in their wrestling, are crowned:]

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: these are they that suffered for the law.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: But the others, who likewise gave up their rods green and with shoots,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: though not with fruit, are they that were persecuted for the law, but did not suffer nor yet deny their law.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: But they that gave them up green just as they received them, are sober and righteous men, who walked altogether in a pure heart and have kept the commandments of the Lord.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And after a few days we came to the place, and the shepherd sat down thyself with a garment of raw flax, and minister to me.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: So I girded myself with a clean garment of raw flax made of coarse material.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And when he saw me girded and ready to minister to him, Call, saith he, the men whose rods have been planted, according to the rank as each presented their rods.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And I went away to the plain, and called them all;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and they stood all of them according to their ranks.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: He saith to them;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Let each man pluck out his own rod, and bring it to me.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Those gave them up first, who had had the withered and chipped rods, and they were found accordingly withered and chipped.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: He ordered them to stand apart.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Then those gave them up, who had the withered but not chipped;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and some of them gave up the rods green, and others withered and chipped as by grubs.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Those then that gave them up green he ordered to stand apart;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: but those that gave them up withered and chipped he ordered to stand with the first.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Then those gave them up who had had the half-withered and with cracks;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and many of them gave them up green and without cracks;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and some gave them up green and with shoots, and fruits on the shoots, such as those had who went into the tower crowned;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and some gave them up withered and eaten, and some withered and uneaten, and some such as they were, half-withered and with cracks.552

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: He ordered them to stand each one apart, some in their proper ranks, and others apart.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Then those gave them up who had their rods green, but with cracks.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: These all gave them up green, and stood in their own company.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And the shepherd rejoiced over these, because they all were changed and had put away their cracks.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And those gave them up likewise who had the one half green and the other half withered.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: The rods of some were found entirely green, of some half-withered, of some withered and eaten, and of some green and with shoots.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: These were all sent away each to his company.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Then those gave them up who had two parts green and the third withered;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: many of them gave them up green, and many half-withered, and others withered and eaten.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: These all stood in their own company.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Then those gave them up who had two parts withered and the third part green.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Many of them gave them up half-withered, but some withered and eaten, others half-withered and with cracks, and a few green.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: These all stood in their own company.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Then those gave them up who had had their rods green, but a very small part [withered] and with cracks.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Of these some gave them up green, and others green and with shoots.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: These also went away to their own company.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Then those gave them up who had a very small part green and the other parts withered.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: The rods of these were found for the most part green and with shoots and fruit on the shoots, and others altogether green.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: At these rods the shepherd rejoiced very, because they were found so.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And these went away each to his own company.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: After had examined the rods of all, he saith to me, I told thee that this tree clingeth to life.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Seest thou, saith he, how many repented and were saved?

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: It is, saith he, that thou mayest see the abundant compassion of the Lord, how great and glorious it is,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and He hath given  Spirit to those that are worthy of repentance.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Wherefore then, Sir, say I, did they not all repent?

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: To those, whose heart He saw about to become pure and to serve Him with all the heart, to them He gave repentance;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: but those whose craftiness and wickedness He saw who intend to repent in hypocrisy, to them He gave not repentance, lest haply they should again profane His name.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: I say unto him,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Sir, now then show me concerning those that have given up their rods, what manner of man each of them is, and their abode,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: that when they hear this, they that believed and have received the seal and have broken it and did not keep it sound may fully understand what they are doing, and repent, receiving from thee a seal, and may glorify the Lord,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: that He had compassion upon them and sent thee to renew their spirits.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Listen, saith he;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: those whose rods were found withered and grub-eaten,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: these are the renegades and traitors to the Church, that blasphemed the Lord in their sins, and still further were ashamed of the Name of the Lord, which was invoked upon them.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: These then perished altogether unto God.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: But thou seest how not one of them repented, although they heard the words which thou spakest to them, which I commanded thee.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: From men of this kind life departed.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: But those that gave up the green and undecayed , these also are near them;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: for they were hypocrites,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and brought in strange doctrines, and perverted the servants of God, especially them that had sinned,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: not permitting them to repent, but persuading them with their foolish doctrines.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: These then have hope of repenting.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: But thou seest that many of them have indeed repented from the time when thou spakest to them my commandments;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: yea, and  still will repent.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And as many as shall not repent, have lost their life;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: but as many of them as repented, became good;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and their dwelling was placed within the first walls, and some of them even ascended into the tower.554

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Thou seest then, that repentance from sins bringeth life, but not to repent bringeth death.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: But as many as gave up  half-withered, and with cracks in them, hear also concerning these.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Those whose rods were half-withered throughout are the double- minded;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: for they neither live nor are dead.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: But those that have them half-withered and cracks in then,, these are both double-minded and slanderers, and are never at peace among themselves but always causing dissensions.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Yet even to these, repentance is given.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Thou seest, that some of them have repented;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and there is still, saith he, hope of repentance among them.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And as many of them, saith he, as have repented, have their abode within the tower but as many of them as have repented tardily shall abide within the walls;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and as many as repent not, but continue in their doings, shall die the death.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: But they that have given up their rods green and with cracks, these were found faithful and good at all times, [but] they have a certain emulation one with another about first places and about glory of some kind or other;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: but all these are foolish in having  one with another about first places.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Yet these also, when they heard my commandments, being good, purified themselves and repented quickly.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: They have their habitation, therefore, within the tower.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: But if any one shall again turn to dissension, he shall be cast out from the tower and shall lose his life.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Life is for all those that keep the commandments of the Lord.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: But in the commandments there is nothing about first places, or about glory of any kind, but about long-suffering and humility in man.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: In such men, therefore, is the life of the Lord, but in factious and lawless men is death.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: But they that gave up their rods half green and half withered, these are they that are mixed up in business and cleave not to the saints.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Therefore the one half of them liveth, but the other half is dead.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: As many then as repented, have their abode within the tower.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: But some of them altogether stood aloof.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: These then have no repentance;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: for by reason of their business affairs they blasphemed the Lord and denied Him.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: So they lost their life for the wickedness that they committed.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: But many of them were doubtful-minded.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: These still have place for repentance, if they repent quickly, and their dwelling shall be within the tower;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and if they repent tardily, they shall dwell within the walls;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: but if they repent not, they too have lost their life.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: But they that have given up two parts green and the third part withered, these are they that have denied with manifold denials.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Many of them therefore repented, and departed to dwell inside the tower;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: but many utterly rebelled from God;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: these lost their life finally.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And some of them were double-minded and caused dissensions.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: For these then there is repentance, if they repent speedily and continue not in their pleasures;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: but if they continue in their doings, they likewise procure for themselves death.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: But they that have given up their rods two thirds withered and one third green, these are men who have been believers, but grew rich and became renowned among the Gentiles.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: They clothed themselves with great pride and became high- minded,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and abandoned the truth and did not cleave to the righteous, but lived together after the manner of the Gentiles, and the path appeared the more pleasant unto them;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: yet they departed not from God, but continued in the faith, though they wrought not the works of the faith.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Many of them therefore repented, and they had their habitation within the tower.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: But others at the last living with the Gentiles, and being corrupted the vain opinions of the Gentiles, departed from God, and worked the works of the Gentiles.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: These therefore were numbered with the Gentiles.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: But others of them were doubtful-minded, not hoping to be saved by reason of the deeds that they had done;556

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and others were double-minded and made divisions among themselves.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: For these then that were double-minded by reason of their doings there is still repentance;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: but their repentance ought to be speedy, that their dwelling may be within the tower;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: but for those who repent not, but continue in their pleasures, death is nigh.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: But they that gave up their rods green, yet with the extreme ends withered and with cracks;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: these were found at all times good and faithful and glorious in the sight of God,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: but they sinned to a very slight degree by reason of little desires and because they had somewhat against one another.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: But, when they heard my words, the greater part quickly repented, and their dwelling was assigned within the tower.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: But some of them were double-minded, and some being double- minded made a greater dissension.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: In these then there is still a hope of repentance, because they were found always good;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and hardly shall one of them die.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: But they that gave up their rods withered, yet with a very small part green, these are they that believed, but practised the works of lawlessness.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Still they never separated from God, but bore the Name gladly, and gladly received into their houses the servants of God.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: So hearing of this repentance they repented without wavering, and they practise all excellence and righteousness.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And some of them even suffer persecution willingly, knowing the deeds that they did.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: All these then shall have their dwelling within the tower.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And after he had completed the interpretations of all the rods, he saith unto me;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Go, and tell all men to repent, and they shall live unto God;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: for the Lord in His compassion sent me to give repentance to all, though some of them do not deserve it for their deeds;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: but being long-suffering the Lord willeth them that were called through His Son to be saved.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Sir, I hope that all when they hear these words will repent;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: for I am persuaded that each one, when he fully knows his own deeds and fears God, will repent.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: He answered and said unto me;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: As many, as from their whole heart shall cleanse themselves from all the evil deeds afore-mentioned,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and shall add nothing further to their sins,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: shall receive healing from the Lord for their former sins, unless they be double-minded concerning these commandments, and they shall live unto God.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: [But as many, saith he, as shall add to their sins and walk in the lusts of this world, shall condemn themselves to death.]

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: But do thou walk in my commandments, and live [unto God;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: yea, and as many as shall walk in them and shall do rightly, shall live unto God.]

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Having shown me all these things he saith to me;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: [PARABLE THE NINTH].

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: After I had written down the commandments and parables of the shepherd, the angel of repentance, he came to me and saith with thee in the form of the Church, showed unto thee.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: For that Spirit is the Son of God.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: For when thou wast weaker in the flesh, it was not declared unto thee through an angel;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: but when thou wast enabled through the Spirit, and didst grow mighty in thy strength so that thou couldest even see an angel,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: then at length was manifested unto thee, through the Church, the building of the tower.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: In fair and seemly manner hast thou seen all things,  as it were by a virgin;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: but now thou seest (being instructed by an angel, though by the same Spirit;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: yet must thou learn everything more accurately from me.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: For to this end also was I appointed by the glorious angel to dwell in thy house, that thou mightest see all things mightily, in nothing terrified, even as before.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And he took me away into Arcadia, to a certain rounded mountain, and set me on the top of the mountain, and showed me a great plain, and round the plain twelve mountains, the mountains having each a different appearance.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: The first was black as soot;558

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: the second was bare, without vegetation;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: the third was thorny and full of briars;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: the fourth had the vegetation half-withered, the upper part of the grass green, but the part by the roots withered, and some of the grass became withered, whenever the sun had scorched it;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: the fifth mountain had green grass and was rugged;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: the sixth mountain was full with clefts throughout, some small and some great, and the clefts had vegetation,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: but the grass was not very luxuriant, but rather as if it had been withered;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: the seventh mountain had smiling vegetation, and the whole mountain was in a thriving condition, and cattle and birds of every kind did feed upon that mountain;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and the more the cattle and the birds did feed, so much the more did the herbage of that mountain flourish.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: The eighth mountain was full of springs, and every kind of creature of the Lord did drink of the springs on that mountain.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: The ninth mountain had no water at all, and was entirely desert;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and it had in it wild beasts and deadly reptile, which destroy mankind.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: The tenth mountain had very large trees and was umbrageous throughout, and beneath the shade lay sheep resting and feeding.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: The eleventh mountain was thickly wooded all over, and the trees thereon were very productive, decked with divers kinds of fruits, so that one seeing then would desire to eat of their fruits.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: The twelfth mountain was altogether white and its aspect was cheerful;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and the mountain was most beauteous in itself 88.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And in the middle of the plain he showed me a great white rock, rising up from the plain.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: The rock was loftier than the mountains, being four-square, so that it could contain the whole world.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Now this rock was ancient, and had a gate hewn out of it;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: but the gate seemed to me to have been hewed out quite recently.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And the gate glistened beyond the brightness of the sun, so that I marvelled at the brightness of the gate.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And around the gate stood twelve virgins.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: The four then that stood at the corners seemed to me to be more glorious (than the rest);

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: but the others likewise were glorious;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and they stood at the four quarters of the gate, and virgins stood

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And they were clothed in linen tunics and girt about in seemly fashion, having their right shoulders free, as if they intended to carry some burden.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Thus were they prepared, for they were very cheerful and eager.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: After I had seen these things, I marvelled in myself at the greatness and the glory of what I was seeing.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And again I was perplexed concerning the virgins, that delicate as they were they stood up like men, as if they intended to carry the whole heaven.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And the shepherd saith unto me;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Why questionest thou within thyself and art perplexed, and bringest sadness on thyself?

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: For whatsoever things thou canst not comprehend, attempt them not, if thou art prudent;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: but entreat the Lord, that thou mayest receive understanding to comprehend them.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: What is behind thee thou canst not see, but what is before thee thou beholdest.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: The things therefore which thou canst not see, let alone, and trouble not thyself (about then);

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: but the things which thou seest, these master, and be not over curious about the rest;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: but I will explain unto thee all things whatsoever I shall show thee.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: I saw six men come, tall and glorious and alike in appearance;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and they summoned a multitude of men.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And the others also which came were tall men above the gate.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And there arose a great noise from those men who had come to build the tower, as they ran hither and thither round the gate.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: For the virgins standing round the gate told the men to hasten to build the tower.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Now the virgins had spread out their hands, as if they would take something from the men.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And the six men ordered stones to come up from a certain deep place, and to go to the building of the tower.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And there went up ten stones square and polished, hewn from a quarry.560

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And the six men called to the virgins, and ordered them to carry all the stones which should go unto the building of the tower, and to pass through the gate and to hand them to the men that were about to build the tower.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And the virgins laid the first ten stones that rose out of the deep on each other, and they carried them together, stone by stone.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And just as they stood together around the gate, in that order they carried them that seemed to be strong enough and had stooped under the corners of the stone, while the others stooped at the sides of the stone.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And so they carried all the stones.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And they carried them right through the gate, as they were ordered, and handed them to the men for the tower;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and these took the stones and builded.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Now the building of the tower was upon the great rock and above the gate.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Those ten stones then were joined together, and they covered the whole rock.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And these formed a foundation for the building of the tower.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And the gate supported the whole tower.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And, after the ten stones, other twenty-five stones came up from the deep, and these were fitted into the building of the tower, being carried by the virgins, like the former.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And after these thirty-five stones came up.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And these likewise were fitted into the tower.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And after these came up other forty stones, and these all were put into the building of the tower.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: So four rows were made in the foundations of the tower.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And  ceased coming up from the deep, and the builders likewise ceased for a little.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And again the six men ordered the multitude of the people to bring in stones from the mountains for the building of the tower.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: They were brought in accordingly from all the mountains, of various colours, shaped by the men, and were handed to the virgins;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and the virgins carried them right through the gate, and handed them in for the building of the tower.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And when the various stones were placed in the building, they became all alike and white, and they lost their various colours.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: But some stones were handed in by the men for the building, and these did not become bright;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: for they were not handed in by the virgins, nor had they been carried in through the gate.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: These stones then were unsightly in the building of the tower.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Then the six men, seeing the stones that were unsightly in the building, ordered them to be removed and carried [below] into their own place whence they were brought.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And they say to the men who were bringing the stones in;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Abstain for your parts altogether from handing in stones for the building;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: but place them by the tower, that the virgins may carry them through the gate, and hand them in for the building.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: For if, they be not carried in through the gate by the hands of these virgins, they cannot change their colours.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Labor not therefore, in vain.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And the building was finished on that day, yet was not the tower finally completed, for it was to be carried up [still] higher;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and there was a cessation in the building.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And the six men ordered the builders to retire for a short time [all of them], and to rest;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: but the virgins they ordered not to retire from the tower.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And me thought the virgins were left to guard the tower.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And after all had retired, I say to the shepherd;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: How is it, Sir, say I, that the building of the tower was not completed?

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: The tower, he saith, cannot yet he fully completed, until its master come and test this building, that if any stones be found crumbling, he may change them;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: for the tower is being built according to His will.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: I would fain know, Sir, say I,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: what is this building of this tower, and concerning the rock and gate, and the mountains, and the virgins, and the stones that came up from the deep, and were not shaped, hut went just as they were into the building;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and wherefore ten stones were first placed in the foundations,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: then twenty-five, then thirty-five, then forty,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and concerning the stones that had gone to the building and were removed again and put away in their own place-concerning all these things set thy soul at rest, Sir, and explain them to me.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: If, saith he, thou be not found possessed of an idle curiosity, thou shalt know all things.562

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: For after a few days we shall come here, and thou shalt see the sequel that overtaketh this tower and shalt understand all the parables accurately.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And after a few days we came to the place where we had sat, and he saith to me, Let us go to the tower;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: for the owner of the tower cometh to inspect it.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And we came to the tower, and there was no one at all by it, save the virgins alone.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And the shepherd asked the virgins whether the master of the tower had arrived.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And they said that he would be there directly to inspect the building.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And, behold, after a little while I see an array of many men coming, and in the midst a man of such lofty stature that he overtopped the tower.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And the six men who superintended the building walked with him on the right hand and on the left, and all they that worked at the building were with him, and many other glorious attendants around him.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And the virgins that watched the tower ran up and kissed him, and they began to walk by his side round the tower.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And that man inspected the building so carefully, that he felt each single stone;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and he held a rod in his hand and struck each single stone that was built in.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And when he smote, some of the stones became black as soot, others mildewed,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: others cracked, others broke off short, others became neither white nor black, others rough and not fitting in with the other stones, and others with many spots;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: these were the varied aspects of the stones which were found unsound for the building.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: So he ordered all these to be removed from the tower, and to be placed by the side of the tower, and other stones to be brought and put into their place.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And the builders asked him from what mountain he desired stones to be brought and put into their place.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And he would not have them brought from the mountains, but ordered them to be brought from a certain plain that was nigh at hand.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And the plain was dug, and stones were found there bright and

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And all the stones which there were anywhere in that plain were brought every one of them, and were carried through the gate by the virgins.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And the square stones were hewed, and set in the place of those which had been removed;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: but the round ones were not placed in the building, because they were too hard to be shaped, and to work on them was slow.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: So they were placed by the side of the tower, as though they were intended to be shaped and placed in the building;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: for they were very bright.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: So then, having accomplished these things,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: the glorious man who was lord of the whole tower called the shepherd to him,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and delivered unto him all the stones which lay by the side of the tower, which were cast out from the building, and saith unto him;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Clean these stones carefully, and set them in the building of the tower, these, I mean, which can fit with the rest;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: but those which will not fit, throw far away from the tower.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Having given these orders to the shepherd, he departed from the tower with all those with whom he had come.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And the virgins stood round the tower watching it.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: I say to the shepherd, How can these stones go again to the building of the tower, seeing that they have been disapproved?

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: He saith unto me in answer;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Seest thou, saith he, these stones?

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: I see them, Sir, say I.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: I myself, saith he, will shape the greater part of these stones and put them into the building, and they shall fit in with the remaining stones.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: How, Sir, say I, can they, when they are chiseled, fill the same space?

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: He saith unto me in answer, As many as shall be found small, shall be put into the middle of the building;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: but as many as are larger, shall be placed nearer the outside, and they will bind them together.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: With these words he saith to me, Let us go away, and after two days let us come and clean these stones, and put them into the building;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: for all things round the tower must be made clean,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: lest haply the master come suddenly and find the circuit of the tower dirty,564

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and he be wroth, and so these stones shall not go to the building of the tower, and I shall appear to be careless in my masters sight.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And after two days we came to the tower, and he saith unto me;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Let us inspect all the stones, and see those which can go to the building.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: I say to him, Sir, let us inspect them.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And so commencing first we began to inspect the black stones;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and just as they were when set aside from the building, such also they were found.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And the shepherd ordered them to be removed from the tower and to be put on one side.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Then he inspected those that were mildewed, and he took and shaped many of them, and ordered the virgins to take them up and put them into the building.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And the virgins took them up and placed them in the building of the tower in a middle position.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: But the rest he ordered to be placed with the black ones;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: for these also were found black.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Then he began to inspect those that had the cracks;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and of these he shaped many, and he ordered them to be carried away by the hands of the virgins for the building.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And they were placed towards the outside, because they were found to be sounder.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: But the rest could not be shaped owing to the number of the cracks.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: For this reason therefore they were cast aside front the building of the tower.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Then he proceeded to inspect the stunted , and many among them were found black, and some had contracted great cracks;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and he ordered these also to be placed with those that had been cast aside.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: But those of them which remained he cleaned and shaped, and ordered to he placed in the building.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: So the virgins took them up, and fitted them into the middle of the building of the tower;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: for they were somewhat weak.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Then he began to inspect those that were half white and half black, and many of them were (now) found black;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and he ordered these also to be taken up with those that had been

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: *But all the rest were taken up by the virgins;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: for being white they were fitted by them[selves] into the building.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
