text: *But they were placed towards the outside, because they were found sound, so that they could hold together those that were placed in the middle;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: for not a single one of them was too short.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Then he began to inspect the hard and rough;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and a few of them were cast away, because they could not be shaped;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: for they were found very hard.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: But the rest of them were shaped and fitted into the middle of the building of the tower;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: for they were somewhat weak.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Then he proceeded to inspect those that had the spots, and of these some few had turned black and were cast away among the rest;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: but the remainder were found bright and sound, and these were fitted by the virgins into the building;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: but they were placed towards the outside, owing to their strength.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Then he came to inspect the white and round stones, and he saith unto me;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: What shall we do with these stones?

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: How do I know, Sir?

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: say I.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: [And he saith to me,] Perceivest thou nothing concerning them?

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: I, Sir, say I, do not possess this art, neither am I a mason, nor can I understand.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Seest thou not, saith he, that they are very round;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and if I wish to make them square, very much must needs be chiseled off from them?

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Yet some of them must of necessity be placed into the building.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: If then, Sir, say I, it must needs be so, why distress thyself, and why not choose out for the building those thou willest, and fit them into it?

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: He chose out from them the large and the bright ones, and shaped them;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and the virgins took them up, and fitted them into the outer parts of the building.566

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: But the rest, which remained over, were taken up, and put aside into the plain whence they were brought;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: they were not however cast away, Because, saith he, there remaineth still a little of the tower to be builded.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And the master of the tower is exceedingly anxious that these stones be fitted into the building, for they are very bright.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: So twelve women were called, most beautiful in form, clad in black, [girded about and having the shoulders bare,] with their hair hanging loose.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And these women, me thought, had a savage look.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And the shepherd ordered them to take up the stones which had been cast away from the building, and to carry them off to the same mountains from which also they had been brought;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and they took them up joyfully, and carried away all the stones and put them in the place whence they had been taken.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And after all the stones had been taken up, and not a single stone still lay round the tower, the shepherd saith unto me;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Let us go round the tower, and see that there is no defect in it.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And I proceeded to go round it with him.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And when the shepherd saw that the tower was very comely in the building, he was exceedingly glad;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: for the tower was so well builded, that when I saw it I coveted the building of it ;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: for it was builded, as it were, of one stone, having one fitting in it.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And the stone-work appeared as if hewn out of the rock;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: for it seemed to be all a single stone.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And I, as I walked with him, was glad to see so brave a sight.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And the shepherd saith to me Go and bring plaster and fine clay, that I may fill up the shapes of the stones that have been taken up and put into the building;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: for all the circuit of the tower must be made smooth.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And I did is he bade, and brought them to him.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Assist me, saith he, and the work will speedily be accomplished.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: So he filled in the shapes of the stones which had gone to the building, and ordered the circuit of the tower to be swept and made clean.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And the virgins took brooms and swept, and they removed all the rubbish from the tower, and sprinkled water, and the site of the tower was made cheerful and very seemly.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: If the lord come to inspect the tower, he hath nothing for which to blame us.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Saying this, he desired to go away.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: But I caught hold of his wallet, and began to adjure him by the Lord that he would explain to me [all] what he had showed me.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: He saith to me;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: I am busy for a little while, and then I will explain everything to thee.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Await me here till I come.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: I say to him;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Sir, when I am here alone what shall I do?

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Thou art not alone, saith he;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: for these virgins are here with thee. Commend me then to them, say I.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: The shepherd calleth them to him and saith to them;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: I commend this man to you till I come, and he departed.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: So I was alone with the virgins;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and they were most cheerful, and kindly disposed to me, especially the four of them that were the more glorious in appearance.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: The virgins say to me;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Today the shepherd cometh not here.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: What then shall I do? say I.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Stay for him, say they, till eventide;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and if he come, he will speak with thee;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: but if he come not, thou shalt stay here with us till he cometh.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: I say to them;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: I will await him till evening, and if he come not, I will depart home and return early in the morning.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: But they answered and said unto me;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: To us thou wast entrusted;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: thou canst not depart from us.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Where then, say I, shall I remain?

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: “Thou shalt pass the night with us, say they, as a brother, not as a husband;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: for thou art our brother, and hence-forward we will dwell with thee;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: for we love thee dearly.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: But I was ashamed to abide with them.568

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And she that seemed to be the chief of them began to kiss and to embrace me;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and the others seeing her embrace me, they too began to kiss me, and to lead me round the tower, and to sport with me.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And I had become as it were a younger man, and I commenced myself likewise to sport with them.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: For some of them began to dance, others to sing.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: But I kept silence and walked with them round the tower, and was glad with them.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: But when evening came I wished to go away home;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: but they would not let me go, but detained me.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And I stayed the nigh with them, and I slept by the side of the tower.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: For the virgins spread their linen tunics on the ground, and made me lie down in the midst of them, and they did nothing else but pray;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and I prayed with them without ceasing, and not less than they.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And the virgins rejoiced that I so prayed.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And I stayed there with the virgins until the morning till the second hour.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Then came the shepherd, and saith to the virgins;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Have ye done him any injury?

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Ask him, say they.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: I say to him, Sir, I was rejoiced to stay with them.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: On what didst thou sup? saith he.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: I supped, Sir, say I, on the words of the Lord the whole nigh through.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Did they treat thee well? saith he.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Yes, Sir, say I.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Now, saith he, what wouldest thou hear first?

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: In the order as thou showedst to me, Sir, from the beginning, say I;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: I request thee, Sir, to explain to me exactly in the order that I shall enquire of thee.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: First of all, Sir, say I, explain this to me.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: The rock and the How, Sir, say I, is the rock ancient, but the gate recent?

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Listen, saith he, and understand, foolish man.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: The Son of God is older than all His creation, so that He became the Fathers adviser in His creation.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: But the gate, why is it recent, Sir? say I.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Because, saith he, He was made manifest in the last days of the consummation;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: therefore the gate was made recent, that they which are to be saved may enter through it into the kingdom of God.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Didst thou see, saith he,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: that the stones which came through the gate have gone to the building of the tower, but those which came not through it were cast away again to their own place?

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: I saw, Sir, say I.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: “Thus, saith he, no one shall enter into the kingdom of God, except he receive the name of His Son.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: For if thou wishest to enter into any city, and that city is walled all round and has one gate only, canst thou enter into that city except through the gate which it hath?

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Why, how, Sir, say I, is it possible otherwise?

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: If then thou canst not enter into the city except through the gate itself, even so, saith he, a man cannot enter into the kingdom of God except by the name of His Son that is beloved by Him.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Didst thou see, saith he, the multitude that is building the tower?

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: I saw it, Sir, say I.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: They, saith he, are all glorious angels.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: With these then the Lord is walled around.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: But the gate is the Son of God;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: there is this one entrance only to the Lord.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: No one then shall enter in unto Him otherwise than through His Son.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Didst thou see, saith he, the six men, and the glorious and mighty man in the midst of them, him that walked about the tower and rejected the stones from the building?

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: I saw him, Sir, say I.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: The glorious man, saith he, is the Son of God, and those six are the glorious angels who guard Him on the right hand and on the left.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Of these glorious angels not one, saith he, shall enter in unto God without Him;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: But the tower, say I, what is it?

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: “The tower, saith he, why, this is the Church.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And these virgins, who are they?

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: They, saith he, are unless these shall clothe him with their garment;570

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: for if thou receive only the name, but receive not the garment from them, thou profitest nothing.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: For these virgins are powers of the Son of God.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: If thou bear the Name, and bear not His power, thou shalt bear His Name to none effect.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And the stones, saith he, which thou didst see cast away, these bare the Name, but clothed not themselves with the raiment of the virgins.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Of what sort, Sir, say I, is their raiment?

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: “The names themselves, saith he, are their raiment.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Whosoever beareth the Name of the Son of God, ought to bear the names of these also;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: for even the Son Himself beareth the names of these virgins.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: As many stones, saith he, as thou sawest enter into the building of the tower, being given in by their hands and waiting for the building, they have been clothed in the power of these virgins.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: For this cause thou seest the tower made a single stone with the rock.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: So also they that have believed in the Lord through His Son and clothe themselves in these spirits, shall become one spirit and one body, and their garments all of one colour.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: But such persons as bear the names of the virgins have their dwelling in the tower.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: The stones then, Sir, say I, which are cast aside, wherefore were they cast aside?

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: For they passed through the gate and were placed in the building of the tower by the hands of the virgins.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Since all these things interest thee, saith he, and thou enquirest diligently, listen as touching the stones that have been cast aside.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: These all, received the name of the Son of God, and received likewise the power of these virgins.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: When then they received these spirits, they were strengthened, and were with the servants of God, and they had one spirit and one body [and one garment];

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: for they had the same mind, and they wrought righteousness.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: After a certain time then they were persuaded by the women whom thou sawest clad in black raiment, and having their shoulders bare and their hair loose, and beautiful in form.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: When they saw them they desired them, and they clothed themselves with their power, but they stripped off from themselves the power of the virgins.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: They then were cast away from the house of God, and delivered to

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: What then, Sir, say I, if these men, being such as they are, should repent and put away their desire for these women, and return unto the virgins, and walk in their power and in their works?

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Shall they not enter into the house of God?

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: They shall enter, saith he, if they shall put away the works of these women, and take again the power of the virgins, and walk in their works.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: For this is the reason why there was also a cessation in the building, that, if these repent, they may go into the building of the tower;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: but if they repent not, then others will go, and these shall be cast away finally.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: For all these things I gave thanks unto the Lord, because He had compassion on all that called upon His name,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and sent forth the angel of repentance to us that had sinned against Him, and refreshed our spirit, and, when we were already ruined and had no hope of life, restored our life.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Now, Sir, say I, show me why the tower is not built upon the ground, but upon the rock and upon the gate.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Because thou art senseless, saith he, and without understanding [thou askest the question].

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: I am obliged, Sir, say I, to ask all questions of thee, because I am absolutely unable to comprehend anything at all;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: for all are great and glorious and difficult for men to understand.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Listen, saith he.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: The name of the Son of God is great and incomprehensible, and sustaineth the whole world.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: If then all creation is sustained by the Son, what thinkest thou of those that are called by Him, and bear the name of the Son of God, and walk according to His commandments?

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Seest thou then what manner of men He sustaineth?

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Even those that bear His name with their whole heart.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Declare to me, Sir, say I, the names of the virgins, and of the of the more powerful virgins, those that are stationed at the corners.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: The first is Faith, and the second, Continence, and the third, Power, and the fourth, Longsuffering.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: But the others stationed between them have these names Simplicity, Guilelessness, Purity, Cheerfulness, Truth, Understanding, Concord, Love.572

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: He that beareth these names and the name of the Son of God shall be able to enter into the kingdom of God.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Hear, saith he, likewise the names of the women that wear the black garments.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Of these also four are more powerful than the rest;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: the first is Unbelief;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: the second, Intemperance;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: the third, Disobedience;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: the fourth, Deceit;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and their followers are called, Sadness, Wickedness, Wantonness, Irascibility, Falsehood, Folly, Slander, Hatred.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: The servant of God that beareth these names shall see the kingdom of God, but shall not enter into it.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: But the stones, Sir, say I, that came from the deep, and were fitted into the building, who are they?

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: “The first, saith he, even the ten, that were placed in the foundations, are the first generation;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: the twenty-five are the second generation of righteous men;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: the thirty-five are Gods prophets and His ministers;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: the forty are apostles and teachers of the preaching of the Son of God.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Wherefore then, Sir, say I, did the virgins give in these stones also for the building of the tower and carry them through the gate?

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: “ Because these first, saith he,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: bore these spirits, and they never separated the one from the other, neither the spirits from the men nor the men from the spirits, but the spirits abode with them till they fell asleep;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Show me still further, Sir, say I.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: What desirest thou to know the deep, and wherefore were they placed into the building, though they bore these spirits?

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: “It was necessary for them, saith he, to rise up through water, that they might be made alive;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: for otherwise they could not enter into the kingdom of God, except they had put aside the deadness of their [former] life.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: So these likewise that had fallen asleep received the seal of the Son of God and entered into the kingdom of God.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: For before a man, saith he, has borne the name of God, he is dead;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: but when he has received the seal, he layeth aside his deadness, and

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: The seal then is the water so they go down into the water dead, and they come up alive.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Thus to them also this seal was preached, and they availed themselves of it that they might enter into the kingdom of God.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Wherefore, Sir, say I, did the forty stones also come up with them from the deep, though they had already received the seal?

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Because, saith he,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: these, the apostles and the teachers who preached the name of the Son of God, after they had fallen asleep in the power and faith of the Son of God,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: preached also to then that had fallen asleep before them, and themselves gave unto them the seal of the preaching.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Therefore they went down with them into the water, and came up again.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: But these went down alive;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: whereas the others that had fallen asleep before them went down dead and came up alive.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: So by their means they were quickened into life, and came to the full knowledge of the name of the Son of God.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: For this cause also they came up with them, and were fitted with them into the building of the tower and were builded with them, without being shaped;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: for they fell asleep in righteousness and in great purity.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Only they had not this seal.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Thou hast then the interpretation of these things also.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: I have, Sir, say I.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Now then, Sir, explain to me concerning the mountains.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Wherefore are their forms diverse the one from the other, and various?

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Listen, saith he.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: These twelve mountains are tribes that inhabit the whole world.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: To these  then the Son of God was preached by the Apostles.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: But explain to me, Sir, why they are various-these mountains-and each has a different appearance.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Listen, saith he.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: These twelve tribes which inhabit the whole world are twelve nations;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and they are various in understanding and in mind.574

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: As various, then, as thou sawest these mountains to be, such also are the varieties in the mind of these nations, and such their understanding.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And I will show unto thee the conduct of each.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: First, Sir, say I,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: show me this, why the mountains being so various, yet,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: when their stones were set into the building, became bright and of one colour, just like the stones that had come up from the deep.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Because, saith he, all the nations that dwell under heaven, when they heard and believed, were called by the one name of [the Son of] God.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: So having received the seal, they had one understanding and one mind, and one faith became theirs and [one] love, and they bore the spirits of the virgins along with the Name;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: therefore the building of the tower became of one colour, even bright as the sun.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: But after they entered in together, and became one body, some of them defiled themselves, and were cast out from the society of the righteous, and became again such as they were before, or rather even worse.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: How, Sir, say I, did they become worse, after they had fully known God?

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: He that knoweth not God, saith he, and committeth wickedness, hath a certain punishment for his wickedness;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: but he that knoweth God fully ought not any longer to commit wickedness, but to do good.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: If then he that ought to do good committeth wickedness, does he not seem to do greater wickedness than the man that knoweth not God?

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Therefore they that have not known God, and commit wickedness, are condemned to death;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: but they that have known God and seen His mighty works, and yet commit wickedness, shall receive a double punishment, and shall die eternally.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: In this way therefore shall the Church of God be purified.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And as thou sawest the stones removed from the tower and delivered over to the evil spirits, they too shall be cast out;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and there shall be one body of them that are purified, just as the tower, after it had been purified, became made as it were of one stone.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Thus shall it be with the Church of God also, after she hath been double-minded and they that commit various kinds of wickedness have been cast out.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: When these have been cast out, the Church of God shall be one body, one understanding, one mind, one faith, one love.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And then the Son of God shall rejoice and be glad in them, for that He hath received back His people pure.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Great and glorious, Sir, say I, are all these things.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Once more, Sir, show me the force and the doings of each one of the mountains, that every soul that trusteth in the Lord, when it heareth, may glorify His great and marvelous and glorious name.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Listen, saith he, to the variety of the mountains and of the twelve nations.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: From the first mountain, which was black, they that have believed are such as these;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: rebels and blasphemers against the Lord, and betrayers of the servants of God.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: For these there is no repentance, but there is death.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: For this cause also they are black;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: for their race is lawless.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And from the second mountain, the bare one, they that believed are such as these;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: hypocrites and teachers of wickedness.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And these then are like the former it not having the fruit of righteousness.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: For, even as their mountain is unfruitful, so likewise such men as these have a name indeed, but they are void of the faith, and there is no fruit of truth in them.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: For these then repentance is offered, if they repent quickly;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: but if they delay, they will have their death with the former.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Wherefore, Sir, say I, is repentance possible for them, but not for the former?

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: For their doings are almost the same.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: On this account, he saith, is repentance offered for them, because they blasphemed not their Lord, nor became betrayers of the servants of God;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: yet from desire of gain they played the hypocrite, and taught each other [after] the desires of sinful men.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: But they shall pay a certain penalty;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: yet repentance is ordained for them, because they are not become blasphemers or betrayers.576

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And from the third mountain, which had thorns and briars, they that believed are such as these;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: some of them are wealthy and others are entangled in many business affairs.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: The briars are the wealthy, and the thorns are they that are mixed up in various business affairs.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: These [then,that are mixed up in many and various business affairs,] cleave [not] to the servants of God, but go astray, being choked by their affairs,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: but the wealthy unwillingly cleave to the servants of God, fearing lest they may be asked for something by them.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Such men therefore shall hardly enter into the kingdom of God.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: For as it is difficult to walk on briars with bare feet, so also it is difficult for such men to enter into the kingdom of God.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: But for all these repentance is possible, but it must be speedy, that in respect to what they omitted to do in the former times, they may now revert to (past) days, and do some good.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: If then they shall repent and do some good, they shall live unto God;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: but if they continue in their doings, they shall be delivered over to those women, the which shall put them to death.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And from the fourth mountain, which had much vegetation, the upper part of the grass green and the part towards the roots withered, and some of it dried up by the sun, they that believed are such as these;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: the double-minded, and they that have the Lord on their lips, but have Him not in their heart.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Therefore their foundations are dry and without power, and their words only live, but their works are dead.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Such men are neither alive nor dead.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: They are, therefore, like unto the double-minded;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: for the double-minded are neither green nor withered;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: for they are neither alive nor dead.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: For as their grass was withered up then it saw the sun, so also the double-minded, when they hear of tribulation, through their cowardice worship idols and are ashamed of the name of their Lord.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Such are neither alive nor dead.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Yet these also, if they repent quickly, shall be able to live;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: but if they repent not, they are delivered over already to the

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And from the fifth mountain, which had green grass and was rugged, they that believed are such as these;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: they are faithful, but slow to learn and stubborn and self-pleasers, desiring to know all things, and yet they know nothing at all.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: By reason of this their stubbornness, understanding stood aloof from them, and a foolish senselessness entered into them;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and they praise themselves as having understanding, and they desire to be self-appointed teachers, senseless though they are.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Owing then to this pride of heart many, while they exalted themselves, have been made empty;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: for a mighty demon is stubbornness and vain confidence.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Of these then many were cast away, but some repented and believed, and submitted themselves to those that had understanding, having learnt their own senselessness.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Yea, and to the rest that belong to this class repentance is offered;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: for they did not become wicked, but rather foolish and without understanding.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: If these then shall repent, they shall live unto God;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: but if they repent not, they shall have their abode with the women who work evil against them.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: But they that believed from the sixth mountain, which had clefts great and small, and in the clefts herbage withered, are such as these;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: they that have the small clefts, these are they that have aught against one another, and from their backbitings they are withered in the faith;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: but many of these repented.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Yea, and the rest shall repent, when they hear my commandments;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: for their backbitings are but small, and they shall quickly repent.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: But they that have great clefts, these are persistent in their backbitings and bear grudges, nursing wrath against one another.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: These then were thrown right away from the tower and rejected from its building.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Such persons therefore shall with difficulty live.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: If God and our Lord, Who ruleth over all things and hath the authority over all His creation, beareth no grudge against them that confess their sins, but is propitiated,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: doth man, who is mortal and full of sins, bear a grudge against man, as though he were able to destroy or save him?578

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: I say unto you: I, the angel of repentance unto as many as hold this heresy, put it away from you and repent, and the Lord shall heal your former sins, if ye shall purify yourselves from this demon;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: but if not, ye shall be delivered unto him to be put to death.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And from the seventh mountain, on which was herbage green and smiling, and the whole mountain thriving,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and cattle of every kind and the fowls of heaven were feeding on the herbage on that mountain, and the green herbage, on which they fed, only grew the more luxuriant, they that believed are such as these;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: they were ever simple and guileless and blessed, having nothing against one another,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: but rejoicing always in the servants of God, and clothed in the Holy Spirit of these virgins, and having compassion always on every man, and out of their labours they supplied every mans need without reproach and without misgiving.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: The Lord then seeing their simplicity and entire childliness made them to abound in the labours of their hands, and bestowed favour on them in all their doings.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: But I say unto you that are such-I, the angel of repentance-remain to the end such as ye are, and your seed shall never be blotted out.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: For the Lord hath put you to the proof, and enrolled you among our number, and your whole seed shall dwell with the Son of God;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: for of His Spirit did ye receive.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And from the eighth mountain, where were the many springs, and all the creatures of the Lord did drink of the springs, they that believed are such as these;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: apostles and teachers, who preached unto the whole world, and who taught the word of the Lord in soberness and purity,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and kept back no part at all for evil desire, but walked always in righteousness and truth, even as also they received the Holy Spirit.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Such therefore shall have their entrance with the angels.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And from the ninth mountain, which was desert, which had reptiles and wild beasts in it which destroy mankind, they that believed are such as these;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: they that have the spots are deacons that exercised their office ill, for themselves from the ministrations which they had received to perform.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: If then they abide in the same evil desire, they are dead and there is no hope of life for them;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: but if they turn again and fulfil their ministrations in purity, it shall be possible for them to live.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: But they that are mildewed, these are they that denied and turned not again unto their Lord, but having become barren and desert, because they cleave not unto the servants of God but remain alone, they destroy their own souls.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: For as a vine left alone in a hedge, if it meet with neglect, is destroyed and wasted by the weeds,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and in time becometh wild and is no longer useful to its owner, so also men of this kind have given themselves up in despair and become useless to their Lord, by growing wild.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: To these then repentance cometh, unless they be found to have denied from the heart;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: but if a man be found to have denied from the heart, I know not whether it is possible for him to live.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And this I say not in reference to these days, that a man after denying should receive repentance;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: for it is impossible for him to be saved who shall now deny his Lord;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: but for those who denied Him long ago repentance seemeth to be possible.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: If a man therefore will repent, let him do so speedily before the tower is completed;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: but if not, he shall he destroyed by the women and put to death.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And the stunted, these are the treacherous and backbiters;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and the wild beasts which thou sawest on the mountain are these.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: For as wild beasts with their venom poison and kill a man, so also do the words of such men poison and kill a man.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: These then are broken off short from their faith through the conduct which they have in themselves;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: but some of them repented and were saved;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and the rest that are of this kind can be saved, if they repent;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: but if they repent not, they shall meet their death from those women of whose power they are possessed.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And from the tenth mountain, where were trees sheltering certain sheep, they that believed are such as these;580

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: bishops, hospitable persons, who gladly received into their houses at all times the servants of God without hypocrisy.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: [These bishops] at all times without ceasing sheltered the needy and the widows in their ministration and conducted themselves in purity at all times.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: These then shall be sheltered by the Lord for ever.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: They therefore that have done these things are glorious in the sight of God, and their place is even now with the angels, if they shall continue unto the end serving the Lord.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And from the eleventh mountain, where were trees full of fruit, decked with divers kinds of fruits, they that believed are such as these;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: they that suffered for the Name, who also suffered readily with their whole heart, and yielded up their lives.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Wherefore then, Sir, say I, have all the trees fruits, but some of their fruits are more beautiful than others?

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Listen, saith he;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: all as many as ever suffered for the Names sake are glorious in the sight of God,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and the sins of all these were taken away, because they suffered for the name of the Son of God.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Now hear why their fruits are various, and some surpassing others.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: As many, saith he, as were tortured and denied not, when brought before the magistracy, but suffered readily, these are the more glorious in the sight of the Lord;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: their fruit is that which surpasseth.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: But as many as became cowards, and were lost in uncertainty,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and considered in their hearts whether they should deny or confess,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and yet suffered, their fruits are less, because this design entered into their heart for this design is evil, that a servant should deny his own lord.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: See to it, therefore, ye who entertain this idea, lest this design remain in your hearts, and ye die unto God.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: But ye that suffer for the Names sake ought to glorify God, because God deemed you worthy that ye should bear this name, and that all your sins should be healed.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Reckon yourselves blessed therefore;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: yea, rather think that ye have done a great work, if any of you shall suffer for Gods sake.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: for your sins weighed you down, and if ye had not suffered for the Name [of the Lord], ye had died unto God by reason of your sins.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: These things I say unto you that waver as touching denial and confession.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Confess that ye have the Lord, last denying Him ye be delivered into prison.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: If the Gentiles punish their slaves, if any one deny his lord, what think ye the Lord will do unto you, He Who hath the authority over all things?

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Away with these designs from your hearts, that ye may live for ever unto God.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And from the twelfth mountain, which was white, they that believed are such as these;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: they are as very babes, into whose heart no guile entereth, neither learnt they what wickedness is, but they remained as babes for ever.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Such as these then dwell without doubt in the kingdom of God, because they defiled the commandments of God in nothing, but continued as babes all the days of their life in the same mind.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: As many of you therefore as shall so continue, saith he, and shall be as infants not having guile, shall be more glorious [even] than all them that have been mentioned before;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: for all infants are glorious in the sight of God, and stand first in His sight.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Blessed then are ye, as many as have put away wickedness from you, and have clothed yourselves in guilelessness:

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: After he had finished the parables of the mountains, I say unto him,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Sir, now explain to me concerning the stones that were taken from the from the tower, and concerning the round (stones) which were placed in the building, and concerning those that were still round.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Hear, saith he, likewise concerning all these things.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: The stones which were taken from the plain and placed in the building of the tower in the room of those that were rejected, are the roots of this white mountain.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: When then they that believed from this mountain were all found guileless, the lord of the tower ordered these from the roots of this mountain to be put into the building of the tower.582

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: For He knew that if these stones should go to the building [of the tower], they would remain bright and not one of then would turn black.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: But if he had added  from the other mountains, he would have been obliged to visit that tower again, and to purify it.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Now all these have been found white, who have believed and who shall believe;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: for they are of the same kind.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Blessed is this kind, for it is innocent! Hear now likewise concerning those round and bright stones.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: All these are from this white mountain.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Now hear wherefore they have been found round.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Their riches have darkened and obscured them a little from the truth, yet they never departed from God, nor did any evil word proceed from their mouth, but all equity and virtue which comes from the truth.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: When therefore the Lord perceived their mind, that they could favour the truth, *and likewise remain good,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: He commanded their possessions to be cut from off them, yet not to be taken away altogether, so that they might be able to do some good with that which hath been left to them, and might live unto God, for that they come of a good kind.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: So therefore they have been cut away a little, and placed in the building of this tower.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: But the other , which have remained round and have not been fitted into the building, because they have not yet received the seal, have been replaced in their own position, for they were found very round.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: For this world and the vanities of their possessions must be cut from off them, and then they will fit into the kingdom of God.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: For it is necessary that they should enter into the kingdom of God;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: because the Lord hath blessed this innocent kind.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Of this kind then not one shall perish.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Yea, even though any one of them being tempted by the most wicked devil have committed any fault, he shall return speedily unto his Lord.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Blessed I pronounce you all to be-I, the angel of repentance- whoever of you are guileless as infants, because your part is good and honourable in the sight of God.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Moreover I bid all of you, whoever have received this seal, keep guilelessness, and bear to grudge, and continue not in your

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: but become of one spirit, and heal these evil clefts and take them away from among you, that the owner of the flocks may rejoice concerning them.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: For he will rejoice, if he find all things whole.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: But if he find any part of the flock scattered, woe unto the shepherds.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: For if the shepherds themselves shall have been found scattered, how will they answer for the flocks?

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Will they say that they were harassed by the flock?

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: No credence will be given them.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: For it is an incredible thing that a shepherd should be injured by his flock;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and he will be punished the more because of his falsehood.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And I am the shepherd, and it behoveth me most strongly to render an account for you.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Amend yourselves therefore, while the tower is still in course of building.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: The Lord dwelleth in men that love peace;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: for to Him peace is dear;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: but from the contentious and them that are given up to wickedness He keepeth afar off.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Restore therefore to Him your spirit whole as ye received it.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: For suppose thou hast given to a fuller a new garment whole, and desirest to receive it back again whole, but the fuller give it back to thee torn, wilt thou receive it thus?

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Wilt thou not at once blaze out and attack him with reproaches, saying;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: “The garment which I gave thee was whole;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: wherefore hast thou rent it and made it useless?

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: See, by reason of the rent, which thou hast made in it, it cannot be of use.”

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Wilt thou not then say all this to a fuller even about a rent which he has made in thy garment?

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: If therefore thou art thus vexed in the matter of thy garment, and complainest because thou receivest it not back whole,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: what thinkest thou the Lord will do to thee, He, Who gave thee the spirit whole, and thou hast made it absolutely useless, so that it cannot be of any use at all to its Lord?

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: For its use began to be useless, when it was corrupted by thee.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Will not therefore the Lord of this spirit for this thy deed punish [thee with death]?584

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: “Certainly, I said, all those, whomsoever He shall find continuing to bear malice, He will punish.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Trample not, said he, upon His mercy, but rather glorify Him, because He is so long-suffering with your sins, and is not like unto you.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Practise then repentance which is expedient for you.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: All these things which are written above I, the shepherd, the angel of repentance, have declared and spoken to the servants of God.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: If then ye shall believe and hear my words, and walk in them, and amend your ways, ye shall be able to live.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: But if ye continue in wickedness and in bearing malice, no one of this kind shall live unto God.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: All things which were to be spoken by me have  been spoken to you.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: The shepherd said to me, Hast thou asked me all thy questions?

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And I said, Yes, Sir.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Why then hast thou not enquired of me concerning the shape of the stones placed in the building, in that we filled up their shapes?

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And I said, I forgot, Sir.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Listen now, said he, concerning them.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: These are they that have heard my commandments now, and have practised repentance with their whole heart.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: So when the Lord saw that their repentance was good and pure, and that they could continue therein, he ordered their former sins to be blotted out.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: These shapes then were their former sins, and they have been chiseled away that they might not appear.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: PARABLE THE TENTH.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: After I had written out this book completely, the angel who had delivered me to the shepherd came to the house where I was, and sat upon a couch, and the shepherd stood at his right hand.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Then he called me, and spake thus unto me;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: I delivered thee, said he, and thy house to this shepherd, that thou mightest be protected by him.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: True, Sir, I said.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: If therefore, said he, thou desirest to be protected from all

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: to have also success in every good work and word, and all the power of righteousness, walk in his commandments, which I have given thee, and thou shalt be able to get the mastery over all wickedness.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: For if thou keep his commandments, all evil desire and the sweetness of this world shall be subject unto thee;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: moreover success shall attend thee in every good undertaking.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Embrace his gravity and self-restraint, and tell it out unto all men that he is held in great honour and dignity with the Lord, and is a ruler of great authority, and powerful in his office.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: To him alone in the whole world hath authority over repentance been assigned.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Seemeth he to thee to be powerful?

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Yet ye despise the gravity and moderation which he useth towards you.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: I say unto him;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Ask him, Sir, himself, whether from the time that he hath been in my house, I have done ought out of order, whereby I have offended him.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: I myself know, said he, that thou hast done nothing out of order, nor art about to do so.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: And so I speak these things unto thee, that thou mayest persevere.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: For he hath given a good account of thee unto me.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Thou therefore shalt speak these words to others, that they too who have practised or shall practise repentance may be of the same mind as thou art;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and he may give a good report of then to me, and I unto the Lord.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: I too, Sir, I say, declare to every man the mighty works of the Lord;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: for I hope that all who have sinned in the past, if they hear these things, will gladly repent and recover life.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Continue therefore, said he, in this ministry, and complete it unto the end.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: For whosoever fulfil his commandments shall have life;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: yea such a man  great honour with the Lord.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: But whosoever keep not his commandments, fly from their life, and oppose him, and follow not his commandments, but deliver themselves over to death;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and each one becometh guilty of his own blood.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: But I bid thee obey these commandments, and thou shalt have a remedy for thy sins.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Moreover, I have sent these virgins unto thee, that they may dwell with thee;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: for I have seen that they are friendly towards thee.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Thou hast them therefore as helpers, that thou mayest be the better able to keep his commandments;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: for it is impossible that these commandments be kept without the help of these virgins.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: I see too that they are glad to be with thee.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: But I will charge them that they depart not at all from thy house.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Only do thou purify thy house;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: for in a clean house they will gladly dwell.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: For they are clean and chaste and industrious, and all have favour in the sight of the Lord.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: If, therefore, they shall find thy house pure, they will continue with thee;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: but if the slightest pollution arise, they will depart from thy house at once.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: For these virgins love not pollution in any form.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: I say unto him, I hope, Sir, that I shall please them, so that they may gladly dwell in my house for ever;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: and just as he to whom thou didst deliver me maketh no complaint against me, so they likewise shall make no complaint.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: He saith unto the shepherd, I perceive, saith he, that he wishes to live as the servant of God, and that he will keep these commandments, and will place these virgins in a clean habitation.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: With these words he again delivered me over to the shepherd, and called the virgins, and said to them;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Inasmuch as I see that ye are glad to dwell in this mans house, I commend to you him and his house, that ye depart not at all from his house.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: But they heard these words gladly.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: He said then to me, Quit you like a man in this ministry;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: declare to every man the mighty works of the Lord, and thou shalt have favour in this ministry.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Whosoever therefore shall walk in these commandments, shall live and be happy in his life;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: but whosoever shall neglect them, shall not live, and shall be unhappy in his life.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Charge all men who are able to do right, that they cease not to practise good works;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: I say moreover that every man ought to be rescued from misfortune;

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: for he that hath need, and suffereth misfortune in his daily life, is in great torment and want.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Whosoever therefore rescueth from penury a life of this kind,

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: winneth great joy for himself For he who is harassed by misfortune of this sort is afflicted and tortured with equal torment as one who is in chains.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: For many men on account of calamities of this kind, because they can bear them no longer, lay violent hands on themselves.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: He then who knows the calamity of a man of this kind and rescueth him not, committeth great sin, and becometh guilty of the mans blood.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Do therefore good works, whoever of you have received from the Lord, lest, while ye delay to do them, the building of the tower be completed.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: For it is on your account that the work of the building has been interrupted.

name: The Shepherd of Hermas
text: Unless then ye hasten to do right, the tower will be completed, and ye shut out. When then he had finished speaking with me, he rose from the couch and departed, taking with him the shepherd and the virgins. He said however unto me, that he would send the shepherd and the virgins back again to my house.588

name: Epistle of James
text: James, a servant of God and of the Lord Jesus Christ, to the twelve tribes that are in the dispersion, greeting.

name: Epistle of James
text: Count it all joy, my brethren, when you fall into diversified temptations,

name: Epistle of James
text: knowing that the proof of your faith works out patience.

text: Blessed is the man that endures temptation, because having become approved he shall receive the crown of life, which he has promised to those that love him.

text: Let no one, when tempted, say: I am tempted by God. For God cannot be tempted by evils, and himself tempts no one.

name: Epistle of James
text: My brethren, hold not the faith of our Lord Jesus Christ of glory with respect of persons.

name: Epistle of James
text: For if there come into your assembly a man with a gold ring on his finger, in splendid raiment, and there come in also a poor man in vile raiment,

text: do you not then make distinctions among yourselves, and have you not become judges having evil thoughts?

name: Epistle of James
text: Hear, my beloved brethren. Has not God chosen the poor in the world, rich in faith and heirs of the kingdom which he has promised to those that love him?

name: Epistle of James
text: But you have dishonored the poor man. Do not the rich act as lords over you, and do not they themselves drag you to the judgment- seats?

name: Epistle of James
text: Do not they themselves blaspheme that honorable name that has been called upon you?

name: Epistle of James
text: If, however, you fulfill the royal law according to the Scripture; Thou shalt love thy neighbor as thyself, you do well:

name: Epistle of James
text: For whoever shall have kept the whole law, but shall have offended in one, has become guilty of all.410

name: Epistle of James

name: Epistle of James
text: For the judgment is merciless to him that has shown no mercy: mercy glories over judgment.

name: Epistle of James
text: What is the profit, my brethren, if any one say that he has faith, but has not works? Can his faith save him?

name: Epistle of James
text: But if a brother or sister be naked and want daily food,

name: Epistle of James
text: and any one of you say to them: Depart in peace, be warmed and be filled, but give them not the things needful for the body, what is the profit?

name: Epistle of James
text: So also faith, if it have not works, is dead in itself.

name: Epistle of James
text: But some one will say: Thou hast faith, and I have works: show me thy faith without the works, and I will show thee my faith by the works.

name: Epistle of James
text: Dost thou believe that God is one? thou doest well: the demons also believe and tremble.

name: Epistle of James
text: But wilt thou know, O vain man, that faith without works is idle?

name: Epistle of James
text: Was not Abraham our father justified by works, when he offered up Isaac his son on the altar?

name: Epistle of James

name: Epistle of James
text: Be patient, therefore, brethren till the coming of the Lord. Behold, the farmer waits for the precious fruit of the earth, being patient over it till he receive the early and latter rain:

name: Epistle of James

name: Epistle of James
text: But above all things, my brethren, swear not, neither by heaven, nor by the earth, nor by any other oath; but let your yes be yes, and no be no, that you fall not under condemnation.

name: Epistle of James
text: Does any one among you suffer evil? Let him pray: is any one cheerful? Let him sing psalms.

name: Epistle of James
text: Is anyone among you sick? Let him call for the elders of the church, and let them pray over him, anointing him with oil in the name of the Lord.

name: Epistle of James
text: And the prayer of faith shall save the sick, and the Lord shall raise him up; and if he have committed sins, it shall be forgiven him.

name: Epistle of James

name: Epistle of James

name: Epistle of James
text: But the God of all grace, who has called you to his eternal glory in Christ, after you have suffered awhile, will himself make you perfect, establish, strengthen, confirm you.

name: Epistle of James
text: To him be might through the ages, amen.

name: Epistle of James
text: By Silvanus to you the faithful brother, as I suppose, I have written in few words, exhorting, and testifying that this is the true grace of God, in which you stand.

name: Epistle of James
text: She that is elected together with you in Babylon salute you, and so does Mark my son.

name: Epistle of James
text: Salute one another with a kiss of love. Peace to you all that are in Christ.420 Epistle of Peter 2nd

name: Epistle of James
text: Peter 1

name: Epistle of James
text: Simon Peter, a servant and apostle of Jesus Christ, to those that have obtained equally precious faith with us in the righteousness of our God and Saviour Jesus Christ.

name: Epistle of James
text: Grace to you and peace be multiplied in the acknowledgment of God and Jesus our Lord.

name: Epistle of James
text: As his divine power has given us all things that pertain to life and godliness, through the acknowledgment of him who has called us by his own glory and virtue,

name: Epistle of James
text: through which very great and precious promises have been given to us, that through these you might become partakers of the divine nature, having escaped the corruption that is in the world in desire;

name: Epistle of James
text: and for this very reason bringing forward all diligence, supply in your faith, virtue, and in virtue, knowledge,

name: Epistle of James
text: and in knowledge, self-control, and in self-control, patience, and in patience, godliness,

name: Epistle of James
text: and in godliness, friendship for brethren, and in friendship for brethren, love.

name: Epistle of James
text: For these things being in you and abounding render you neither idle, nor unfruitful for the acknowledgment of our Lord Jesus Christ;

name: Epistle of James
text: but he in whom these are not present, is blind, not seeing afar off, having taken up a forgetfulness of the purification of his old sins.

name: Epistle of James
text: Wherefore the rather, brethren, be diligent to make your calling and election sure; for in doing these things you shall never stumble.

name: Epistle of James
text: For so shall there be richly supplied to you the entrance into the eternal kingdom of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ.

name: Epistle of James
text: Wherefore I shall always remind you of these things, though you know them and are established in the present truth.

name: Epistle of James
text: Yes, I think it right, as long as I am in this tabernacle, to stir you up by putting you in remembrance,

name: Epistle of James
text: knowing that shortly I must put off this my tabernacle, even as our Lord Jesus Christ has shown me.

name: Epistle of James
text: But I will endeavor that you may always be able, after my departure, to have these things in remembrance.

name: Epistle of James
text: For we did not follow cunningly devised fables when we made known to you the power and coming of our Lord Jesus Christ, but had been made eye-witnesses of his majesty.

name: Epistle of James
text: For he received from God the Father honor and glory, a voice having been borne to him by the most excellent glory, such as this: This is my beloved Son, in whom I am well pleased.

name: Epistle of James
text: And this voice brought from heaven we heard, being with him in

name: Epistle of James
text: and we have the prophetic word more sure, to which you do well to give heed, as to a lamp shining in a dark place, till the day dawn and the day-star arise in your hearts;

name: Epistle of James
text: knowing this first, that no prophecy of Scripture comes from one’s own interpretation.

name: Epistle of James
text: For not by the will of man was prophecy ever brought, but men from God spoke, being moved by the Holy Spirit.

name: Epistle of James
text: Peter 2

name: Epistle of James
text: But there arose false prophets among the people, as there shall be false teachers also among you, such as shall privily introduce heresies of destruction, even denying the Lord that bought them, who bring on themselves swift destruction;

name: Epistle of James
text: and many will follow their licentiousness, because of whom the way of truth shall be blasphemed;

name: Epistle of James
text: and in covetousness with deceitful words they will make merchandise of you; for whom the condemnation of old lingers not, and their destruction slumbers not.

name: Epistle of James
text: For if God spared not the angels that sinned, but casting them down to Tartarus in chains of darkness delivered them up to be kept for judgment,

name: Epistle of James
text: and spared not the old world, but preserved Noah, the eighth person, a preacher of righteousness, having brought a flood on the world of the ungodly,

name: Epistle of James
text: and turning the cities of Sodom and Gomorrah into ashes, condemned them with an overthrow, making them an example of those that shall live ungodly,

name: Epistle of James
text: and delivered righteous Lot, wearied out with the licentious conduct of the ungodly;

name: Epistle of James
text: for the righteous man dwelling among them, by seeing and hearing, vexed his righteous soul from day to day with their lawless deeds:

name: Epistle of James
text: the Lord knows how to deliver the godly out of temptation, and to keep the unrighteous to the day of judgment to be punished,

name: Epistle of James
text: but especially those that walk after the flesh in unclean desire, and despise governments. Presumptuous, self-willed men, they tremble not while blaspheming dignities;

name: Epistle of James
text: whereas angels, who are greater in strength and power, bring no railing accusation against them before the Lord;

name: Epistle of James
text: but these, as irrational animals made by nature for capture and destruction, speaking evil of things in which they are ignorant, shall also perish in their corruption,

name: Epistle of James
text: thus receiving the reward of unrighteousness, who count reveling in the daytime a delight; spots and blemishes they are reveling in their deceits while feasting with you,422

name: Epistle of James
text: having eyes full of an adulteress, and that can not cease from sin, seducing unsteady souls, having a heart exercised in covetousness, children of the curse:

name: Epistle of James
text: having left the straight way, they have turned aside, following the way of Balaam the son of Beor, who loved the wages of unrighteousness,

name: Epistle of James
text: but was reproved for his iniquity: the dumb beast of burden speaking with man’s voice forbade the madness of the prophet.

name: Epistle of James
text: These are wells without water, and mists driven by a tempest, for whom the blackness of darkness is reserved.

name: Epistle of James
text: For speaking great swelling words of vanity, they seduce in the desires of the flesh by lasciviousness those that are just escaping from them that live in error,

name: Epistle of James
text: promising them freedom, while they themselves are servants of corruption; for by whom any one has been overcome, by him has he also been made a servant.

name: Epistle of James
text: For if, after escaping from the pollutions of the world through the knowledge of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ, they are again entangled in these and overcome, their last state becomes worse than the first.

name: Epistle of James
text: For it had been better for them not to have known the way of righteousness, than having known it to turn from the holy commandment that had been delivered to them.

name: Epistle of James
text: That of the true proverb has happened to them: A dog turned back to his own vomit; and: A sow washed to wallowing in the mire.

name: Epistle of James
text: Peter 3

name: Epistle of James
text: This now, beloved, is the second epistle that I write to you, in both of which I stir up your pure mind by way of remembrance,

name: Epistle of James
text: that you be mindful of the words spoken before by the holy prophets, and of the commandment of the Lord and Saviour, that was given by your apostles,

name: Epistle of James
text: knowing this first, that there shall come in the last days shameless scoffers walking according to their own desires,

name: Epistle of James
text: and saying: Where is the promise of his coming? For since the fathers fell asleep, all things thus continue from the beginning of the creation.

name: Epistle of James
text: For this they willingly know not, that the heavens were of old and the earth from water and by means of water consisting by the word of God,

name: Epistle of James
text: by which the then world, having been overflowed with water,

name: Epistle of James
text: but the present heavens and earth are kept in store by the same word, reserved for fire at the day of judgment and perdition of ungodly men.

name: Epistle of James
text: But be not ignorant of this one thing, beloved, that one day with the Lord is as a thousand years, and a thousand years as one day.

name: Epistle of James
text: The Lord delays not concerning the promise, as some count delaying, but is longsuffering for your sake, not willing that any should perish, but that all should come to repentance.

name: Epistle of James
text: But the day of the Lord will come as a thief, in which the heavens shall pass away with a great noise, and the elements shall melt with fervent heat, and the earth and the works that are in it shall be burned up.

name: Epistle of James
text: As all these things are thus to be dissolved, what manner of persons ought you to be in holy behavior and godliness,

name: Epistle of James
text: looking for and hastening the coming of the day of God, because of which the heavens being on fire shall be dissolved and the elements shall melt with fervent heat?

name: Epistle of James
text: But we, according to his promise, look for new heavens and a new earth, in which dwells righteousness.

name: Epistle of James
text: Wherefore, beloved, as you look for these things, be diligent to be found spotless and blameless before him in peace,

name: Epistle of James
text: and regard the longsuffering of our Lord salvation, even as our beloved brother Paul, according to the wisdom that is given to him, has written to you,

name: Epistle of James
text: as also in all his epistles speaking in them of these things, in which things are some hard to be understood, which the unlearned and unsteady wrest, as they do also the other Scriptures, to their own destruction.

name: Epistle of James
text: Do you then, beloved, knowing it before, beware lest being led away by the error of the lawless you fall from your own steadfastness,

name: Epistle of James
text: but grow in grace and the knowledge of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ. To him be glory both now and to the day of eternity.424 Epistle of John 1st

name: Epistle of James
text: John 1

name: Epistle of James
text: That which was from the beginning, which we have heard, which we have seen with our eyes, which we looked upon and our hands handled, of the word of life;

name: Epistle of James
text: and the life was manifested, and we have seen and do testify and declare to you the life eternal, which was with the Father and was manifested to us:

name: Epistle of James
text: that which we have seen and heard, declare we to you, that you also may have fellowship with us. And our fellowship indeed is with the Father and with his Son Jesus Christ.

name: Epistle of James
text: And these things write we to you, that your joy may be made full.

name: Epistle of James
text: And this is the message that we have heard from him, and declare again to you, that God is light and darkness in him there is none.

name: Epistle of James
text: If we say that we have fellowship with him, and walk in darkness, we lie and do not the truth;

name: Epistle of James
text: but if we walk in the light as he himself is in the light, we have fellowship one with another, and the blood of Jesus his Son cleanses us from all sin.

name: Epistle of James
text: If we say that we have no sin, we deceive ourselves and the truth is not in us.

name: Epistle of James
text: If we confess our sins, faithful is he and righteous to forgive us the sins and cleanse us from all unrighteousness.

name: Epistle of James
text: If we say that we have not sinned, we make him a liar, and his word is not in us,

name: Epistle of James
text: John 2

name: Epistle of James
text: My little children, these things write I to you that you sin not. And if any one sin, we have an advocate with the Father, Jesus Christ the righteous;

name: Epistle of James
text: and he himself is the expiation for our sins, not for ours only, however, but also for the whole world.

name: Epistle of James
text: And in this we know that we have known him, if we keep his commandments.

name: Epistle of James
text: He that says: I have known him and keeps not his commandments is a liar, and the truth is not in him;

name: Epistle of James
text: but whoever keeps his word, truly in him has the love of God been perfected. In this we know that we are in him.

name: Epistle of James
text: He that says that he abides in him ought himself also so to walk as

name: Epistle of James
text: Beloved, no new commandment write I to you, but an old commandment, which you had from the beginning: the old commandment is the word which you heard.

name: Epistle of James
text: Again a new commandment write I to you, which thing is true in him and in you, because the darkness is passing away and the true light now shines.

name: Epistle of James
text: He that says that he is in the light, and hates his brother, is in darkness till now.

name: Epistle of James
text: He that loves his brother abides in the light, and there is no stumbling-block in him;

name: Epistle of James
text: but he that hates his brother is in darkness, and walks in darkness, and knows not whither he goes, because darkness has blinded his eyes.

name: Epistle of James
text: I write to you, little children, because your sins have been forgiven for his name’s sake.

name: Epistle of James
text: I write to you, fathers, because you have known him that is from the beginning. I write to you, young men, because you have overcome the wicked one. I have written to you, little children, because you have known the Father.

name: Epistle of James
text: I have written to you, fathers, because you have known him that is from the beginning. I have written to you, young men, because you are strong, and the word of God abides in you, and you have overcome the wicked one,

name: Epistle of James
text: Love not the world, neither the things that are in the world. If any one love the world, the love of the Father is not in him;

name: Epistle of James
