name: Paul to the Romans
text: Paul, a servant of Jesus Christ, a called apostle, set apart to the gospel of God,

name: Paul to the Romans
text: which he announced beforehand through his prophets in the holy Scriptures,

name: Paul to the Romans
text: concerning his Son, who was born of the posterity of David according to the flesh,

name: Paul to the Romans
text: who was constituted Son of God in power, according to the spirit of holiness, from the resurrection of the dead, Jesus Christ our Lord,

name: Paul to the Romans
text: through whom we received grace and apostleship in order to the obedience of faith among all the nations for his name’s sake,

name: Paul to the Romans
text: among whom are you also the called, of Jesus Christ:

name: Paul to the Romans
text: to all that are in Rome, beloved of God, called saints. Grace to you and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: First, I thank my God through Jesus Christ concerning you all, that your faith is spoken of in all the world.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: For God is my witness, whom I serve in my spirit in the gospel of his Son, how unceasingly I make mention of you,

name: Paul to the Romans
text: always in my prayers making request if by any means now at last I may be prospered in the will of God to come to you.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: For I greatly desire to see you, that I may share with you some spiritual gift, in order that you may be strengthened;

name: Paul to the Romans
text: that is, that I may be comforted together among you through the faith that is in each other, both yours and mine.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: But I desire that you be not ignorant, brethren, that I often purposed to come to you, and have been hindered to the present time, that I might have some fruit also among you, even as among the rest of the Gentiles.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: Both to Greeks and to Barbarians, both to wise and to unwise, am I debtor:

name: Paul to the Romans
text: so as far as I am able, I am ready to preach the gospel to you also that are in Rome.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: For I am not ashamed of the gospel; for it is the power of God in order to salvation to every one that believes, to the Jew first, and also to the Greek.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: For in it is revealed God’s righteousness by faith for faith; as it is written: He that is righteous by faith shall live.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: For the wrath of God is revealed from heaven against all ungodliness and unrighteousness of men that repress the truth in

name: Paul to the Romans
text: because that which is known of God is manifest in them, for God has manifested it to them.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: For his attributes which are invisible, since the creation of the world, are clearly seen, being perceived by the things that are made, both his eternal power and divinity, so that they are without excuse;

name: Paul to the Romans
text: because, though they knew God, they did not glorify him as God, or give him thanks, but became vain in their reasonings, and their heart, void of understanding, was darkened.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: Professing to be wise, they became fools,

name: Paul to the Romans
text: and exchanged the glory of the incorruptible God for the likeness of an image of corruptible man, and of birds, and fourfooted beasts, and creeping things.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: Wherefore God delivered them up in the desires of their hearts to uncleanness, so that their bodies were dishonored among no them;

name: Paul to the Romans
text: and these exchanged the truth of God for a lie, and worshipped and served the creature more than the Creator, who is blessed for ever: Amen.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: For this reason God delivered them up to dishonorable passions; for their females exchanged the natural use for that against nature,

name: Paul to the Romans
text: and in like manner also the males, leaving the natural use of the female, were inflamed in their lust one for another, males with males working the indecency, and receiving in themselves the due reward of their error.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: And as they did not approve of holding God in their knowledge, God delivered them up to a mind incapable of approving, that they might do things unbecoming,

name: Paul to the Romans
text: having been filled with all unrighteousness, wickedness malice, covetousness; full of envy murder, strife, deceit, malignity

name: Paul to the Romans
text: whisperers, backbiters, haters of God, insolent, haughty, boasters: inventors of evil things, disobedient to parents,

name: Paul to the Romans
text: without understanding, covenant-breakers, without natural affection, unmerciful:

name: Paul to the Romans
text: who, acknowledging the just decree of God, that those who practice such things are worthy of death, not only do them, but approve those that practice them.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: Wherefore thou art inexcusable, O man, whoever thou art that judges! For in what thou judgest the other, thou condemnest thyself; for thou that judgest doest the same things.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: For we know that the judgment of God is according to truth, against those that practice such things.272

name: Paul to the Romans
text: But thinkest thou this, O man that judgest those who practice such things, and doest the same, that thou shalt escape the judgment of God?

name: Paul to the Romans
text: Or dost thou despise the riches of his goodness and forbearance and longsuffering, not understanding that the goodness of God leads thee to repentance?

name: Paul to the Romans
text: But, according to thy hardness and impenitent heart, thou dost treasure up for thyself wrath in a day of wrath and revelation of the righteous judgment of God,

name: Paul to the Romans
text: who will render to each one according to his works;

name: Paul to the Romans
text: to those that, by perseverance in good work, seek for glory and honor and incorruptibility, eternal life;

name: Paul to the Romans
text: but to those that are of party-spirit, and obey not the truth, but obey unrighteousness, wrath and indignation shall be rendered.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: Affliction and anguish shall be on every soul of man that works out that which is evil, of the Jew first, and also of the Greek;

name: Paul to the Romans
text: but glory and honor and peace to every one that works that which is good, to the Jew first, and also to the Greek.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: For there is no acceptance of persons with God.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: For as many as sinned without law shall also perish without law; and as many as sinned under the law shall be judged by the law;

name: Paul to the Romans
text: for not the hearers of law are righteous before God, but the doers of law shall be declared righteous.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: For whenever Gentiles, that have no law, do by nature the things of the law, these, not having law, are a law to themselves:

name: Paul to the Romans
text: who show the work of the law written in their hearts, their conscience also bearing testimony, and their reasonings between one another bringing accusation, or also making excuse

name: Paul to the Romans
text: in the day when God shall judge the secrets of men through Jesus Christ according to my gospel.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: But if thou art named Jew, and restest on the law, and makest thy boast in God,

name: Paul to the Romans
text: and knowest his will, and provest things that differ, being instructed out of the law;

name: Paul to the Romans
text: and art confident that thou thyself art a guide of the blind, a light to those that are in darkness,

name: Paul to the Romans
text: an instructor of the foolish, a teacher of babes, having the form of knowledge and of truth in the law:

name: Paul to the Romans
text: thou, then, that teachest another, teachest not thou thyself? Thou that preachest that men should not steal, dost thou steal?

name: Paul to the Romans
text: Thou that sayest that men should not commit adultery, dost thou commit adultery? Thou that abhorrest idols, dost thou rob temples?

name: Paul to the Romans
text: Thou that makest thy boast in the law, through transgression of

name: Paul to the Romans
text: For the name of God is blasphemed among the Gentiles because of you, as it is written.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: For circumcision indeed profits if thou keep the law; but if thou be a transgressor of law, thy circumcision has become uncircumcision.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: If, then, the uncircumcision keep the judgments of the law, shall not his uncircumcision be counted for circumcision?

name: Paul to the Romans
text: And that which is by birth uncircumcision, if it keep the law, will judge thee, who with letter and circumcision art a transgressor of law.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: For he is not a Jew that is one outwardly, neither is that circumcision which is outward in the flesh;

name: Paul to the Romans
text: but he is a Jew who is one inwardly, and circumcision is that of the heart, in spirit, not in letter, whose praise is not of men, but of God.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: What, then, the pre-eminence of the Jew, or what the profit of circumcision?

name: Paul to the Romans
text: Much in every way. First, indeed, that they were intrusted with the oracles of God.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: What then? if some were unfaithful, will their unfaithfulness make null the faithfulness of God?

name: Paul to the Romans
text: Let it not be; but let God become true, but every man a liar, as it is written: That thou mayest be declared just in thy words and mayest overcome when thou art judged.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: But if our unrighteousness renders God’s righteousness conspicuous, what shall we say? Is God unrighteous who brings on us the punishment? I speak as a man.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: Let it not be; since how shall God judge the world?

name: Paul to the Romans
text: For if the truth of God has, through my lie, become more abundant for his glory, why am I also still judged as a sinner?

name: Paul to the Romans
text: And why not say (as we are blasphemously reported, and as some affirm that we do say): Let us do the evil, that the good may come? whose condemnation is just.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: What then? Do we excel? Not at all; for we have before accused both Jews and Greeks all of being under sin,

name: Paul to the Romans
text: as it is written: There is none righteous, no, not one;

name: Paul to the Romans
text: there is none that understands, there is none that seeks after God:

name: Paul to the Romans
text: they have all gone out of the way, they have together become unprofitable: there is none that does good, there is not even one.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: Their throat is an open sepulcher; with their tongues they have used deceit, the poison of asps is under their lips.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: Whose mouth is full of cursing and bitterness.274

name: Paul to the Romans
text: Swift are their feet to shed blood,

name: Paul to the Romans
text: destruction and misery are in their ways,

name: Paul to the Romans
text: and the way of peace have they not known.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: There is no fear of God before their eyes.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: But we know that whatever things the law says, it speaks to those under the law, that every mouth may be stopped, and all the world become guilty before God.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: Because by works of law shall no flesh be declared righteous in his sight; for through law is the knowledge of sin.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: But now without law the righteousness of God has been made manifest, being witnessed by the law and the prophets:

name: Paul to the Romans
text: I say, the righteousness of God, through faith in Jesus Christ, to all that believe. For there is no difference;

name: Paul to the Romans
text: for all sinned and do come short of the glory of God,

name: Paul to the Romans
text: being justified freely by his grace, through the redemption that is in Christ Jesus,

name: Paul to the Romans
text: whom God set forth as a propitiatory sacrifice through faith in his blood, for a manifestation of his righteousness, because of the passing by of past sins

name: Paul to the Romans
text: in the forbearance of God, with a view to the manifestation of his righteousness in the present time, in order that he might be righteous, and declare righteous him that is of the faith of Jesus.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: Where, then, is the boasting? It is excluded. Through what law? Of works? No; but through the law of faith.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: We conclude, then, that a man is declared righteous by faith, without works of law.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: Is he the God of the Jews only? Is he not also of the Gentiles? Yes, of the Gentiles also.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: Seeing there is one God who will declare the circumcision righteous by faith and the uncircumcision through the faith.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: Do we, then, make law void through faith? Let it not be: on the other hand, we establish law.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: What, then, shall we say that Abraham, our forefather, has found according to the flesh?

name: Paul to the Romans
text: For, if Abraham was justified by works, he has cause for boasting, but not before God.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: For what says the Scripture? Abraham believed God, and it was counted to him for righteousness.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: But to him that works, the reward is not counted as a favor, but as a

name: Paul to the Romans
text: to him, however, that works not, but believes on him that justifies the ungodly man, his faith is counted for righteousness.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: Even as David also speaks of the blessedness of the man to whom God counts righteousness without works:

name: Paul to the Romans
text: Blessed are they whose transgressions are forgiven, and whose sins are covered:

name: Paul to the Romans
text: blessed is the man whose sin the Lord will not count.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: Is this blessedness, then, upon the circumcision only, or also upon the uncircumcision? For we say: Faith was counted to Abraham for righteousness.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: How, then, was it counted? While he was in circumcision, or in uncircumcision? Not in circumcision, but in uncircumcision.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: And he received a sign of circumcision, a seal of the righteousness of the faith which he had while in uncircumcision, that he might be the father of all that believe while yet in uncircumcision, that righteousness might be counted to them,

name: Paul to the Romans
text: and the father of circumcision to them that are not of the circumcision only, but that also walk in the steps of the faith of our father Abraham, which he had while in uncircumcision.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: For not through law was the promise to Abraham, or to his posterity, that he should be heir of the world, but through the righteousness of faith.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: For if they that are of law are heirs, faith is made void, and the promise is rendered powerless;

name: Paul to the Romans
text: for the law works wrath; for where no law is, neither is there transgression.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: Therefore it is of faith, that it might be according to grace, in order that the promise may be sure to all the posterity; not to that of the law only, but also to that of the faith of Abraham, who is the father of us all.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: As it is written: A father of many nations have I made thee before him whom he believed, even God, who makes the dead alive and calls things that are not as if they are:

name: Paul to the Romans
text: who against hope on hope believed, in order that he might become a father of many nations, according to that which was spoken: So shall thy posterity be;

name: Paul to the Romans
text: and not being weak in faith, he considered his own body that had become dead, being about a hundred years old and the deadness of Sarah’s womb;

name: Paul to the Romans
text: but in regard to the promise of God he doubted not through unbelief, but grew strong in faith, giving glory to God,

name: Paul to the Romans
text: and being fully persuaded that what he had promised he was able also to perform.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: Wherefore also it was counted to him for righteousness.276

name: Paul to the Romans
text: It was not written, however, for his sake, only that it was counted to him,

name: Paul to the Romans
text: but also for the sake of us. to whom it shall be counted if we believe on him that raised Jesus our Lord from the dead,

name: Paul to the Romans
text: who was delivered up because of our offenses, and raised because of our justification.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: Therefore, being justified by faith, we have peace with God through our Lord Jesus Christ,

name: Paul to the Romans
text: through whom, also, we have had the access, by faith, into this grace in which we stand, and we boast in hope of the glory of God.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: And not only so, but we also boast in afflictions, knowing that affliction works endurance,

name: Paul to the Romans
text: and endurance approval, and approval, hope;

name: Paul to the Romans
text: and hope makes not ashamed, because the love of God has been poured out in our hearts through the Holy Spirit that was given to us.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: Furthermore, we being yet without strength, at the proper time Christ died for the ungodly.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: For scarcely for a righteous man will one die; though for the good man perhaps some one would even dare to die;

name: Paul to the Romans
text: but God renders his love for us conspicuous in this, that, we being yet sinners, Christ died for us.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: Much more, then, being now justified in his blood, we shall be saved through him from the wrath.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: For if being enemies we were reconciled to God through the death of his Son, much more having been reconciled we shall be saved in his life;

name: Paul to the Romans
text: and not only so, but also glorying in God through our Lord Jesus Christ, through whom we have now received the reconciliation.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: Therefore, as through one man sin entered into the world, and through sin death, and so death passed through upon all men, inasmuch as all sinned;

name: Paul to the Romans
text: for till the law sin was in the world, but sin is not imputed where there is no law;

name: Paul to the Romans
text: yet, death reigned from Adam to Moses, even over those that did not sin after the likeness of the transgression of Adam, who is a type of the coming one.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: Yet, not as the offense, so also the gracious gift; for if through the offense of the one the many died, much more did the grace of God and the gift in the grace of the one man, Jesus Christ, abound to the

name: Paul to the Romans
text: And not as through one that sinned is the gift; for the judgment passed from one offense to condemnation, but the gracious gift from many offenses to the righteous decree.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: For if, in the offense of one, death reigned through the one, much more shall they that receive the abundance of grace and of the gift of righteousness reign in life through the one, Jesus Christ.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: Therefore, as through one offense judgment came upon all men to condemnation, so also through one righteous deed, judgment came upon all men to justification of life.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: For as through the disobedience of the one man the many were constituted sinners, so also through the obedience of the one shall the many be constituted righteous.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: But law came in beside, that the offense might abound; but where sin abounded, grace exceedingly abounded,

name: Paul to the Romans
text: that, as sin reigned in death, so also grace might reign through righteousness to eternal life through Jesus Christ our Lord.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: What, then, shall we say? Let us continue in sin, that grace may abound?

name: Paul to the Romans
text: Let it not be. How shall we that died to sin live any longer in it?

name: Paul to the Romans
text: Know you not that as many of us as were baptized into Christ Jesus, were baptized into his death?

name: Paul to the Romans
text: We were, therefore, buried with him through baptism into death, that as Christ was raised from the dead through the glory of the Father, so we, also, might walk in newness of life.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: For if we have grown together with the likeness of his death, we shall grow together also with the likeness of his resurrection,

name: Paul to the Romans
text: knowing this, that our old man was crucified with him, that the body of sin might be made powerless, that we should no longer serve sin;

name: Paul to the Romans
text: for he that has died has been acquitted of sin.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: But if we died with Christ, we believe that we shall also live with him,

name: Paul to the Romans
text: knowing that Christ, having been raised from the dead, dies no more: death no longer has dominion over him.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: For in that he died, to sin he died once for all; but in that he lives, he lives to God.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: Thus do you also count yourselves dead indeed to sin, but living to God in Christ Jesus.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: Therefore let not sin reign in your mortal body, in order to obey its desires;278

name: Paul to the Romans
text: neither present your members as instruments of unrighteousness to sin, but present yourselves to God as being alive from the dead, and your members as instruments of righteousness to God.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: For sin shall not have dominion over you; for you are not under law, but under grace.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: What then? shall we sin because we are not under law, but under grace? Let it not be.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: Know you not that to whom you present yourselves servants for obedience, his servants you are whom you obey, either of sin to death, or of obedience to righteousness?

name: Paul to the Romans
text: But thanks to God that you were servants of sin, but you obeyed from the heart the form of teaching into which you were delivered,

name: Paul to the Romans
text: and having been made free from sin, you became servants to righteousness.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: I speak as a man, because of the weakness of your flesh. For as you present your members servants to uncleanness and to lawlessness in order to lawlessness, so now present your members servants to righteousness in order to sanctification.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: For when you were servants of sin you were free in respect to righteousness.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: What fruit, therefore, had you then? Of which things you are now ashamed; for the end of those things is death.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: But now, having been made free from sin, and having become servants to God, you have your fruit to sanctification, and the end, life eternal.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: For the wages of sin is death; but the gracious gift of God is life eternal in Christ Jesus our Lord.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: Know you not, brethren, for I speak to those that know law, that the law has dominion over the man as long as he lives?

name: Paul to the Romans
text: For the married woman is bound by the law to the living husband; but if the husband shall have died, she is loosed from the law of the husband.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: So then, if, while her husband lives, she be married to another man, she shall be called an adulteress; but if her husband shall have died, she is free from his law, so that she is not an adulteress, though she be married to another man.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: So then, my brethren, you also became dead to the law through the body of Christ, in order that you should be married to another, him that was raised from the dead, that we should bring forth fruit to

name: Paul to the Romans
text: For when we were in the flesh, the passions of sins which were through the law wrought in our members to bring forth fruit to death;

name: Paul to the Romans
text: but now we have been delivered from the law, having died to that in which we were held, so that we serve in newness of spirit and not in oldness of letter.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: What, then, shall we say? Is the law sin? Let it not be; but I had not known sin except through law; for I had not known desire unless the law had said: Thou shalt not desire.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: But sin, taking occasion, through the commandment wrought in me all manner of desire; for without law sin is dead.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: Now, I was alive without law once; but when the commandment came, sin became alive,

name: Paul to the Romans
text: and I died; and the commandment which was for life, this was found by me to be for death.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: For sin, taking occasion, through the commandment deceived me, and through it slew me.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: So, then, the law is holy, and the commandment holy and just and good.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: Did, then, that which is good become death to me? Let it not be; but sin, that it might appear sin, working out death to me through that which is good, that sin through the commandment might become exceedingly sinful.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: For we know that the law is spiritual: but I am flesh, sold under sin.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: For what I work I know not; for I practice not what I wish, but what I hate this I do.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: But if I do this that I wish not, I agree with the law that it is good;

name: Paul to the Romans
text: and now I no longer do it, but sin that dwells in me.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: For I know that there dwells in me, that is, in my flesh, no good. For to will is present with me, but to work out the beautiful, not;

name: Paul to the Romans
text: for the good that I wish I do not, but the evil that I hate, this I practice.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: But if I do this that I wish not, I no longer do it, but sin that dwells in me.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: I find, then, the law, to me wishing to do the good, —That evil is present with me;

name: Paul to the Romans
text: for I delight in the law of God according to the inward man,

name: Paul to the Romans
text: but I see a different law in my members warring against the law of my mind, and making me a captive in the law of sin that is in my members.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: Wretched man that I am: who shall deliver me from the body of this death?280

name: Paul to the Romans
text: Thanks to God, through Jesus Christ our Lord: so, then, I myself with the mind indeed serve the law of God, but with the flesh the law of sin.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: There is, therefore, now no condemnation to those who are in Christ Jesus.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: For the law of the Spirit of life in Christ Jesus made thee free from the law of sin and of death.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: For what the law could not do, because it was weak through the flesh, God, sending his own Son in the likeness of the flesh of sin, and on account of sin, condemned sin in the flesh,

name: Paul to the Romans
text: that the righteous demand of the law might be fulfilled in us, who walk not according to the flesh, but according to the Spirit.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: For those that are according to the flesh mind the things of the flesh, but those that are according to the Spirit, the things of the Spirit.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: For the mind of the flesh is death, but the mind of the Spirit is life and peace.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: Because the mind of the flesh is enmity towards God; for it is not subjected to the law of God, neither indeed can it be.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: And they that are in the flesh can not please God.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: You, however, are not in the flesh, but in the Spirit, if so be that the Spirit of God dwells in you. And if any one has not the Spirit of Christ, he is none of his.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: But if Christ is in you, the body is dead because of sin, but the spirit is life because of righteousness.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: And if the Spirit of him who raised Jesus from the dead dwells in you, he who raised Christ Jesus from the dead will also make your mortal bodies alive through his Spirit that dwells in you.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: Therefore, brethren, we are debtors, not to the flesh, that we should live according to the flesh.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: For if you live according to the flesh, you shall die; but if through the Spirit you put to death the deeds of the body, you shall live.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: For as many as are led by the Spirit of God, these are sons of God.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: For you did not receive the spirit of bondage again to fear; but you received the Spirit of adoption, in which we cry: Abba, Father.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: The Spirit itself bears testimony with our spirit that we are children of God.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: But if children, also heirs: heirs, indeed, of God, but joint-heirs with Christ, if so be that we suffer with him. that we may also be glorified with him.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: For I reckon that the sufferings of the present time are not worthy

name: Paul to the Romans
text: For the earnest expectation of the creation awaits the revelation of the sons of God.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: For the creation was subjected to vanity, not willingly, but by reason of him who subjected it,

name: Paul to the Romans
text: in hope that the creation itself shall be freed from the bondage of corruption into the liberty of the glory of the children of God.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: For we know that the whole creation groans together and is in pain together till now;

name: Paul to the Romans
text: and not only so, but ourselves also, having the firstfruits of the Spirit, even we ourselves groan within ourselves, awaiting the adoption, the redemption of our body.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: For by hope were we saved; but hope seen is not hope; for what any one sees, why does he also hope for it?

name: Paul to the Romans
text: But if we hope for that which we see not, we with patience wait for it.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: And in like manner the Spirit also helps our weakness. For we know not what we shall pray for as we ought, but the Spirit itself intercedes with groanings unutterable:

name: Paul to the Romans
text: he, however, who searches the hearts knows what is the mind of the Spirit, that he intercedes for the saints according to the will of God.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: But we know that to those who love God all things work together for good, to those who are called according to his purpose.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: For whom he foreknew, he also predestinated to be conformed to the image of his Son, that he might be firstborn among many brethren;

name: Paul to the Romans
text: and whom he predestinated, these he also called; and whom he called, these he also declared righteous; and whom he declared righteous, these he also made glorious.* * By conferring on them the doxa—glory of the New Covenant.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: What shall we then say to these things? If God is for us, who is against us?

name: Paul to the Romans
text: He indeed that spared not his own Son, but delivered him up for us all, how will he not also with him freely give us all things?

name: Paul to the Romans
text: Who shall bring a charge against God’s elect? It is God who justifies.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: Who is he that condemns? It is Christ Jesus who died; yes, more, who has risen, who is at the right hand of God; who also intercedes for us.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: Who shall separate us from the love of Christ? Shall affliction, or distress, or persecution, or hunger, or nakedness, or danger, or the sword?282

name: Paul to the Romans
text: as it is written: For thy sake we are killed all the day; we are counted as; sheep for slaughter.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: But in all these things we do more than conquer through him that loved us.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: For I am persuaded that neither death nor life, nor angels nor principalities, nor things present nor things to come, nor powers

name: Paul to the Romans
text: nor height nor depth, nor any other created thing, shall be able to separate us from the love of God that is in Christ Jesus our Lord.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: I speak the truth in Christ, I lie not, my conscience bearing me testimony in the Holy Spirit,

name: Paul to the Romans
text: that I have great grief and unceasing sorrow in my heart.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: For I could wish that I myself were accursed from Christ for my brethren, my kinsmen according to the flesh,

name: Paul to the Romans
text: who are Israelites, to whom belong the adoption, and the glory, and the covenants, and the giving of the law, and the religious service, and the promises;

name: Paul to the Romans
text: whose are the fathers, and from whom is Christ according to the flesh: who is over all, God blessed for ever, Amen.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: But I do not say such a thing as: The word of God has failed. For these are not all Israel, who are of Israel;

name: Paul to the Romans
text: neither, because they are the posterity of Abraham, are all children; but; In Isaac shall thy posterity be called:

name: Paul to the Romans
text: that is, the children of the flesh, these are not the children of God, but the children of the promise are counted as the posterity.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: For the word of promise was this: According to this season will I come, and Sarah shall have a son.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: And not only this, but also Rebecca, having conceived by one, our father Isaac, —

name: Paul to the Romans
text: for the children not yet having been born, neither having done any good or ill, that the purpose of God according to election might stand, not of works, but of him that calls, —

name: Paul to the Romans
text: it was said to her: The elder shall serve the younger,

name: Paul to the Romans
text: as it is written: Jacob I loved, but Esau I hated.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: What, then, shall we say? Is there unrighteousness with God? Let it not be.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: For he says to Moses: I will have mercy on whom I have mercy, and I will have compassion on whom I have compassion.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: So, then, not of him that wills nor of him that runs, but of God

name: Paul to the Romans
text: For the Scripture says to Pharaoh: For this same purpose did I raise thee up, that I might show in thee my power, and that my name might be published in all the earth.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: Therefore, on whom he wills he has mercy, and whom he wills he hardens.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: Thou wilt say to me therefore: Why does he yet find fault? For who has resisted his will?

name: Paul to the Romans
text: Yes, rather, O man, who art thou that replies against God? Shall the thing moulded say to him that moulded it: Why didst thou make me thus?

name: Paul to the Romans
text: Has not the potter right over the clay to make of the same lump one vessel for honor and another for dishonor?

name: Paul to the Romans
text: But if God—willing to show his wrath, and to make known his power, endured in much longsuffering vessels of wrath fitted for destruction,

name: Paul to the Romans
text: also that he might make known the riches of his glory on vessels of mercy, which he before prepared for glory?

name: Paul to the Romans
text: whom he also called, us not only from among the Jews, but also from among the Gentiles,

name: Paul to the Romans
text: as he also says in Hosea: I will call that my people which was not my people, and her beloved, that was not beloved;

name: Paul to the Romans
text: and it shall come to pass in the place where it was said to them: You are not my people, there shall they be called sons of the living God.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: But Isaiah cries concerning Israel: Though the number of the sons of Israel be as the sand of the sea, the remnant shall be saved.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: For a fulfilling and cutting short of the word will the Lord make on the earth.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: And as Isaiah predicted: Unless the Lord of Sabaoth had left us posterity, we had become as Sodom and had been made like Gomorrah.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: What, then, shall we say? that the Gentiles, that were not following after righteousness, attained to righteousness, the righteousness that is of faith;

name: Paul to the Romans
text: but Israel, following after a law of righteousness, did not attain to a law.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: Why? because they sought it not by faith, but as by works: for they stumbled at the stone of stumbling,

name: Paul to the Romans
text: as it is written: Behold, I lay in Zion a stone of stumbling and a rock of offense; and he that believes on him shall not be ashamed.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: Brethren, the good pleasure of my heart, and my prayer to God for them, is for their salvation;284

name: Paul to the Romans
text: For I bear them testimony that they have a zeal for God, but not according to knowledge.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: For, being ignorant of God’s righteousness, and seeking to establish their own righteousness, they have not submitted themselves to the righteousness of God.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: For Christ is the end of the law for righteousness to every one that believes.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: For Moses writes that the man that does the righteousness of the law shall live in it.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: But the righteousness that is of faith speaks thus: Say not in thy heart: Who shall ascend into heaven? that is, to bring Christ down:

name: Paul to the Romans
text: or, Who shall descend into the abyss? that is, to bring Christ up from the dead.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: But what says it? The word is near thee, in thy mouth and in thy heart: that is, the word of faith which we preach.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: Because, if thou shalt confess with thy mouth that Jesus is Lord, and shalt believe in thy heart that God raised him from the dead, thou shalt be saved;

name: Paul to the Romans
text: for with the heart faith is exercised in order to righteousness, and with the mouth confession is made in order to salvation.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: For the Scripture says: Whoever believes on him shall not be ashamed.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: For there is no difference between Jew and Greek; for the same is Lord of all, rich toward all that call upon him.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: For every one that calls on the name of the Lord shall be saved.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: How, then, shall they call on him in whom they have not believed? And how shall they believe in him of whom they have not heard? And how shall they hear without a preacher?

name: Paul to the Romans
text: And how shall they preach unless they be sent? As it is written: How beautiful are the feet of them that bring glad tidings of good things.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: But they have not all obeyed the gospel. For Isaiah says: Lord, who has believed that which was heard by us?

name: Paul to the Romans
text: So, then, faith comes from what is heard, and that which is heard comes through the word of God.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: But I say, have they not heard? Yes, verily, Their sound went forth into all the earth, and their words to the end of the world.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: But I say, did not Israel know? First Moses says: I will provoke you to jealousy by that which is no nation, by a foolish nation I will excite you to anger.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: But Isaiah is very bold, and says: I was found by them that sought me not, I became manifest to them that asked not after me.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: But of Israel he says: All day long I stretched forth my hands to a

name: Paul to the Romans
text: I say, then, Did God cast away his people? It can not be; for I am an Israelite, of the posterity of Abraham, of the tribe of Benjamin.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: God did not cast away his people whom he foreknew. Know you not what the Scripture says in speaking of Elijah, how he complains to God against Israel?

name: Paul to the Romans
text: Lord, thy prophets they have killed, thy altars they have dug down, and I am left the only one, and they seek my life.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: But what says the answer of God to him? I have reserved for myself seven thousand men who have not bowed the knee to Baal.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: So, then, even in the present time there is a remnant according to the election of grace;

name: Paul to the Romans
text: now if by grace, no longer of works, since grace no longer becomes grace.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: What then? That which Israel seeks for, this he did not obtain, but the election obtained it, and the rest were hardened,

name: Paul to the Romans
text: as it is written: God gave them a spirit of stupor, eyes that they should not see, and ears that they should not hear, till this day.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: And David says: Let their table become a snare, and a trap, and a stumblingblock, and a recompense to them:

name: Paul to the Romans
text: let their eyes be darkened, that they may not see, and bow down their back always.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: I say, then, did they stumble that they should fall? It can not be; but by their fall salvation has come to the Gentiles, in order to excite them to emulation,

name: Paul to the Romans
text: But if their fall is the riches of the world and their worse estate the riches of the Gentiles, how much more their fulness.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: But I speak to you, the Gentiles. Inasmuch as I am the apostle of the Gentiles, I glorify my office,

name: Paul to the Romans
text: if in any way I may excite to emulation my own flesh and save some of them.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: For, if the casting away of them is the reconciliation of the world, what shall their reception be but life from the dead?

name: Paul to the Romans
text: But if the firstfruit is holy, so also the lump; and if the root is holy, so also the branches.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: But if some of the branches were broken off, and thou, being a wild olive, wert grafted in among them, and made a joint-partaker of the root and the fatness of the olive,

name: Paul to the Romans
text: boast not against the branches; but if thou boastest, thou bearest not the root, but the root thee.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: Thou wilt say then: The branches were broken off that I might be grafted in.286

name: Paul to the Romans
text: Well: because of unbelief they were broken off, but thou standest by faith. Be not highminded, but fear;

name: Paul to the Romans
text: for if God spared not the natural branches, neither will he spare thee.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: Behold, then, the goodness and severity of God: towards those that fell severity, but towards thee the goodness of God, if thou continue in his goodness, otherwise thou also shalt be cut off.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: And these, moreover, if they continue not in unbelief, shall be grafted in; for God is able to graft them in again.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: For if thou wert cut out of an olive tree that is wild by nature, and wert grafted contrary to nature into a good olive tree, how much more shall these the natural be grafted into their own olive tree.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: For I do not wish you, brethren, to be ignorant of this mystery, lest you should be wise in your own conceits, that hardness, in part, has come upon Israel till the fulness of the Gentiles shall have come in;

name: Paul to the Romans
text: and so all Israel shall be saved, as it is written: There shall come out of Zion the deliverer, he shall turn away ungodliness from Jacob.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: And this is the covenant which they shall have from me, when I take away their sins.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: As to the gospel they are enemies for your sake, but as to the election they are beloved for the fathers’ sakes:

name: Paul to the Romans
text: for the gifts and the calling of God are irrevocable.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: For as you in time past believed not God, but now have obtained mercy through the unbelief of these,

name: Paul to the Romans
text: so also have these now believed not, that through your mercy they also may now obtain mercy;

name: Paul to the Romans
text: for God has shut up all in unbelief, that he might have mercy upon all.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: O the depth of the riches and wisdom and knowledge of God: how unsearchable are his judgments and his ways past finding out.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: For who has known the mind of the Lord? or who has been his counsellor?

name: Paul to the Romans
text: or who has first given to him, and a recompense shall be made him?

name: Paul to the Romans
text: For of him, and through him, and for him, are all things: to him be glory through the ages. Amen.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: I beseech you therefore, brethren, through the mercies of God, to present your bodies a sacrifice: living, holy, acceptable to God, which

name: Paul to the Romans
text: And be not conformed to this age, but be transformed by the renewing of your mind, that you may prove what the will of God is, the good, and acceptable, and perfect.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: For I say, through the grace that was given to me, to every one that is among you, that he think not of himself more highly than he ought to think, but that he think soberly, as God distributed to each a measure of faith.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: For as in one body we have many members, but all the members have not the same office,

name: Paul to the Romans
text: so we the many are one body in Christ, and every one members one of another,

name: Paul to the Romans
text: but having gifts differing according to the grace that was given to us; whether prophecy, let us prophesy according to the proportion of faith;

name: Paul to the Romans
text: or ministry, let us wait on our ministry; or he that teaches, on his teaching;

name: Paul to the Romans
text: or he that exhorts, on his exhortation: he that gives, let him do it with simplicity: he that rules, with diligence: he that shows mercy, with cheerfulness.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: Let love be unfeigned. Abhor that which is evil, cleave to that which is good:

name: Paul to the Romans
text: in brotherly love, be affectionate one toward another: in honor, preferring one another:

name: Paul to the Romans
text: in diligence, not slothful: in spirit, fervent; serving the Lord;

name: Paul to the Romans
text: in hope, rejoicing: in affliction, patient: in prayer, persevering;

name: Paul to the Romans
text: communicating to the necessities of the saints; following hospitality:

name: Paul to the Romans
text: bless them that persecute you; bless, and curse not.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: Rejoice with them that rejoice, weep with them that weep.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: Be of the same mind one toward another; mind not high things, but condescend to things that are lowly: be not wise in your own conceits.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: Render to no one evil for evil; provide for things honorable in the sight of all men;

name: Paul to the Romans
text: if possible, as far as it is of you, be at peace with all men;

name: Paul to the Romans
text: avenge not yourselves, beloved, but give place to the wrath; for it is written: Vengeance is mine, I will repay, says the Lord.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: If, then, thy enemy hunger, feed him; if he thirst, give him drink; for in doing this thou shalt heap coals of fire on his head.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: Be not overcome by evil, but overcome evil with good.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: Let every soul submit himself to the authorities that are over him. For there is no authority except of God, and those that are have been appointed by God.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: So, then, he that sets himself against the authority resists the appointment of God: and they that resist shall receive to themselves condemnation.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: For rulers are not a terror to the good work, but to the evil. And dost thou desire not to be afraid of the authority? do that which is good, and thou shalt have praise from the same;

name: Paul to the Romans
text: for he is the minister of God to thee for good. But if thou do that which is evil, be afraid; for he wears not the sword in vain; for he is the minister of God, an avenger to execute wrath on him that practices that which is evil.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: Wherefore it is needful that you submit yourselves, not only because of wrath, but also because of conscience.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: For, for this reason you pay tribute also; for they are the ministers of God attending continually to this very thing.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: Render to all their dues: tribute to whom tribute is due, custom to whom custom, fear to whom fear, honor to whom honor.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: Owe no one any thing, except to love one another; for he that loves another has fulfilled the law.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: For this, Thou shalt not commit adultery, Thou shalt not kill, Thou shalt not steal, Thou shalt not desire, and, if there is any other commandment, it is briefly summed up in this saying, in this: Thou shalt love thy neighbor as thyself.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: Love works no evil to the neighbor: love, therefore, is the fulfillment of the law.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: And this, knowing the time, that it is the hour, at which we should have already awaked out of sleep; for now is our salvation nearer than when we believed.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: The night is far spent, the day is at hand. Let us therefore put off the works of darkness, and let us put on the armor of light.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: Let us walk becomingly as in the day, not in riotings and drunkenness, not in lewdness and wantonness, not in contention and envy;

name: Paul to the Romans
text: but put on the Lord Jesus Christ, and make no provision for the desires of the flesh.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: Now, him that is weak in the faith receive, not to judgments of thoughts.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: One believes that he may eat all things, another who is weak eats

name: Paul to the Romans
text: Let not him that eats despise him that eats not; and let not him that eats not judge him that eats; for God has received him.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: Who art thou that judgest another man’s servant? To his own master he stands or falls; but he shall stand, for the Lord is able to make him stand.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: One esteems one day better than another; another esteems every day alike: let each one be fully persuaded in his own mind.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: He that regards the day, to the Lord he regards it. And he that eats, to the Lord he eats, for he gives thanks to God; and he that eats not, to the Lord he eats not, and gives thanks to God.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: For no one of us lives to himself, and no one dies to himself;

name: Paul to the Romans
text: for if we live, to the Lord we live, and if we die, to the Lord we die. If, then, we live, and if we die, the Lord’s are we.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: For, for this purpose Christ died and lived, that he might be Lord both of the dead and the living.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: But why judgest thou thy brother? And why dost thou despise thy brother? For we must all stand before the judgment-seat of God.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: For it is written: As I live, says the Lord, every knee shall bow to me, and every tongue shall confess to God.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: So, then, each one of us shall give an account of himself to God.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: No longer, therefore, let us judge one another; but judge this rather, to put no stumbling-block or occasion of falling in your brother’s way.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: I know and am persuaded in the Lord Jesus that nothing is unclean of itself, but to him that thinks that anything is unclean, to him it is unclean.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: For if on account of meat thy brother is grieved, thou no longer walkest according to love. Do not by thy meat destroy him for whom Christ died.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: Let not, then, your good be evil spoken of.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: For the kingdom of God is not eating and drinking, but righteousness and peace and joy in the Holy Spirit;

name: Paul to the Romans
text: for he that in this serves Christ is acceptable to God and approved by men.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: So, then, let us pursue the things of peace, and things by which we may edify one another.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: Do not for the sake of meat overthrow the work of God. All things, indeed, are clean; but it is evil for the man that eats so as to give offense:

name: Paul to the Romans
text: it is good not to eat flesh, neither to drink wine, nor anything by which thy brother stumbles.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: The faith that thou hast, have thou to thyself in the sight of God. Blessed is he that judges not himself in that which he allows;290

name: Paul to the Romans
text: he that doubts is condemned if he eat, because he eats not from faith; and everything that is not from faith is sin.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: Now we the strong ought to bear the infirmities of the weak, and not to please ourselves.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: Let each one of us please his neighbor, for his good with a view to edification;

name: Paul to the Romans
text: for Christ pleased not himself, but, as it is written: The reproaches of them that reproached thee fell on me.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: For whatever things were formerly written, were written for our instruction, that we, through the patience and the comfort of the Scripture, might have hope.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: Now may the God of patience and of comfort grant to you to be of the same mind one toward another according to Christ Jesus,

name: Paul to the Romans
text: that with one mind you may with one mouth glorify the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: Wherefore, receive one another, as Christ also received you, to the glory of God.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: For I say that Christ became a minister of the circumcision for the truth of God, that he might confirm the promises made to the fathers,

name: Paul to the Romans
text: and that the Gentiles might glorify God for his mercy, as it is written: For this cause will I give thanks to thee among the Gentiles, and to thy name will I sing.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: And again he says: Rejoice, you Gentiles, with his people.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: And again: Praise the Lord, all you Gentiles, and applaud him, all you peoples.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: And again Isaiah says: There shall be a root of Jesse, and he that rises to rule the Gentiles; in him shall Gentiles hope.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: Now may the God of hope fill you with all joy and peace in believing, in order that you may abound in hope in the power of the Holy Spirit.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: Now, my brethren, I am persuaded, even I myself, concerning you, that you also yourselves are full of goodness, having been filled with all knowledge, able also to admonish one another.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: I have, however, written more boldly to you, brethren, in some measure, as putting you in mind because of the grace that is given to me by God,

name: Paul to the Romans
text: that I should be a minister of Christ Jesus to the Gentiles, ministering as a priest in the gospel of God, that the offering of the Gentiles might become acceptable, being sanctified in the Holy

name: Paul to the Romans
text: I have, therefore, my boasting in Christ Jesus in things pertaining to God;

name: Paul to the Romans
text: for I will not dare to speak of any of the things that Christ did not work through me for the obedience of the Gentiles, by word and deed,

name: Paul to the Romans
text: in the power of signs and wonders, in the power of the Spirit of God, so that from Jerusalem and round about as far as Illyricum I have fully preached the gospel of Christ.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: But so making it a point of honor, I have preached the gospel not where Christ was named, that I might not build on another’s foundation,

name: Paul to the Romans
text: but as it is written: They to whom no message came concerning him, shall see, and they who have not heard, shall understand.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: For which cause also I have been hindered many times from coming to you;

name: Paul to the Romans
text: but now, no longer having a place in these parts, and having for many years a strong desire to come to you,

name: Paul to the Romans
text: whenever I take my journey into Spain; for I hope, in passing through, to see you, and by you to be sent forward thither, if first I may be in some measure filled with you.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: But now I am going to Jerusalem, ministering to the saints.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: For Macedonia and Achaia have been pleased to make a contribution for the poor of the saints that are in Jerusalem.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: For they have been pleased, and their debtors they are; for if the Gentiles have shared in their spiritual things, they ought also to minister to them in carnal things.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: Having, therefore, performed this, and having secured to them this fruit, I will return through you into Spain;

name: Paul to the Romans
text: but I know that in coming to you I shall come in the fulness of the blessing of Christ.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: But I beseech you, brethren, through our Lord Jesus Christ, and through the love of the Spirit, that you strive together with me in prayers to God for me,

name: Paul to the Romans
text: that I may be delivered from the disobedient in Judea, and that my service which is for Jerusalem may be acceptable to the saints,

name: Paul to the Romans
text: that, coming to you, in joy through the will of God, I may with you be refreshed.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: The God of peace be with you all. Amen.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: I commend to you Phebe, our sister, who is a deaconess of the church that is in Cenchrea,292

name: Paul to the Romans
text: that you receive her in the Lord in a manner worthy of saints, and that you aid her in whatever matter she may have need of you; for she has been a helper of many, of myself also.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: Salute Prisca and Aquila, my fellow-laborers in Christ Jesus,

name: Paul to the Romans
text: who for my life laid down their own necks, to whom not I only give thanks, but all the churches of the Gentiles:

name: Paul to the Romans
text: salute also the church that is in their house. Salute Epenetus, my beloved, who is the firstfruits of Asia to Christ.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: Salute Mary, who labored much for us.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: Salute Andronicus and Junias, my kinsmen and my fellow- prisoners, who are well known among the apostles, who also were in Christ before me.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: Salute Amplias, my beloved in the Lord.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: Salute Urbanus, my fellow-laborer in Christ, and Stachys, my beloved.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: Salute Apelles, approved in Christ. Salute those who are of the household of Aristobulus.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: Salute Herodion my kinsman. Salute those who are of the household of Narcissus, who are in the Lord.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: Salute Tryphsena and Tryphosa, who labored in the Lord. Salute Persis the beloved, who labored much in the Lord.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: Salute Rufus, the chosen in the Lord, and his mother and mine.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: Salute Asyncritus, Phlegon, Hermes, Patrobas, Hermas, and the brethren that are with them.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: Salute Philologus and Julia, Nereus and his sister, and Olympas, and all the saints that are with them.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: Salute one another with a holy kiss. All the churches of Christ salute you.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: Now I beseech you, brethren, to mark those that cause divisions and offenses contrary to the teaching that you learned, and turn away from them;

name: Paul to the Romans
text: for such serve not our Lord Christ, but their own belly, and through good words and fair speeches deceive the hearts of the simple.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: For your obedience has come abroad to all; I therefore rejoice over you: I desire, however, that you be wise in regard to that which is good, but harmless in regard to that which is evil.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: And the God of peace will bruise Satan under your feet shortly. The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: Timothy my fellow-laborer salutes you: Lucius also, and Jason, and Sosipater, my kinsman.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: Gaius my host, and the host of the whole church, salutes you. Erastus, the treasurer of the city, salutes you; and Quartus, our brother.

name: Paul to the Romans
text: Now to him who is able to establish you according to my gospel and the preaching of Jesus Christ, according to the revelation of the mystery that was kept in silence during eternal times,

name: Paul to the Romans
text: but is now made manifest, and through the Scriptures of the prophets, according to the commandment of the eternal God, made known for obedience of faith among all nations,

name: Paul to the Romans
text: to the only wise God, through Jesus Christ: to whom be glory through the ages. Amen.294

name: Paul to Titus
text: Paul, a servant of God, but an apostle of Christ Jesus, according to the faith of God’s elect, and the acknowledgment of truth that is according to godliness,

name: Paul to Titus
text: in hope of eternal life, which God who lies not promised before the times of the ages,

name: Paul to Titus
text: but in his own times manifested his word in what is preached, with which I was intrusted according to the appointment of our Saviour God,

name: Paul to Titus
text: to Titus, my true son according to the common faith. Grace and peace from God the Father, and Christ Jesus our Saviour.

name: Paul to Titus
text: For this cause left I thee in Crete, that thou mightest further set in order the things that are wanting, and ordain elders in every city, as I had appointed thee:

name: Paul to Titus
text: if any one is blameless, the husband of one wife, having faithful children that are not accused of riotous living, nor unruly.

name: Paul to Titus
text: For the bishop must be blameless as the steward of God, not self- willed, not soon angry, not fond of wine, no striker, not eager after base gain,

name: Paul to Titus
text: but a lover of hospitality, a lover of the good, sober-minded, just, holy, having self-control,

name: Paul to Titus
text: holding fast the faithful word according to the teaching, that he may be able, in the teaching that gives health, both to exhort and convince the gainsayers.

name: Paul to Titus
text: For there are many and unruly vain talkers and deceivers, especially they of the circumcision,

name: Paul to Titus
text: whose mouths must be stopped: who subvert whole houses, teaching things that they ought not, for the sake of base gain.

name: Paul to Titus
text: Some one of them, a prophet of their own, has said: The Cretans are always liars, evil wild beasts, lazy bellies.

name: Paul to Titus
text: This testimony is true. For which cause reprove them with severity, that they may be healthy in the faith,

name: Paul to Titus
text: not giving heed to Jewish fables, and commandments of men that turn away from the truth.

name: Paul to Titus
text: To the pure all things are pure; but to the defiled and unbelieving nothing is pure, but both their mind and conscience are defiled.

name: Paul to Titus
text: God they profess to know, but in their works they deny him, being abominable and disobedient and, with regard to every good work, disapproved.

name: Paul to Titus
text: But speak thou the things that become the teaching that gives health.

name: Paul to Titus
text: That aged men be watchful, grave, sober-minded, healthy in faith, in love, in patience:

name: Paul to Titus
text: that aged women in like manner be, in behavior, reverent, not false accusers, not addicted to much wine, teachers of what is good,

name: Paul to Titus
text: that they teach the young women to love their husbands, to love their children,

name: Paul to Titus
text: to be sober-minded, chaste, workers at home, good, obedient to their own husbands, that the word of God be not blasphemed.

name: Paul to Titus
text: The younger men in like manner exhort to be sober-minded,

name: Paul to Titus
text: in all things showing thyself an example of good works, in teaching showing uncorruptness, gravity.

name: Paul to Titus
text: healthful speech that can not be condemned, that the opponent may be ashamed, having nothing evil to say of us.

name: Paul to Titus
text: Servants exhort to be subject to their own masters, to be acceptable to them in all things, not contradicting,

name: Paul to Titus
text: not taking a part for themselves, but showing all good faithfulness. that they may adorn the teaching of our Saviour God in all things.

name: Paul to Titus
text: For the grace of God that brings salvation to all men has appeared,

name: Paul to Titus
text: instructing us, that, denying ungodliness and worldly desires, we should live soberly and righteously and godly in the present age,

name: Paul to Titus
text: waiting for the blessed hope, and the appearing of the glory of our great God and Saviour Jesus Christ,

name: Paul to Titus
text: who gave himself for us that he might redeem us from all iniquity, and purify for himself a peculiar people, zealous for good works.

name: Paul to Titus
text: These things speak and exhort and reprove with all authority: let no one despise thee.

name: Paul to Titus
text: Put them in mind to be subject to rulers, to authorities, to obey, to be ready for every good work,

name: Paul to Titus
text: to revile no one, to be without contention, gentle, showing all meekness to all men.

name: Paul to Titus
text: For we also were once foolish, disobedient, deceived, serving various desires and pleasures, living in malice and envy, hateful and hating one another;

name: Paul to Titus
text: but when the kindness and philanthropy of our Saviour God appeared,

name: Paul to Titus
text: not by works of righteousness which we had done, but according to his mercy, he saved us through the bath of regeneration and renewing of the Holy Spirit,386

name: Paul to Titus
text: which he poured out upon us richly through Jesus Christ our Saviour,

name: Paul to Titus
text: that having been justified by his grace, we might become heirs according to the hope of life eternal.

name: Paul to Titus
text: Faithful is the saying, and concerning these things I will that thou affirm strongly, in order that those that believe in God may be careful to practice good works. These things are honorable and profitable for men;

name: Paul to Titus
text: but foolish questions, and genealogies, and strifes, and contentions about law, reject; for they are unprofitable and fruitless.

name: Paul to Titus
text: An heretical man, after the first and second admonition, reject,

name: Paul to Titus
text: knowing that such a man is perverted, and sins, being self- condemned.

name: Paul to Titus
text: When I shall send Artemas to thee, or Tychicus, be diligent to come to me to Nicopolis: for there have I determined to winter.

name: Paul to Titus
text: Zenas, the lawyer, and Apollos send forward diligently, that nothing be wanting to them.

name: Paul to Titus
text: But let ours also learn to practice honorable works for necessary uses, that they be not unfruitful.

name: Paul to Titus
text: All that are with me salute thee. Salute those that love us in the faith.
